birth_date = {{birth date and age|1989|12|3|df=y}}<ref name=Hugman1011>{{cite book |editor-first=Barry J. |editor-last=Hugman |title=The PFA Footballers' Who's Who 2010–11 |year=2010 | caps1 = 70 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2007 | clubs2 = → [[Woking F.C.|Woking]] (loan) | caps2 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2008 | clubs3 = → [[Cambridge United F.C.|Cambridge United]] (loan) | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2008 | clubs4 = → [[Team Bath F.C.|Team Bath]] (loan) | caps4 = 2 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2009 | clubs5 = → [[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]] (loan) | caps5 = 4 | goals5 = 0 | years6 = 2009–2010 | clubs6 = → [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] (loan) | caps6 = 44 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2010 | clubs7 = → [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] (loan) | caps7 = 3 | goals7 = 0 | years8 = 2011–2012 | clubs8 = → [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] (loan) | caps8 = 6 | goals8 = 0 | years9 = 2012 | clubs9 = → [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] (loan) | caps9 = 10 | goals9 = 0 | years10 = 2014–2015 | clubs10 = [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] | caps10 = 3 | goals10 = 0 | years11 = 2015–2016 | clubs11 = [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] | caps11 = 7 | goals11 = 0 | years12 = 2016– | clubs12 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps12 = 43 | goals12 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2010–2011 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2018– | nationalteam2 = [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 12:06, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 08:48, 3 February 2019 (UTC) }} '''Alex Simon McCarthy''' (born 3 December 1989) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for {{English football updater|Southamp}} club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and the [[England national football team|England national team]].
A product of Reading's [[Reading F.C. Under-21s and Academy|Academy]], McCarthy spent time out on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] in the [[National League (division)|Conference Premier]] before signing professional terms with the club in 2008. He made his [[The Football League|Football League]] debut in 2009 whilst on loan to [[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]] and spent the following season at [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil Town]] before making his Reading debut in 2011. He has since spent time on loan at [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] and [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]]. McCarthy left for [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] in 2014.
At international level McCarthy has represented England and made his debut for the [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] team in 2010, appearing three times in total. In November 2018, he made his debut for the senior team.
==Club career== ===Early career=== Born in [[Guildford]], Surrey,<ref name=Hugman1011/> McCarthy began his career as a schoolboy at [[Wimbledon F.C.|Wimbledon]] and [[Wycombe Wanderers F.C.|Wycombe Wanderers]] before joining [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on a scholarship at 16.{{citation needed|date=October 2016}} He was a regular in the [[Reading F.C. Under-21s and Academy|Academy]] team for two years and was part of a group that included several future first-team players including [[Jem Karacan]], [[Alex Pearce]] and [[Gylfi Sigurðsson]].<ref name="Academy magic: Alex's story">{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/news/article/mccarthyblogengland-16-513-825451.aspx |title=Academy magic: Alex's story |publisher=Reading F.C. |accessdate=29 May 2013}}</ref> His first experience of senior football came in August 2007 on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] at [[Woking F.C.|Woking]] where he made one appearance cover for the injured [[Nick Gindre]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.wokingfc.co.uk/news/article/674/salisbury-city-2-woking-1/ |title=Salisbury City 2–1 Woking |publisher=Woking F.C. |accessdate=23 June 2013}}</ref> On 26 March 2008, he joined fellow [[National League (division)|Conference Premier]] team [[Cambridge United F.C.|Cambridge United]] on work experience,<ref>{{cite web |title=Reading Keeper Signs |url=http://www.cambridge-united.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10423~1274599,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111001142734/http://www.cambridge-united.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10423~1274599%2C00.html |archivedate=1 October 2011 |publisher=Cambridge United F.C. |date=26 March 2008 |accessdate=17 February 2009 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> making his debut two days later in a 3–0 defeat to [[Kidderminster Harriers F.C.|Kidderminster Harriers]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Cambridge 0–3 Kidderminster |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_conf/7309390.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 March 2008 |accessdate=17 February 2009}}</ref> He made no further appearances and returned to Reading before signing his first professional contract in July 2008.<ref name="Alex McCarthy profile">{{cite web |url=http://shop.theshots.co.uk/PlayerDisplay.ink?season=08/09&Playertype=p&squadno=7218 |title=Alex McCarthy profile |publisher=Aldershot Town F.C. |accessdate=23 June 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141227180249/http://shop.theshots.co.uk/PlayerDisplay.ink?season=08%2F09&Playertype=p&squadno=7218 |archivedate=27 December 2014 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> McCarthy moved on loan again on 24 October 2008, joining [[National League South|Conference South]] team [[Team Bath F.C.|Team Bath]] as injury cover.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Alex-McCarthy-comes-solve-Ged-Roddy-s-Bath-City-keeper-crisis/story-11266264-detail/story.html |title=Alex McCarthy comes in to solve Ged Roddy's Bath City keeper crisis |newspaper=The Post |location=Bristol |accessdate=23 June 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130624234446/http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Alex-McCarthy-comes-solve-Ged-Roddy-s-Bath-City-keeper-crisis/story-11266264-detail/story.html |archivedate=24 June 2013 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his debut the next day in the [[FA Cup]] fourth qualifying round against [[Salisbury City F.C.|Salisbury City]]<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/need-twelfth-man-says-Team-Bath-boss-Ged-Roddy/story-11266874-detail/story.html |title='We need a twelfth man' says Team Bath boss Ged Roddy |newspaper=The Post |location=Bristol |accessdate=23 June 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130624234444/http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/need-twelfth-man-says-Team-Bath-boss-Ged-Roddy/story-11266874-detail/story.html |archivedate=24 June 2013 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> and also played in the first round defeat to [[Forest Green Rovers F.C.|Forest Green Rovers]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Team-Bath-dumped-FA-Cup/story-11233104-detail/story.html |title=Team Bath dumped out of the FA Cup |newspaper=The Post |location=Bristol |accessdate=23 June 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120913064646/http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/Team-Bath-dumped-FA-Cup/story-11233104-detail/story.html |archivedate=13 September 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> making four appearances in total.<ref name="Alex McCarthy profile"/> Another short loan spell followed with McCarthy joining [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Aldershot Town F.C.|Aldershot Town]] for one month on 2 February 2009.<ref>{{cite news |title=Aldershot secure double signing |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aldershot/7865708.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 February 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090206185200/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/a/aldershot/7865708.stm |archivedate=6 February 2009}}</ref> He made his [[The Football League|Football League]] debut 12 days later in a 3–2 defeat to [[Exeter City F.C.|Exeter City]]<ref>{{cite news |title=Exeter 3–2 Aldershot |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/7876773.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 February 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090216162154/http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_3/7876773.stm |archivedate=16 February 2009}}</ref> and played three further matches before returning to Reading at the beginning of March.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.gethampshire.co.uk/sport/football/news/shots-set-battle-bantams-5351746 |last=Oliver |first=Charlie |date=6 March 2009 |title=Shots set for battle with Bantams |newspaper=Aldershot News & Mail |accessdate=23 June 2013 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160127040342/http://www.gethampshire.co.uk/sport/football/news/shots-set-battle-bantams-5351746 |archive-date=27 January 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref name=sb0809/>
At the start of the 2009–10 season McCarthy joined [[EFL League One|League One]] club [[Yeovil Town F.C.|Yeovil]] on an initial six-month loan<ref>{{cite news |title=Yeovil take Royals keeper on loan |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/y/yeovil/8167029.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 July 2009}}</ref> and made his debut on 8 August in a 2–0 home win over [[Tranmere Rovers F.C.|Tranmere Rovers]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/8186304.stm |title=Yeovil Town 2–0 Tranmere Rovers |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=24 June 2013}}</ref> A month later he received the first sending-off of his career after fouling [[Stockport County F.C.|Stockport County's]] [[Nicholas Bignall]], who was also on loan from Reading.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/8246615.stm |title=Yeovil Town 2–2 Stockport County |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=24 June 2013}}</ref> McCarthy's loan spell was renewed in January 2010 and again in February, before being extended for the rest of the season on 24 March.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/y/yeovil/8586085.stm |title=Reading keeper Alex McCarthy agrees Yeovil extension |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=24 June 2013}}</ref> Over the course of his spell he played 44 league matches and kept all 12 of Yeovil's clean sheets.<ref name="Academy magic: Alex's story"/> Following his successful loan, McCarthy was given a new three-year contract at Reading, keeping him with the club until 2013.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/reading/8898828.stm |title=Alex McCarthy agrees new Reading contract |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=24 June 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/6303253/ |title=McCarthy pens Royals deal |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=24 June 2013}}</ref> He again departed on loan in August 2010, joining [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]], though he remained there for just one month before being replaced by fellow Reading loanee [[Ben Hamer]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/b/brentford/8958474.stm |title=Brentford re-sign Reading goalkeeper Ben Hamer |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=24 June 2013}}</ref>
===Reading and various loan spells=== After returning from loan at Brentford in September 2010, McCarthy spent the next five months on the bench as cover for [[Adam Federici]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.soccerbase.com/teams/team.sd?team_id=2125&teamTabs=results&season_id=140 |title=2010–11 results |work=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=7 July 2013}}</ref> He eventually made his Reading debut on 19 February 2011, coming on as a substitute for the injured Federici in the 84th minute against [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] and helping to secure a 1–1 draw.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0,,10306~53011,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110224024419/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/MatchReport/0%2C%2C10306~53011%2C00.html |archivedate=24 February 2011 |title=Report: Royals held by Hornets |publisher=Reading F.C. |accessdate=7 July 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> With Federici out for six weeks with knee ligament damage, McCarthy had a run in the team and made his full debut three days later in a 2–1 win over [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.readingchronicle.co.uk/sport/readingfc/articles/2011/02/25/50799-impressive-mccarthy-aiming-to-keep-jersey/ |last=Smith |first=Anthony |date=25 February 2011 |title=Impressive McCarthy aiming to keep jersey |newspaper=Reading Chronicle |accessdate=7 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~2300239,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110224230330/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10306~2300239%2C00.html |archivedate=24 February 2011 |title=McCarthy: "I thrive on the pressure" |publisher=Reading F.C. |date=23 February 2011 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> In his next outing he saved a penalty against [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] as Reading twice came from behind to draw the match 3–3.<ref>{{cite web |title=Report: Royals fight for 3–3 draw |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~2303108,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110302023812/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10306~2303108%2C00.html |archivedate=2 March 2011 |publisher=Reading F.C. |date=26 February 2011 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He also played an important role in the 1–0 FA Cup fifth round win over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], producing a late save to deny [[Leon Osman]] in a performance described as "tremendous" by former England manager [[Kevin Keegan]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Keegan hails "tremendous" McCarthy |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~2305928,00.html |publisher=Reading F.C. |date=2 March 2011 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110305235658/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10306~2305928%2C00.html |archivedate=5 March 2011 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> Despite another strong display in the next round against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] at [[City of Manchester Stadium|Eastlands]], Reading lost the match 1–0 to a [[Micah Richards]] header.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/fa_cup/9421251.stm |title=Manchester City 1–0 Reading |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=7 July 2013}}</ref> He continued in goal until 30 April when he was displaced by a fit again Federici for the 0–0 draw at [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]]<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.getreading.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/boss-tells-reading-fc-stars-4215008 |title=Boss tells Reading FC stars to party after securing play-offs |newspaper=Reading Post |accessdate=7 July 2013}}</ref> and remained an unused substitute during Reading's play-off campaign.<ref name=sb1011/>
With Federici remaining the first choice Reading goalkeeper for the 2011–12 season, McCarthy was loaned to [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] for a month on 4 November to gain [[EFL Championship|Championship]] experience.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15571443.stm |title=Leeds United agree loan deal for keeper Alex McCarthy |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 November 2011}}</ref> An injury to [[Andy Lonergan]] and the indifferent form of [[Paul Rachubka]] saw him go straight into the team for the match against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com.p.preprod.performgroup.com/news/20111104/mccarthy-starts-odea-set-to-miss-out_2247585_2506041 |title=McCarthy Starts, O'Dea set to miss out |publisher=Leeds United A.F.C. |date=4 November 2011 |access-date=29 October 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160127040342/http://www.leedsunited.com.p.preprod.performgroup.com/news/20111104/mccarthy-starts-odea-set-to-miss-out_2247585_2506041 |archive-date=27 January 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> He kept a clean sheet on debut as the match ended in a 1–0 win.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/match-report/match/1119816 |title=Clayton stunner secures points |publisher=Leeds United A.F.C. |date=6 November 2011}}</ref> Further clean sheets against [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] and Millwall followed and were enough to keep him in the team ahead of the returning Lonergan.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/match-report/match/1119849 |title=United romp to emotional success |publisher=Leeds United A.F.C. |date=29 November 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/news/article/kwp76q3aoeio17p73e6u73hz4/title/united-win-it-for-speedo |title=Leeds United 2–0 Millwall |publisher=Leeds United A.F.C. |date=3 December 2011}}</ref> In the last match of his initial spell he saved an injury time penalty against Watford, allowing Leeds to rescue a point with a last minute equaliser.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com/match-report/match/1119876 |title=Snoddy spot-kick snatches point |publisher=Leeds United A.F.C. |date=10 December 2011}}</ref> Following the match, he revealed that he was keen on extending his loan at Leeds, with Reading agreeing to renew it for a second month two days later.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds_united_i_d_like_to_stay_on_mccarthy_interview_1_4052464 |last=Hay |first=Phil |date=12 December 2011 |title=Leeds United: I'd like to stay on – McCarthy |newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post |accessdate=9 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.yorkshireeveningpost.co.uk/sport/leeds-united/latest-whites-news/leeds_united_mccarthy_loan_extended_1_4053154 |title=Leeds United: McCarthy loan extended |newspaper=Yorkshire Evening Post |date=12 December 2011}}</ref> Ineligible to face his parent club on 17 December, he was replaced by Lonergan and made no further appearances,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com.p.preprod.performgroup.com/news/20111219/lonners-steeling-himself-for-fight_2247585_2552261 |title=Lonners steeling himself for fight |publisher=Leeds United A.F.C. |date=19 December 2011 |access-date=29 October 2015 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160127040342/http://www.leedsunited.com.p.preprod.performgroup.com/news/20111219/lonners-steeling-himself-for-fight_2247585_2552261 |archive-date=27 January 2016 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> returning to Reading on 3 January 2012.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.leedsunited.com.p.preprod.performgroup.com/news/20120103/loan-duo-return-to-clubs_2247585_2564698 |title=Keogh and McCarthy head away from Elland Road |publisher=Leeds United A.F.C. |date=3 January 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160127040342/http://www.leedsunited.com.p.preprod.performgroup.com/news/20120103/loan-duo-return-to-clubs_2247585_2564698 |archivedate=27 January 2016 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> He signed a new three-year contract with Reading on 9 January before joining [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]] on loan until the end of the season.<ref name="McCarthy signs new Reading FC deal and joins Ipswich Town on loan">{{cite news |url=http://www.getreading.co.uk/sport/football/readingfc/s/2106033_mccarthy_signs_new_reading_fc_deal_and_joins_ipswich_town_on_loan |title=McCarthy signs new Reading FC deal and joins Ipswich Town on loan |newspaper=Reading Post |accessdate=10 July 2013 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120226155158/http://www.getreading.co.uk/sport/football/readingfc/s/2106033_mccarthy_signs_new_reading_fc_deal_and_joins_ipswich_town_on_loan |archivedate=26 February 2012 |deadurl=yes}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11707/7418981/Ipswich-seal-keeper-deal |title=Ipswich seal keeper deal |publisher=Sky Sports |date=8 January 2012}}</ref> On his return to [[Elland Road]] with Ipswich he was sent off for handling the ball outside the penalty area with 20 minutes remaining. Ipswich, one goal up at the time, went on to lose the match 3–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16559231 |title=Leeds United 3–1 Ipswich Town |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=10 July 2013}}</ref> After 10 appearances, all coming in the league, he returned to Reading at the end of the season.<ref name=sb1112/>
====2012–13 season==== [[File:Alex McCarthy 1.png|thumb|upright|McCarthy playing for [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] in 2013]]
Again starting the season as second choice goalkeeper, several mistakes and an injury meant McCarthy replaced Adam Federici for the 3–1 defeat by [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 16 September 2012.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.express.co.uk/posts/view/346883/Reading-boss-Brian-McDermott-says-keeper-Adam-Federici-dropped-for-poor-form |title=Reading boss Brian McDermott says keeper Adam Federici dropped for poor form |newspaper=Daily Express |accessdate=18 December 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19491534 |title=Reading 1–3 Tottenham Hotspur |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=18 December 2012}}</ref> After debuting in the [[Premier League]], he achieved the feat of playing in the [[English football league system|six top levels of English football]] at the age of 22.{{citation needed|date=October 2016}} He retained his place in the team for the next few matches and put in an impressive performance against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] on 6 October leading to suggestions of a senior [[England national football team|England]] call up in the future.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/reading/9592680/Reading-goalkeeper-Alex-McCarthy-shows-he-has-England-potential-as-Swansea-are-denied-victory.html |last=Clutton |first=Graham |date=7 October 2012 |title=Reading goalkeeper Alex McCarthy shows he has England potential as Swansea are denied victory |newspaper=The Telegraph |accessdate=18 December 2012}}</ref> His good form continued with a man of the match performance in Reading's next match against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]], firstly tipping [[Esteban Granero]]'s free-kick onto the crossbar before saving from [[Adel Taarabt]] at close range.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://goalkeepermagazine.com/goalkeeper-news/impressive-alex-mccarthy-widely-praised/ |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130317220544/http://goalkeepermagazine.com/goalkeeper-news/impressive-alex-mccarthy-widely-praised/ |archivedate=17 March 2013 |title=Impressive Alex McCarthy widely praised |work=Goalkeeper Magazine |accessdate=18 December 2012}}</ref> The match ended badly though as he injured himself colliding with the goal post after diving to stop a Taarabt shot.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.getreading.co.uk/sport/football/readingfc/s/2123625_mccarthy_in_doubt_for_norwich_city_clash |title=McCarthy in doubt for Norwich City clash |newspaper=Reading Post |accessdate=18 December 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121110151917/http://www.getreading.co.uk/sport/football/readingfc/s/2123625_mccarthy_in_doubt_for_norwich_city_clash |archivedate=10 November 2012 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> Despite initial hopes the injury was not too serious, he was forced to undergo shoulder surgery in early December potentially ruling him out for remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/news/article/alex-op-061212-528369.aspx |title=McCarthy op a success |publisher=Reading F.C. |accessdate=18 December 2012}}</ref> He recovered quicker than expected though and returned to the team on 13 April 2013, keeping a clean sheet in a 0–0 draw with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/news/article/liverpool-report-769301.aspx |title=Scintillating stalemate |publisher=Reading F.C. |accessdate=14 July 2013}}</ref> After making ten saves during the match, he was widely praised with his performance described as "fantastic" by [[Nigel Adkins]] and "absolutely staggering" by Liverpool manager [[Brendan Rodgers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/news/article/adkins-post-pool-130413-769820.aspx |title=Boss on 'world-class' Alex |publisher=Reading F.C. |accessdate=14 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22139618 |title=Liverpool boss Brendan Rodgers hails 'staggering' Alex McCarthy |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=14 July 2013}}</ref> He remained in goal for the rest of the season, making 14 appearances in total.<ref name=sb1213/>
===Queens Park Rangers=== On 29 August 2014, McCarthy joined newly promoted [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] in the Premier League for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11711/9446908/transfer-news-qpr-sign-goalkeeper-alex-mccarthy-from-reading |title=Transfer news: QPR sign goalkeeper Alex McCarthy from Reading |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=29 August 2014}}</ref> McCarthy made his Rangers debut at home against Liverpool in a blockbuster narrow 3–2 defeat.<ref>{{cite news |title=QPR 2–3 Liverpool |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29586620 |accessdate=5 December 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 October 2014}}</ref>
===Crystal Palace=== On 23 July 2015, McCarthy joined Premier League club Crystal Palace for an undisclosed fee, reported to be £3.5 million, on a four-year contract.<ref>{{cite news |title=Alex McCarthy: Goalkeeper moves from QPR to Crystal Palace |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33644447 |accessdate=22 July 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> McCarthy made his Palace debut on 8 August 2015 in a 3–1 win away to [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Report: Norwich City 1–3 Crystal Palace |url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2015/august/report-norwich-city-1-3-crystal-palace/ |date=8 August 2015 |publisher=Crystal Palace F.C. |accessdate=10 August 2015}}</ref>
===Southampton=== On 1 August 2016, he joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on a three-year contract, for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite news |title=Alex McCarthy: Southampton sign Crystal Palace goalkeeper |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36945414 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=1 August 2016 |date=1 August 2016}}</ref>
McCarthy was initially used as back-up to regular keeper, [[Fraser Forster]], but on 30 December 2017 he took over from the latter, following the regular goalkeeper's drop in form.<ref>{{cite news |last=Crook |first=Alex |title=Southampton keeper Alex McCarthy sends warning to Fraser Forster and Crystal Palace |url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/898885/Southampton-Crystal-Palace-Alex-McCarthy-Fraser-Forster-Premier-League-news |accessdate=7 February 2018 |newspaper=Daily Express |date=1 January 2018}}</ref>
On 27 June 2018, McCarthy signed a new four-year contract with the club, keeping him on their books until 2020, and making him one of their highest earning players, reflecting his status as first-choice keeper.<ref>{{cite web |title=McCarthy pens new four-year deal |url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2018-06-27/alex-mccarthy-new-southampton-four-year-contract-announcement |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=2 July 2018 |date=27 June 2018}}</ref>
==International career== McCarthy trained with the England [[England national under-19 football team|under-19s]] before joining the [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] set-up for the first time in September 2009.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ytfc.net/page/FirstTeam/0,,10673,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090830014305/http://www.ytfc.net/page/FirstTeam/0%2C%2C10673%2C00.html |archivedate=30 August 2009 |title=Alex McCarthy profile |publisher=Yeovil Town F.C. |accessdate=20 July 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~1791568,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20090911081209/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10306~1791568%2C00.html |archivedate=11 September 2009 |title=McCarthy backs up U21 draw |publisher=Reading F.C. |accessdate=20 July 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He received several further call-ups to the under-21s in 2009–10 and eventually made his debut as a second-half substitute against Uzbekistan in August 2010.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ciderspace.co.uk/ASP/news/news.asp?NewsItemId=10513 |title=McCarthy gets England under-21s call-up for Macedonia clash |publisher=Ciderspace |date=4 October 2009 |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ciderspace.co.uk/ASP/news/news.asp?NewsItemId=10795 |title=McCarthy gets England call-up for Wembley fixture |publisher=Ciderspace |date=4 November 2009 |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ciderspace.co.uk/ASP/news/news.asp?NewsItemId=11729 |title=McCarthy gets England call-up for Greece visit |publisher=Ciderspace |date=24 February 2010 |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/8902828.stm |title=England U21 2–0 Uzbekistan U21 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 August 2010 |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref> In March 2011 he was named in a 31-man squad to face [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark]] and [[Iceland national under-21 football team|Iceland]] as preparation for the [[UEFA European Under-21 Championship]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-under-21s/News/2011/Squad-Den-Ice |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130104222409/http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-under-21s/News/2011/Squad-Den-Ice |dead-url=yes |archivedate=4 January 2013 |title=Pearce picks big squad |publisher=The Football Association |date=15 March 2011}}</ref> He played a full 90 minutes in the first match and 45 in the second as England won 4–0 and lost 2–1 respectively.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~2323751,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110427143445/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10306~2323751%2C00.html |archivedate=27 April 2011 |title=Joy for McCarthy on U21s debut |publisher=Reading F.C. |accessdate=20 July 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-1370978/England-U21-1-Iceland-U21-2-Stuart-Pearce-lets-rip-defeat-proves-point.html |last=King |first=Dominic |date=29 March 2011 |title=Stuart Pearce lets rip after defeat proves a point |newspaper=Daily Mail |accessdate=20 July 2013}}{{Unreliable source?|date=June 2017}}</ref> He travelled with the squad to championships in Denmark but did not play any matches, finishing with three caps at under-21 level.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-under-21s/News/2011/england-under-21s-squad-euro |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120527053045/http://www.thefa.com/England/mens-under-21s/News/2011/england-under-21s-squad-euro |dead-url=yes |archivedate=27 May 2012 |title=Pearce names squad for Euro 2011 |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/All-Teams/Players/M/Alex-Mc-Carthy |title=Alex McCarthy profile |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref>
In April 2012, McCarthy was named in the 80-man longlist of potential players for the [[Great Britain Olympic football team|Great Britain football team]] at the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Summer Olympics]],<ref name = shortlist/> and in June, he made it down to the shortlist of 35 players provisionally selected for the tournament,<ref name=shortlist>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~2803664,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120615181315/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10306~2803664%2C00.html |archivedate=15 June 2012 |title=McCarthy makes latest Olympic cut |publisher=Reading F.C. |date=14 June 2012 |accessdate=20 July 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> although he did not make the final 18.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.getreading.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/alex-mccarthy-missed-out-gb-4198702 |title=Alex McCarthy missed out of GB Olympic squad |newspaper=Reading Post |date=2 July 2012 |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref>
In May 2013 he was called up to the England [[England national football team|senior]] team for the [[Exhibition game#Association football|friendlies]] against [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] and [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]],<ref>{{cite web |title=Roy calls on McCarthy |url=http://www.thefa.com/england/News/2013/england-squad-ireland-brazil |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130630101544/http://www.thefa.com/england/News/2013/england-squad-ireland-brazil |dead-url=yes |archivedate=30 June 2013 |publisher=The Football Association |accessdate=16 May 2013}}</ref> becoming the first Reading [[Reading F.C. Under-21s and Academy|youth team]] graduate to gain a full England call-up since the Academy era began in 1998,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/news/article/mccarthy-called-up-160513-825007.aspx |title=McCarthy in England squad |publisher=Reading F.C. |date=16 May 2013 |accessdate=20 July 2013}}</ref> although he did not make an appearance.{{citation needed|date=October 2016}} On 1 September 2016, he was called up to the senior squad again by [[Sam Allardyce]] to replace the injured [[Fraser Forster]] for a [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] qualifier against [[Slovakia national football team|Slovakia]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37243639 |title=England keeper Fraser Forster replaced by Southampton team-mate Alex McCarthy |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=1 September 2016}}</ref>
In August 2018, McCarthy was called up for England's first squad since the 2018 World Cup, for matches against [[Spain national football team|Spain]] and [[Switzerland national football team|Switzerland]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Luke Shaw: Manchester United defender included in England 23-man squad |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45357041 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 August 2018 |date=30 August 2018}}</ref> He made his debut on 15 November as a half-time substitute in England's 3–0 win over the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] at [[Wembley Stadium]] in a friendly, nearly five and a half years to the day after his first call-up.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45174412 |title=England 3–0 USA |first=Phil |last=McNulty |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 November 2018 |accessdate=15 November 2018}}</ref>

youthyears1 = 2001–2006 | youthclubs1 = [[Nagoya Grampus]] | years1 = 2007–2010 | clubs1 = [[Nagoya Grampus]] | caps1 = 71 | goals1 = 5 | years2 = 2010–2012 | clubs2 = [[VVV-Venlo]] | caps2 = 54 | (UTC) | ntupdate = 20:20, 1 February 2019 (UTC) }} {{nihongo|'''Maya Yoshida'''|吉田 麻也|Yoshida Maya|born 24 August 1988}} is a Japanese [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for {{English football updater|Southamp}} club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and the [[Japan national football team|Japan national team]]. Yoshida is also the captain of the Japanese national football team. ==Club career== ===Nagoya Grampus=== Born in [[Nagasaki]], Yoshida had been a defensive midfielder when playing for Grampus's youth team, but was converted to a centre back after promotion to its top team in 2007. In the 2008 season, he was in the starting lineup for most of the league matches with his Serbian teammate [[Miloš Bajalica]]. He scored [[Nagoya Grampus]]'s historical first goal in the [[AFC Champions League]] in the game against [[Ulsan Hyundai Horang-i]] on 10 March 2009.{{cite news |title=Ulsan Hyundai vs. Nagoya Grampus - Football Match Summary |url=http://www.espn.com/soccer/match?gameId=264652 |accessdate=23 December 2018 |work=ESPN}} ===VVV-Venlo=== In December 2009, it was announced that Yoshida had transferred to Dutch club [[VVV-Venlo]].[http://www.wsn.com/2009/12/28/football/news/asia/nagoyas-yoshida-to-join-venlo_26909/ Nagoya's Yoshida to join Venlo], wsn.com, 28 December 2009 {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20100102014453/http://www.wsn.com/2009/12/28/football/news/asia/nagoyas-yoshida-to-join-venlo_26909/ |date=2 January 2010 }} He had desired to play for a club in Europe since he was young. [[Keisuke Honda]] who was his teammate of [[Nagoya Grampus]] introduced his agent, [[Tetsuro Kiyooka]] to support his future vision.[http://www.japantimes.co.jp/sports/2014/04/03/soccer/venlo-chief-eyes-new-japanese-talent/ Venlo chief eyes new Japanese talent], The Japan Times, 3 April 2014 Indeed, Yoshida followed the footsteps of Keisuke Honda who also played for VVV-Venlo before he joined them.{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/11/transfer-zone/2009/12/29/1714116/japan-defender-maya-yoshida-leaves-nagoya-grampus-for-vvv |title=Japan Defender Maya Yoshida Leaves Nagoya Grampus For VVV Venlo |publisher=Goal.com |date=29 December 2009 |accessdate=15 July 2013 }} He scored a bicycle kick goal for VVV-Venlo off a corner kick on 11 September 2011 against [[PSV Eindhoven]]. The match ended in a 3–3 draw. This goal was awarded as "Goal of the Season 2011–2012" of the [[Eredivisie]]. In this season Maya Yoshida scored as a central defender 5 goals in total. ===Southampton=== On 30 August 2012, he agreed to join [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on a three-year contract for a fee thought to be in the region of £3 million.{{cite web|title=Japan's Yoshida Set For Saints|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/japans-yoshida-set-for-saints-343281.aspx |publisher=Southampton FC|date=30 August 2012|accessdate=30 August 2012}}{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19426865 |title=Southampton sign Maya Yoshida, Japan's Olympic captain|date=30 August 2012|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=1 September 2012}} He made his debut for the Saints on 15 September 2012, against Arsenal in a 6–1 defeat, coming on as a 28th-minute substitute for [[Jos Hooiveld]]. He then made his home debut a week later on 22 September 2012 in a 4–1 win over [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]], playing the whole 90 minutes. On 9 August 2013, it was announced that Yoshida would be on the front cover of the Japanese Edition of [[FIFA 14]].{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/saints-agree-partnership-with-ea-sports-979983.aspx|title=Saints agree partnership with EA SPORTS |publisher=Southampton FC |date= |accessdate=9 August 2013 }} He scored his first goal for Southampton in a 2–1 defeat to [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in the [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] on 6 November 2013.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24739094|title=Sunderland 2 – 1 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=6 November 2013 |accessdate=6 November 2013}} He scored his first Premier League goal in a 3–1 defeat at [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]] on 22 February 2014 after a [[Steven Davis]] free kick.{{cite web|last=Hassan|first=Nabil|title=West Ham 3 – 1 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26202718 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=21 March 2014|date=22 February 2014}} His next goal came on 20 December 2014, in a 3–0 victory over [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], with Steven Davis again providing the assist.{{cite web|last1=Cryer|first1=Andy|title=Southampton 3 – 0 Everton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30459790|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=31 December 2014|date=20 December 2014}} In January 2015 Southampton announced that Yoshida and the club had agreed terms to an extension of his contract until 2018.{{cite web|last1=Lucas|first1=Jim|title=Yoshida extends Saints deal until 2018|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/20150102-maya-yoshida-contract-2177890.aspx|website=Southampton FC|accessdate=8 January 2015}} On 28 October, he scored his first goal of the 2015–16 season with a 20-yard strike against [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in the League Cup.{{cite web|last1=Wilson|first1=Jeremy|title=Southampton 2 Aston Villa 1, match report: Maya Yoshida and Graziano Pelle goals end Villa's cup hopes |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/league-cup/11961167/Southampton-2-Aston-Villa-1-match-report-Maya-Yoshida-and-Graziano-Pelle-goals-end-Villas-cup-hopes.html|publisher=Daily Telegraph|accessdate=29 October 2015|date=28 October 2015}}{{cite web|last1=Prentki|first1=Tom|title=Southampton 2 – Aston Villa 1: Yoshida and Pelle goals sink managerless Villains|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/615433/Southampton-Aston-Villa-Capital-One-Cup-match-report-Maya-Yoshida-Graziano-Pelle|publisher=Daily Express|accessdate=29 October 2015|date=28 October 2015}} Yoshida's second goal of the season came on 6 February 2016 in a 1–0 victory at [[St Mary's Stadium|St. Mary's]] over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham]].{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Alan|title=Maya Yoshida celebrates as 10-man Southampton keep out West Ham|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/feb/06/southampton-west-ham-premier-league-match-report|accessdate=7 February 2016|publisher=The Observer|date=6 February 2016}} ==International career== Yoshida earned a call-up for Japan's U-23 team in April 2008 and was a member of the Japan team for the [[2008 Summer Olympic]] finals.{{cite web|publisher=Sports Reference|title=Maya Yoshida Biography and Statistics|url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/yo/maya-yoshida-1.html|accessdate=25 July 2009}} He made his full international debut for [[Japan national football team|Japan]] on 6 January 2010 in a [[2011 AFC Asian Cup]] qualifier against [[Yemen national football team|Yemen]]. Yoshida subsequently played in all three of the group-stage matches, the quarter-final and final for the winning Japan side in 2011 AFC Asian Cup. Yoshida was named as captain for the Japanese National Team at the [[2012 Summer Olympics]] in London. He also participated in Japan's 2014 World Cup qualifying campaign and participated in all of Japan's group stage games at the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil. Yoshida was selected as a member of the Japanese team for the [[2015 AFC Asian Cup]]. He played Japan's opener match against debutant [[Palestine national football team|Palestine]] and scored the final goal in a 4–0 win.{{cite web|title=Japan 4 Palestine 0|url=http://www.the-afc.com/afcasfeeds?fixtureid=8257&stageid=327&tMode=C&view=ajax&show=matchsummary|website=www.the-afc.com|accessdate=12 January 2015}} On 31 May 2018, Yoshida was selected in the 23-man squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/sports/2018/05/31/soccer/nishino-reveals-23-man-squad-world-cup|title=Nishino reveals 23-man squad for World Cup|publisher=The Japan Times|accessdate=7 July 2018}} He played every single minute in all the group stage matches against [[Colombia national football team|Colombia]],{{cite web |last1=Jennings |first1=Patrick |title=Colombia 1 Japan 2 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439048 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=7 July 2018 |location=Saransk |date=19 June 2018}} [[Senegal national football team|Senegal]]{{cite web |last1=Johnston |first1=Neil |title=Japan 2 Senegal 2 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439190 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=7 July 2018 |location=Ekaterinburg |date=24 June 2018}} and [[Poland national football team|Poland]].{{cite web |last1=Hafez |first1=Shamoon |title=Japan 0 Poland 1 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44439298 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=7 July 2018 |location=Volgograd |date=28 June 2018}} His side were knocked out of the tournament after losing 3–2 to [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]] in the round of 16 match.{{cite web |last1=Begley |first1=Emlyn |title=Belgium 3 Japan 2 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44597759 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=7 July 2018 |location=Rostov-on-Don |date=2 July 2018}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|27 February 2019}}[http://aus.worldfootball.net/spieler_profil/maya-yoshida/2/ Maya {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2018}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Jannik Vestergaard |image = Jannik-Vestergaard-Training-Bremen (cropped).jpg |image_size = |caption = Vestergaard training with [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in 2015 |fullname = Jannik Vestergaard<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/844127 |title=2018/19 Premier League squads confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=3 September 2018 |accessdate=4 September 2018}}</ref> |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1992|8|3|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Hvidovre]], Denmark |height = 1.99 m<ref>{{cite web |url=https://southamptonfc.com/first-team/jannik-vestergaard |title=Jannik Vestergaard |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=11 February 2019}}</ref> |position = [[Centre back]] |currentclub = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] |clubnumber = 4 |youthyears1 = |youthclubs1 = Vestia |youthyears2 = |youthclubs2 = [[Boldklubben Frem|Frem]] |youthyears3 = |youthclubs3 = [[F.C. Copenhagen|Copenhagen]] |youthyears4 = |youthclubs4 = [[Brøndby IF|Brøndby]] |years1 = 2010–2011 |clubs1 = [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim II|1899 Hoffenheim II]] |caps1 = 22 |goals1 = 4 |years2 = 2011–2015 |clubs2 = [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] |caps2 = 71 |goals2 = 4 |years3 = 2015–2016 |clubs3 = [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] |caps3 = 48 |goals3 = 3 |years4 = 2016–2018 |clubs4 = [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] |caps4 = 66 |goals4 = 7 |years5 = 2018– |clubs5 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] |caps5 = 21 |goals5 = 0 |nationalyears1 = 2010 |nationalteam1 = [[Denmark national under-18 football team|Denmark U18]] |nationalcaps1 = 4 |nationalgoals1 = 1 |nationalyears2 = 2010–2011 |nationalteam2 = [[Denmark national under-19 football team|Denmark U19]] |nationalcaps2 = 7 |nationalgoals2 = 0 |nationalyears3 = 2011 |nationalteam3 = [[Denmark national under-20 football team|Denmark U20]] |nationalcaps3 = 2 |nationalgoals3 = 0 |nationalyears4 = 2011–2015 |nationalteam4 = [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark U21]] |nationalcaps4 = 28 |nationalgoals4 = 4 |nationalyears5 = 2013– |nationalteam5 = [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] |nationalcaps5 = 16 |nationalgoals5 = 1 |club-update = 09:22, 11 March 2019 (UTC) |ntupdate = 16 June 2018 }} '''Jannik Vestergaard''' (born 3 August 1992) is a Danish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for English club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], and for the [[Denmark national football team|Danish national team]].
==Early and personal life== Vestergaard was born to a Danish father and a German mother in the Copenhagen suburb of [[Hvidovre]] and grew up in Copenhagen.<ref name="vestergaard">{{cite web |title=JANNIK VESTERGAARD: DER LANGE|trans-title= |periodical=Achtzehn99 |publisher= |url=http://www.achtzehn99.de/newsarchiv-2/newsarchiv-2011/jannik-vestergaard-der-lange/ |deadurl=yes |format= |accessdate=27 April 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160427174126/http://www.achtzehn99.de/newsarchiv-2/newsarchiv-2011/jannik-vestergaard-der-lange/ |archivedate=2016-04-27 |last=TSG 1899 Hoffenheim Fußball-Spielbetriebs GmbH (Hrsg.) |date=30 March 2011 |year= |month= |day= |language=German |pages= |quote=}}</ref>
His German grandfather Hannes Schröers and uncle Jan Schröers also were footballers for [[Fortuna Düsseldorf]] and [[Bayer 05 Uerdingen]] respectively.<ref name="vestergaard"/> His cousin Mika Schröers plays for [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]]'s youth teams.<ref name="borussia">{{Cite web |url=http://www.borussia.de/de/aktuelles-termine/news/borussia-news/news-detailansicht.html?tx_ttnews[tt_news]=17808&cHash=636fa09509ea574c321108e6d377f224 |title=Borussia verpflichtet Jannik Vestergaard |author=Borussia VfL 1900 Mönchengladbach GmbH (publisher) |website=Borussia Mönchengladbach |date=11 June 2016 |accessdate=12 June 2016 |language=de}}</ref><ref name="borussiaen">{{Cite web |url=http://www.borussia.de/english/team/news/borussia-news/news-detailansicht.html?tx_ttnews[tt_news]=17814&cHash=e51b4ec4a1d4a076017c69c8510ad8dd |title=Borussia sign Jannik Vestergaard |author=Borussia VfL 1900 Mönchengladbach GmbH (publisher) |website=Borussia Mönchengladbach |date=11 June 2016 |accessdate=12 June 2016}}</ref>
He has a girlfriend called Pernille and a dog called Brady.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bundesliga.com/en/news/Bundesliga/jannik-vestergaard-ten-things-on-gladbach-s-great-dane-defender-467867.jsp |date=9 July 2018 |publisher=Bundesliga |title=Jannik Vestergaard: 10 things on the Borussia Mönchengladbach and Denmark star |accessdate=10 September 2018}}</ref>
==Club career== Vestergaard played youth football with Vestia, [[Boldklubben Frem|Frem]], [[F.C. Copenhagen|Copenhagen]] and [[Brøndby IF|Brøndby]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.tipsbladet.dk/artikel/jeg-har-aldrig-kunne-lide-tabe |title="Jeg har aldrig kunne lide at tabe" |website=Tipsbladet.dk}}</ref><ref name="DBU"/> He began his senior career with German club [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim]].<ref name="NFT">{{NFT player|pid=53370|accessdate=1 February 2015}}</ref><ref>{{fussballdaten|id=vestergaardjannik|name=Jannik Vestergaard}}</ref> He moved to [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]] in January 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2014/0000311773.php |title=Vestergaard joins Bremen from Hoffenheim |date=27 January 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2015 |publisher=Bundesliga|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150131062542/http://www.bundesliga.com/en/liga/news/2014/0000311773.php|archive-date=31 January 2015|dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://int.soccerway.com/news/2015/January/27/bremen-land-vestergaard/n537113/ |title=Bremen land Vestergaard |date=27 January 2015 |accessdate=1 February 2015 |publisher=Soccerway}}</ref>
On 11 June 2016, Vestergaard joined [[Borussia Mönchengladbach]] for a reported transfer of €12 million plus bonuses.<ref name="borussia"/><ref name="borussiaen"/><ref>{{cite news |title="Gute Lösung" mit Vestergaard |url=http://www.kreiszeitung.de/werder-bremen/werder-bremen-gute-loesung-vestergaard-gladbach-wechsel-bringt-zwoelf-millionen-euro-6479166.html |accessdate=26 September 2016 |work=Kreiszeitung |date=10 June 2016 |language=German}}</ref>
He moved to English club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 13 July 2018, signing a four-year contract.<ref>{{cite web |title=Saints seal Vestergaard deal |url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2018-07-13/announcement-jannik-vestergaard-transfer-southampton-borussia-mochengladbach |publisher=Southampton FC |accessdate=13 July 2018 |date=13 July 2018}}</ref><ref name = "BBC">{{cite web |title=Jannik Vestergaard: Southampton sign centre-back from Borussia Monchengladbach |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44821140 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=13 July 2018 |date=13 July 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Vestergaard represented the Denmark national youth teams at [[Denmark national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[Denmark national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[Denmark national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[Denmark national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels.<ref name="DBU">{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/landshold/Landsholdsdatabasen/LBasePlayerInfo.aspx?playerid=6829 |title=Profile |accessdate=1 February 2015 |language=Danish |publisher=DBU}}</ref> He received his first call-up to the [[Denmark national football team|Denmark senior team]] in August 2013, describing it as his "dream" to play for the country,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bold.dk/nyt/Jannik-V-Droemmen-har-altid-vaeret-Danmark |title=Jannik V: Drømmen har altid været Danmark |date=12 August 2013 |accessdate=1 February 2015 |language=Danish |publisher=Bold}}</ref> and he made his debut later that month in a match against [[Poland national football team|Poland]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.dbu.dk/Nyheder/2013/August/nederlag_til_polen.aspx |title=Målrigt opgør endte med dansk nederlag |date=14 August 2013 |accessdate=1 February 2015 |author=Jan Vinberg Eliassen |language=Danish |publisher=DBU}}</ref> His first goal for Denmark came in his first competitive game, against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]] in the [[European Championship]] play-off return leg on 17 November 2015.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.borussia.de/english/team/news/borussia-news/news-detailansicht.html?tx_ttnews%5Btt_news%5D=17814&cHash=e51b4ec4a1d4a076017c69c8510ad8dd |title=Borussia sign Jannik Vestergaard - Borussia Mönchengladbach |website=Borussia.de |accessdate=10 July 2018}}</ref>
He represented the Denmark U21 team at the [[2015 UEFA European Under-21 Championship]] in the Czech Republic, and scored in a 2–1 defeat of [[Czech Republic national under-21 football team|the host nation]] in the opening match at the [[Eden Arena]] in [[Prague]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/matches/round=2000408/match=2015370/postmatch/report/index.html |title=Czech Republic 1–2 Denmark |date=17 June 2015 |work=UEFA}}</ref>
He was also eligible to represent [[Germany national football team|Germany]] through his German mother.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://sporten.tv2.dk/2013-05-28-dansk-stortalent-føler-sig-mere-og-mere-tysk |title=Dansk stortalent føler sig mere og mere tysk |date=28 May 2013 |accessdate=1 February 2015 |author=Lars Bruun-Mortensen |language=Danish |publisher=TV2}}</ref>
Vestergaard was a member of Denmark's squad at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]] in Russia,<ref name = "FIFA">{{cite web |url=https://tournament.fifadata.com/documents/FWC/2018/pdf/FWC_2018_SQUADLISTS.PDF |title=2018 FIFA World Cup: List of players |publisher=FIFA |format=PDF |page=8 |date=18 June 2018}}</ref> but did not make any appearances in the tournament.<ref name = "BBC"/>
==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 9 March 2019}}<ref>{{soccerway|jannik-vestergaard/143213|accessdate=12 August 2018}}</ref>
