{{Use dmy dates|date=June 2013}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Mario Lemina | image = FC Lorient - january 3rd 2013 training - Mario Lemina.JPG | image_size = 250 | fullname = Mario René Junior Lemina{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=15 February 2018}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|09|1|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Libreville]], Gabon | height = 1.84 m{{cite web|title=Mario Lemina: Biography|url=https://southamptonfc.com/first-team/mario-lemina|publisher=Southampton F.C.|accessdate=10 August 2017|date=9 August 2017}} | position = [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|Central midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | clubnumber = 18 | youthyears1 = 2005–2013 | youthclubs1 = [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] | years1 = 2012–2013 | clubs1 = [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] | caps1 = 14 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2013–2015 | clubs2 = [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]] | caps2 = 41 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2015–2017 | clubs3 = [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] | caps3 = 29 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2017– | clubs4 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps4 = 43 | goals4 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[France national under-20 football team|France U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 6 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013 | nationalteam2 = [[France national under-21 football team|France U21]] | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2015– | nationalteam3 = [[Gabon national football team|Gabon]] | nationalcaps3 = 11 | nationalgoals3 = 3 | club-update = 12:43, 30 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 5 September 2017 }} '''Mario René Junior Lemina''' ({{IPA-fr|maʁjo ləmina}}; born 1 September 1993) is a Gabonese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|central midfielder]] for English club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and the [[Gabon national football team|Gabon national team]]. He played for French sides [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] and [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]], before joining Italian side [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] in 2015, where he won the [[Double (association football)#Italy|domestic double]] in both of his seasons with the club. ==Club career== ===Early career with Lorient=== Lemina began his career in France with the [[FC Lorient|Lorient]] youth academy at the age of 11; he was later promoted to the first team during the [[2012–13 Ligue 1|2012–13 season]], his only season with the club.{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/features/mario-lemina-juves-hot-headed-loanee-who-liverpool-wanted-summer#:oC24SNXstL9f9A|title=Mario Lemina: Juve’s hot-headed loanee who Liverpool wanted this summer|publisher=Four Four Two|author1=Greg Lea|date=14 October 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}} ===Marseille=== The following season, [[Olympique de Marseille|Marseille]] acquired Lemina for €4 million, although he initially struggled to gain playing time in his first year with the club, making only eight league starts during the [[2013–14 Ligue 1|2013–14 season]]. He began to be used more frequently by manager [[Marcelo Bielsa]] during the [[2014–15 Ligue 1|2014–15 season]], making his breakthrough with the club, as he helped the team to a fourth-place finish, earning 23 appearances in the league. In February 2015, Lemina was sent off for a punch to the groin of [[Ola Toivonen]] in a 1–1 [[Ligue 1]] away draw against [[Stade Rennais F.C.|Rennes]].{{cite web|url=http://www.fourfourtwo.com/au/news/lemina-could-face-action-after-groin-punch|title=Lemina could face action after groin punch|publisher=Four Four Two|date=7 February 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}} ===Juventus=== During the summer of 2015, Lemina began to attract the attention of several clubs, including [[Premier League]] clubs [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]], [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]]. On 31 August, however, the last day of the transfer window, [[Juventus F.C.|Juventus]] announced the signing of Lemina on a season-long loan for €500,000 with an option to buy for €9.5 million at the end of the [[2015–16 Serie A|2015–16 season]].{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/11/transfer-zone/2015/08/31/14909702/juventus-confirm-lemina-medical?ICID=HP_BN_4|title=Juventus confirm Lemina medical|publisher=Goal.com|author=Alec Fenn|date=31 August 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}} On 26 September 2015, he scored his first goal for Juventus in his third appearance, coming in the 63rd minute of a 2–1 away loss to [[S.S.C. Napoli|Napoli]].{{cite web|url = http://www.gazzetta.it/Calcio/Serie-A/Napoli/26-09-2015/napoli-juventus-2-1-insigne-higuain-inguaiano-allegri-lemina-gol-inutile-130279942508.shtml|title=Napoli-Juventus 2-1: Insigne e Higuain inguaiano Allegri. Lemina, gol inutile|trans-title=Napoli-Juventus 2-1: Insigne and Higuain get Allegri in trouble. Lemina, futile goal|publisher=La Gazzetta dello Sport|author=Gianluca Monti|language=Italian|date=26 September 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}} On 29 April 2016, Lemina's loan was made permanent; he signed a four-year deal from Marseille for a fee of €9.5 million plus an extra €1 million if performance related targets are met. The deal was scheduled to keep him at Juventus until 2020.{{cite web|url=http://www.juventus.com/en/news/news/2016/-lemina-signs-four-year-juventus-deal-.php|title=Lemina signs four-year Juventus deal|publisher=juventus.com|date=29 April 2016|accessdate=29 April 2016}} On 21 May, Lemina started in the [[2016 Coppa Italia Final|Coppa Italia Final]], playing the full match as Juventus defeated [[A.C. Milan]] 1–0 after extra time to capture the domestic double for the second consecutive season.{{cite web|url=http://www.football-italia.net/84739/coppa-italia-morata-extra-time|title=Coppa Italia: Morata in extra time|publisher=Football Italia|date=21 May 2016|accessdate=21 May 2016}} ===Southampton=== On 8 August 2017, Lemina joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on a five-year deal for a club record fee of £15.4m.{{cite web|title=Mario Lemina: Southampton sign Juventus midfielder for £15.4m|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40841080|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 August 2017}}{{cite web|title=Saints seal Lemina deal|url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2017-08-08/southampton-mario-lemina-transfer-announcement|publisher=Southampton F.C.|accessdate=10 August 2017|date=8 August 2017}} He made his debut on 20 August, in a 3–2 victory over [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].{{cite web|last1=Chapman|first1=Caroline|title=Southampton 3–2 West Ham United |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40908330|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 August 2017|date=19 August 2017}} His first goal for Southampton came in a 3–2 victory over fellow strugglers [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] on 3 February.{{cite news| last1=Henry| first1= Matthew|title=West Bromwich Albion 2–3 Southampton| url= https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42842347 |accessdate=4 February 2018|publisher=BBC Sport| date=3 February 2018}} ==International career== Lemina had been called by the [[Gabon national football team|Gabon national team]] to participate in the [[2015 African Cup of Nations]], but he refused his call-up.{{cite web|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/Lemina-est-du-voyage/524621|title=Lemina refuse la sélection|language=French|date=28 December 2014|publisher=[[L'Équipe|lequipe.fr]]|accessdate=29 December 2014}} Although he had initially represented France's [[France national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[France national under-21 football team|under-21]] sides,{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.us/story/2591248/mario-lemina-joins-juventus-on-loan-from-marseille|title=Mario Lemina joins Juventus on loan as Mauricio Isla, Paolo De Ceglie go to OM|publisher=ESPN FC|date=31 August 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}} also winning the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] at youth level, he formally switched to the Gabonese Federation on 2 June, and is now a formal member of the Gabon national team.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/34209107|title=Mario Lemina: France U20 World Cup winner chooses Gabon|publisher=BBC Sport.com|author1=Oluwashina Okeleji|date=10 September 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}} He scored on his international debut, in a 3–3 friendly draw against [[Tunisia national football team|Tunisia]] on 9 October 2015.{{cite web|url=http://www.lastampa.it/2015/10/10/sport/calcio/qui-juve/juve-non-solo-infortuni-dalle-nazionali-primo-gol-di-lemina-col-gabon-x2CuhpuKF9fiB99sYyOLEL/pagina.html|title=Juve, non solo infortuni dalle Nazionali: primo gol di Lemina col Gabon|trans-title=Juve, not only injured internationals: Lemina's first goal with Gabon|publisher=La Stampa|language=Italian|author=Alberto Dolfin|date=10 October 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}} ==Style of play== A strong, hard-working, and dynamic right-footed [[midfielder]], with good technique and solid distribution, Lemina is a [[Midfielder#Box-to-box midfielder|box-to-box]] player who is usually deployed in the [[Midfielder#Central midfielder|centre]], due to his ability to start attacking plays after winning back possession. Due to his tactical versatility, he is capable of playing in several positions, and has been deployed as a [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]], as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full-back]], or as a [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wing-back]], on the right flank; during his time with Marseille, he also played as [[Defender (association football)#Centre-back|centre-back]] in a three-man defence on occasion, during the 2014–15 season, under manager [[Marcelo Bielsa]].{{cite web|url=http://sport.ilmattino.it/sscnapoli/news/lemina_vuole_napoli_intermediario/1536663.shtml|title=Luigi Romano, intermediario per Lemina, promette: "Centrocampista di classe e grinta, vuole l’azzurro"|trans-title=Lugii Romano, an intermediary for Lemina, promises: "A classy and tenacious midfielder, he wants the azzurri shirt"|publisher=Il Mattino|author=Pasquale Guardascione|language=italian|date = 28 August 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.corrieredellosport.it/news/calcio/calcio-mercato/2015/08/29-3557170/napoli_soriano-lemina_le_scelte_a_centrocampo/?cookieAccept|title=Napoli, Soriano-Lemina: le scelte a centrocampo|trans-title=Napoli, Soriano-Lemina: the choices in midfield|publisher=Il Corriere dello Sport|author=Antonio Giordano|date=29 August 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}}{{cite web|url=http://www.corrieredellosport.it/news/calcio/calcio-mercato/2015/08/28-3534546/assalto_napoli_lemina_o_vecino_a_centrocampo/?cookieAccept|title=Assalto Napoli: Lemina o Vecino a centrocampo|trans-title=Napoli assalt: Lemina or Vecino in midfield|publisher=Il Corriere dello Sport|author=Antonio Giordano|language=Italian|date=28 August 2015|accessdate=10 December 2015}} Despite his talent, he has also earned a reputation for having a temper and for lacking concentration at times. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|30 January 2019}}.{{cite web|title=M. [[England national football team|England]] | nationalcaps7 = 19 | nationalgoals7 = 1 | club-update = 12:24, 2 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 01:29, 25 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Ryan Dominic Bertrand''' (born 5 August 1989) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|left back]] for {{English football updater|Southamp}} club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
Born in [[Southwark]], London, Bertrand began his youth career at [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]], before signing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in July 2005. He graduated from Chelsea's youth system and was sent on [[loan (sports)|loan]] to various clubs between 2006 and 2010. He made his full debut for Chelsea on 20 April 2011, six years after joining them, in a fixture against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]]. In the 2011–12 season, Bertrand signed a new four-year contract with Chelsea and was made understudy to [[Ashley Cole]], whom he described a "fantastic role model." On 19 May 2012, Bertrand became the first player to make his Champions League debut in the [[2012 UEFA Champions League Final|final]], starting in an unfamiliar left wing role in front of Cole; Chelsea beat [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] 4–3 on penalties. He has honours with Chelsea, including an [[FA Cup]] and [[UEFA Champions League]] titles.
Bertrand is an [[England national football team|England]] international, having also represented '[[England national youth football team|the Young Lions]]' at [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]], [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels, as well as [[Great Britain Olympic football team|Great Britain]] at the [[2012 Summer Olympics]]. On 15 August 2012, he made his debut for the England senior team, in a friendly against [[Italy national football team|Italy]], in a 2–1 win.
==Early life== Bertrand was born in [[Southwark]], London.<ref name=Hugman1011/> He joined [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]] aged nine, progressing through their youth system.<ref name=gills/> Bertrand attended the [[Robert Napier School]] in [[Gillingham, Kent|Gillingham]], Kent.<ref>{{cite news |title=Gillingham schoolboy Ryan Bertrand may play for Chelsea in Champions League final |url=http://www.kentonline.co.uk/medway_messenger/news/2012/may/15/ryan.aspx |date=25 April 2013 |accessdate=15 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120522005435/http://www.kentonline.co.uk/medway_messenger/news/2012/may/15/ryan.aspx |archivedate=22 May 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Business ventures== Bertrand is a founder of the [[Financial technology|Fin-tech]] brokerage [[Silicon Markets]] which provides [[machine learning]] and algorithmic trading tools<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.siliconmarkets.com/about |title=About Silicon Markets |publisher=Silicon Markets |accessdate=15 March 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160315155111/http://www.siliconmarkets.com/about|archive-date=15 March 2016|dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> for retail traders in the [[Foreign exchange market|Foreign Exchange]] and CFD markets.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/england-footballer-ryan-bertrand-sets-073000940.html |title=England footballer Ryan Bertrand sets up Silicon Markets |publisher=Yahoo Finance |date=21 October 2015 |accessdate=10 March 2016 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160310202648/http://finance.yahoo.com/news/england-footballer-ryan-bertrand-sets-073000940.html |archivedate=10 March 2016 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==Club career== ===Chelsea=== Bertrand was signed by [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in July 2005 from Gillingham for an initial £125,000, which was set by a tribunal and is subject to increase depending on progress.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/teams/g/gillingham/4424256.stm |title=Scally unhappy over Bertrand cash |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 November 2005 |accessdate=10 November 2005}}</ref>
====Loan spells==== [[File:Bradley Orr - 2008.jpg|thumb|Bertrand (right) playing for [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] in 2008]]
During the 2006–07 season, he was twice sent on [[loan (sports)|loan]] to [[AFC Bournemouth]], at the same time as Chelsea teammate [[Jack Cork]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He suffered a ruptured spleen in a youth team match against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] that ruled him out of the later part of that season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/page/PlayerProfileDetail/0,,10268~37737,00.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080731172607/http://www.chelseafc.com/page/PlayerProfileDetail/0%2C%2C10268~37737%2C00.html |dead-url=yes |archivedate=31 July 2008 |title=Ryan Bertrand Profile |publisher=Chelsea F.C |accessdate=20 May 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/900384|archive-url=https://archive.is/20140419110631/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/900384|dead-url=yes|archive-date=19 April 2014 |title=Ryan Bertrand |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=1 February 2014 |accessdate=19 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/1005124|archive-url= https://archive.is/20140419110631/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/1005124|dead-url= yes|archive-date= 19 April 2014 |title=March diary: Still hunting for all the glory |first=Neil |last=Barnett |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=1 April 2007 |accessdate=19 April 2014}}</ref>
In August 2007, Bertrand joined [[Oldham Athletic A.F.C.|Oldham Athletic]] on loan until January 2008.<ref>{{cite news |title=Oldham sign Chelsea youngster |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/o/oldham_athletic/6956773.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 August 2007 |accessdate=21 August 2007}}</ref>
On 4 January 2008, a matter of days after his spell at Oldham came to an end, Bertrand joined [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] on loan for the rest of the 2007–08 season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Canaries sign Pattison & Bertrand |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/norwich/7172043.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=4 January 2008 |accessdate=23 March 2008}}</ref> He put in a number of impressive displays playing at both left full back and on the left wing, and admitted he would welcome a longer stay with the club.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} Bertrand became popular with the [[Carrow Road]] crowd earning him the nickname 'Plastic' in reference to the Belgian singer [[Plastic Bertrand]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Bertrand could stay longer |url=http://www.canaries.premiumtv.co.uk/page/NewsDetails/0,,10355~1265370,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120218141000/http://www.canaries.co.uk/page/NewsDetails/0%2C%2C10355~1265370%2C00.html |archivedate=18 February 2012 |publisher=Norwich City F.C. |date=14 March 2008 |accessdate=23 March 2008 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref> On 4 July 2008, he rejoined the club on loan until January 2009, with an option to extend to the end of the season.<ref>{{cite news |title=Norwich re-sign Bertrand on loan |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/norwich/7491258.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 July 2008 |accessdate=5 July 2008}}</ref>
On 17 July 2009, Bertrand joined [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://goal.com/en/news/9/england/2009/07/17/1388380/chelsea-youngster-ryan-bertrand-joins-reading |title=Chelsea Youngster Ryan Bertrand Joins Reading |publisher=Goal.com |date=17 July 2009 |accessdate=20 May 2012}}</ref> He scored his first professional goal against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] on 10 March 2010.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He came third in the voting for Reading's player of the season, behind [[Gylfi Sigurðsson]] and [[Jimmy Kébé]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8557684.stm |title=Reading 4–1 Derby |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 March 2010 |accessdate=13 April 2010}}</ref>
On 5 August 2010, Bertrand signed on loan with [[EFL Championship|Championship]] club [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] in an initial six-month deal.<ref>{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest sign Chelsea left-back Ryan Bertrand |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/nottm_forest/8888432.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 August 2010 |accessdate=5 August 2010}}</ref> He made his debut for ''Forest'' as a substitute in a 1–0 away defeat against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He was a regular for ''Forest'' for whom he made a total of 19 appearances.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} ''Forest'' were interested in either extending Bertrand's loan spell for the rest of the season or to sign him permanently<ref>{{cite news |title=Forest manager Davies eyes permanent Ryan Bertrand deal |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/nottm_forest/9304470.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 December 2010 |accessdate=18 August 2011}}</ref> but when his loan period expired on 3 January 2011 he returned to his parent club Chelsea.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
===Return to Chelsea=== ====2010–11 season==== [[File:Bertrand in defence.jpg|thumb|upright|Bertrand playing for [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]] in 2012]]
Bertrand made his [[Premier League]] debut on 20 April 2011, when he came on as substitute to replace [[Ashley Cole]] in a 3–1 win against [[Birmingham City F.C.|Birmingham City]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Chelsea 3–1 Birmingham |first=Paul |last=Fletcher |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/eng_prem/9457016.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 April 2011 |accessdate=19 May 2012}}</ref> Bertrand also made a goal, providing a cross which [[Florent Malouda]] headed past Birmingham goalkeeper [[Ben Foster (footballer)|Ben Foster]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/apr/20/chelsea-birmingham-city-premier-league|title=Chelsea 3-1 Birmingham City - Premier League match report|first=Dominic Fifield at Stamford|last=Bridge|date=20 April 2011|publisher=|accessdate=26 January 2019|via=www.theguardian.com}}</ref>
On 15 July 2011, Bertrand signed a new four-year contract with Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news |title=Josh McEachran signs new five-year Chelsea deal |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14168931.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 July 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=McEachran and Bertrand sign long-term |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2393457 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=15 July 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140105215842/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2393457 |archivedate=5 January 2014 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He was used as a back-up to Cole by then Chelsea manager [[Carlo Ancelotti]], as he remained with Chelsea and left back [[Patrick van Aanholt]] went out on loan.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} Six years after signing for Chelsea as a school-boy, Bertrand made his first starting appearance against [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in the [[2010–11 Football League Cup|League Cup]]. The match finished in favour of Chelsea, who won on [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|penalties]] 4–3, as the match ended goalless.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2011/sep/21/chelsea-fulham-carling-cup|title=Chelsea 0-0 Fulham (Chelsea win 4-3 on penalties) - Carling Cup match report|first=Jamie Jackson at Stamford|last=Bridge|date=21 September 2011|publisher=|accessdate=26 January 2019|via=www.theguardian.com}}</ref>
====2011–12 season==== During the [[2011–12 Chelsea F.C. season|2011–12 season]], Bertrand played 90 minutes in Chelsea's 2–0 defeat against [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] in the [[2011–12 Football League Cup|League Cup]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Chelsea 0 Liverpool 2 |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2532417 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140602204832/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2532417 |archivedate=2 June 2014 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made his first league appearance of the season coming on as a late substitute for Ashley Cole against [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], the match ended in a 2–0 defeat for Chelsea.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/16884797 |title=Everton 2–0 Chelsea |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 February 2012 |accessdate=13 February 2012}}</ref> Bertrand was handed his first Premier League start against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] on 7 April, in which he produced an outstanding performance, as Chelsea won 2–1 and he was named fan's [[man of the match]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He was again named man of the match in his third start, a 0–0 draw with Arsenal on 21 April.<ref>{{cite news |title=Belligerent Blues |url=http://www1.skysports.com/news/12040/7690136/l |publisher=Sky Sports |date=21 April 2012}}</ref> On 5 May, Bertrand won the [[2011–12 FA Cup|FA Cup]] with Chelsea, but he did not appear on the pitch in the win against Liverpool.<ref>{{cite web |title=Liverpool 1v2 Chelsea |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/matchday-live/match/61587 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=5 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120904072037/http://www.chelseafc.com/matchday-live/match/61587 |archivedate=4 September 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Bertrand made his European debut in the [[2012 UEFA Champions League Final]] against [[FC Bayern Munich|Bayern Munich]] on 19 May 2012, playing on the left of midfield,<ref>{{cite news |last=Rostance |first=Tom |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18131939 |title=Chelsea v Bayern Munich: Champions League final |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 May 2012 |accessdate=20 May 2012}}</ref> becoming the first player in the Champions League era to make his debut in the final.<ref name=gills>{{cite news |first=Dominic |last=Fifield |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/may/20/ryan-bertrand-debut-chelsea-champions-league?newsfeed=true |title=Ryan Bertrand has glorious debut for Chelsea in Champions League final |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=20 May 2012 |accessdate=20 May 2012}}</ref> He was substituted with a knock after 70 minutes and replaced by Florent Malouda as Chelsea edged out Bayern 4–3 on penalties.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,,11065_3510294,00.html |title=Match Report | Bayern Munich v Chelsea – 19 May 2012 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=7 December 2011 |accessdate=20 May 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120522031414/http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0%2C%2C11065_3510294%2C00.html |archivedate=22 May 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
====2012–13 season==== Bertrand scored his first professional goal for Chelsea in the [[2012 FA Community Shield|Community Shield]] match against [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 12 August 2012, which they went on to lose 3–2.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/9470676/Chelsea-2-Manchester-City-3-match-report.html |title=Chelsea 2 Manchester City 3: match report |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |date=12 August 2012 |first=Henry |last=Winter}}</ref> He started in the first league match of the season against Wigan Athletic playing as a winger.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} On 5 September 2012, Bertrand signed a new improved five-year contract with Chelsea.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2911095/title/long-term-deal-for-bertrand |title=Long-term deal for Bertrand |publisher=Chelsea F.C |date=5 September 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120907015112/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/2911095/title/long-term-deal-for-bertrand |archivedate=7 September 2012 |df=dmy-all}}</ref> On 25 September, he scored his second professional goal in a [[2012–13 Football League Cup|League Cup]] match against [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolverhampton Wanderers]] at Stamford Bridge, which Chelsea won 6–0.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19632463 |title=Chelsea 6–0 Wolverhampton |date=25 September 2012 |accessdate=11 April 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
On 1 April 2013, he came on as a replacement for Ashley Cole in the [[2012–13 FA Cup|FA Cup]] quarter-final replay against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], which Chelsea went on to win 1–0.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} It was revealed after the match that Cole would be sidelined for at least two weeks, leaving Bertrand as the clubs only recognised left back.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He started the next match, the [[2012–13 UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] quarter-final first leg against [[Rubin Kazan]] at Stamford Bridge, putting in a strong performance as Chelsea ran out 3–1 winners.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/european/europa-league-victor-moses-and-ryan-bertrand-pass-their-auditions-for-roles-in-busy-runin-for-chelsea-8560909.html |newspaper=The Independent |location=London |date=5 April 2012 |first=Simon |last=Johnson |title=Chelsea v Rubin Kazan: Victor Moses and Ryan Bertrand pass their auditions for roles in busy run-in}}</ref> On 7 April, Bertrand made his 50th Chelsea appearance in a 2–1 win against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3135883/title/team-news-chelsea-v-sunderland |title=Team news: Chelsea v Sunderland |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=7 April 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130409095718/http://www.chelseafc.com/news-article/article/3135883/title/team-news-chelsea-v-sunderland |archivedate=9 April 2013 |df=dmy-all}}</ref>
He started at left back in the [[FA Cup semi-finals|FA Cup semi-final]] against Manchester City at [[Wembley Stadium]] on 14 April, which ended in a 2–1 defeat for Chelsea.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} In the continued absence of Ashley Cole, Bertrand started and performed well in the next league match in the [[West London derby]] against Fulham at [[Craven Cottage]] on 17 April, which Chelsea comfortably won 3–0 thanks to a 30-yard strike from [[David Luiz]] and a brace from [[John Terry]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
====Aston Villa (loan)==== On 17 January 2014, Bertrand joined [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] on loan for the remainder of the [[2013–14 Aston Villa F.C. season|2013–14 season]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11677/9119701/transfer-news-aston-villa-bring-in-ryan-bertrand-on-loan-from-chelsea |title=Transfer news: Aston Villa bring in Ryan Bertrand on loan from Chelsea |publisher=Sky Sports |date=17 January 2014}}</ref> He made his debut the next day in a 2–2 draw with Liverpool.<ref>https://www.birminghammail.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/aston-villa-ryan-bertrand-wont-6631746</ref>
===Southampton=== On 30 July 2014, Bertrand joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on loan for the [[2014–15 Premier League|2014–15 season]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Bertrand joins Southampton on loan |url=http://www.chelseafc.com/news/latest-news/2014/07/saints-loan-for-bertrand.html |accessdate=31 July 2014 |publisher=Chelsea F.C. |date=31 July 2014}}</ref> He made his competitive debut for the club on 17 August in their first match of the league season, playing the full 90 minutes of a 2–1 defeat away to Liverpool.<ref>{{cite news |title=Liverpool 2–1 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28730043 |accessdate=17 August 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 August 2014}}</ref> Bertrand scored for Southampton the first time on 27 September, opening a 2–1 home win against [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Lewis |first1=Aimee |title=Southampton 2–1 QPR |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29289926 |accessdate=27 September 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 September 2014}}</ref> His second goal for the club came on 26 December, in a 3–1 victory over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=Emons |first1=Michael |title=Crystal Palace 1–3 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30971834 |accessdate=1 February 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 December 2014}}</ref> On 1 February 2015, he was given a straight red card at the end of a 0–1 home loss against [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]] for a foul on [[Modou Barrow]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Southampton 0–1 Swansea |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30971834 |accessdate=1 February 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=1 February 2015}}</ref>
On 2 February 2015, Bertrand completed a permanent move to Southampton, signing a 4½-year deal for an undisclosed fee,<ref>{{cite web |title=Bertrand joins Saints on permanent deal |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/20150202-ryan-bertrand-permanent-southampton-chelsea-deadline-day-2244851.aspx |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=3 February 2015 |date=2 February 2015}}</ref> estimated to be £10 million.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Mackay |first1=Hamish |last2=Harris |first2=Nick |title=Ryan Bertrand joins Southampton for £10m from Chelsea on four-and-a-half-year deal |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2937145/Southampton-sign-Ryan-Bertrand-10m-Chelsea-four-half-year-deal.html |accessdate=3 February 2015 |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=2 February 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> On 26 April, he was the only Southampton player named in the [[PFA Team of the Year]].<ref name=six>{{cite news |title=Chelsea's Eden Hazard named PFA Player of the Year |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/32472834 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 April 2015 |accessdate=14 April 2017}}</ref>
Bertrand scored his only goal of the 2015–16 season in the final match, a penalty in a 4–1 win over Crystal Palace.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Oscroft |first1=Tim |title=Southampton 4–1 Crystal Palace |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240425 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=14 July 2016 |date=15 May 2016}}</ref> On 12 July 2016, Bertrand signed a new five-year contract.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ryan Bertrand: Southampton and England defender signs new five-year deal |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36776319 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=13 July 2016 |date=12 July 2016}}</ref>
==International career== ===England youth=== Bertrand has represented [[England national youth football team|England youth teams]] at [[England national under-17 football team|under-17]], [[England national under-18 football team|under-18]], [[England national under-19 football team|under-19]], [[England national under-20 football team|under-20]] and [[England national under-21 football team|under-21]] levels.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
He was part of the [[2008 UEFA European Under-19 Championship squads#England|U19 squad]] at the [[2008 UEFA European Under-19 Championship|2008 European Championship]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}}
He was promoted to the U21s and called up for several [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|2009 European Championship qualifiers]], but missed out of the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship squads#England|squad]] for the [[2009 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|final tournament]].{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} On 14 November, [[Stuart Pearce]] selected him at left back for an under-21 match against [[Portugal national under-21 football team|Portugal]] at Wembley in [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification Group 9|Group 9]] of the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|qualification process]],<ref>{{cite news |date=14 November 2009 |title=Rose the thorn in Portugal's side |work=uefa.com |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |accessdate=23 February 2018 |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2011/matches/round=2000006/match=2000211/index.html}}</ref> and helped the team keep first clean sheet since 29 June 2009.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} He was named in the England under-21 [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship squads#England|squad]] for the [[2011 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2011 European Championship]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://thefa.com/England/mens-under-21s/News/2011/england-under-21s-squad-euro |title=Pearce names squad for Euro 2011 |date=23 May 2011 |work=thefa.com |publisher=The Football Association |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110527145535/http://thefa.com/England/mens-under-21s/News/2011/england-under-21s-squad-euro |archivedate=27 May 2011 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> and played all matches.<ref>{{cite news |title=Spain-England |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |work=uefa.com |url=http://www.uefa.com:80/under21/matches/season=2011/round=2000002/match=2003390/postmatch/index.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110616133532/http://www.uefa.com/under21/matches/season=2011/round=2000002/match=2003390/postmatch/index.html |archivedate=16 June 2011 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Ukraine-England |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |work=uefa.com |url=http://www.uefa.com:80/under21/matches/season=2011/round=2000002/match=2003394/postmatch/lineups/index.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110619095528/http://www.uefa.com/under21/matches/season=2011/round=2000002/match=2003394/postmatch/lineups/index.html |archivedate=19 June 2011 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=England-Czech Republic |publisher=Union of European Football Associations |work=uefa.com |url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/matches/season=2011/round=2000002/match=2003397/postmatch/report/index.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110622053919/http://www.uefa.com/under21/matches/season=2011/round=2000002/match=2003397/postmatch/report/index.html |archivedate=22 June 2011 |deadurl=yes}}</ref>
===Great Britain Olympic=== On 2 July 2012, Bertrand was named in Stuart Pearce's [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's team squads#Great Britain|18-man squad]] for the [[Football at the 2012 Summer Olympics – Men's tournament|2012 Summer Olympics]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Pearce names squad |url=http://www1.skysports.com/olympics/story/15234/7859286 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=2 July 2012 |accessdate=2 July 2012}}</ref> He played his first match for [[Great Britain Olympic football team|Great Britain]] on 20 July 2012 in a friendly match against [[Brazil Olympic football team|Brazil]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Great Britain 0–2 Brazil |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/olympics/18929315 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 July 2012 |accessdate=20 July 2012}}</ref> He played three matches during the Olympic tournament.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.sports-reference.com/olympics/athletes/be/ryan-bertrand-1.html |title=Ryan Bertrand Bio, Stats, and Results |website=Olympics at Sports-Reference.com |language=en|access-date=2018-06-03}}</ref>
===Senior team=== On 10 August 2012, Bertrand was called up to the senior [[England national football team|England]] team for the first time, for a friendly match against [[Italy national football team|Italy]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://sports.yahoo.com/news/lescott-called-injured-oxlade-chamberlain-110000966--sow.html |title=Lescott called up as injured Oxlade-Chamberlain drops out of England squad for Italy friendly |publisher=Yahoo Sports |date=13 August 2012}}</ref> He made his international debut coming on for [[Leighton Baines]] in the 78th minute and cleared a shot off the line minutes later from [[Manolo Gabbiadini]] which eventually led to England's winning goal as England won the match 2–1.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2188915/England-2-Italy-1--match-report.html |title=England 2 Italy 1: Defoe thunderbolt earns Hodgson's men morale-boosting win |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=15 August 2012 |first=Matt |last=Lawton}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref>
On 11 September 2012, Bertrand came on after 73 minutes in the [[2014 FIFA World Cup qualification]] match against [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]] and crossed the ball that led to the [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] that [[Frank Lampard]] converted.<ref>{{cite news |title=England 1–1 Ukraine |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/19527517 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=2 July 2014 |date=11 September 2012}}</ref> On 8 October 2012, Bertrand was called up to the England squad for two more qualifying matches, against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] and [[Poland national football team|Poland]].<ref>{{cite news |title=England call-ups for Jonjo Shelvey and Ryan Bertrand |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19860360 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=8 October 2012}}</ref> However he missed both matches because of a virus.<ref>https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/early-england-goal-against-san-marino-the-key-says-wayne-rooney-8208649.html</ref>
Bertrand came on as a substitute for England away to Italy on 3 March 2015 and he won his fourth full cap, starting for England against [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] in [[Dublin]] on 7 June 2015.<ref>{{cite news |title=Rain washes out England's qualifying match with Poland |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/0/football/19941036 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=2 July 2014 |date=16 October 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://metro.co.uk/2012/10/16/steven-gerrard-hits-back-at-patrick-vieira-stars-do-love-playing-for-england-601595/ |title=Steven Gerrard hits back at Vieira: Stars do love playing for England |newspaper=Metro |location=London |date=16 October 2012 |accessdate=19 April 2014}}</ref>
Bertrand was part of the [[UEFA Euro 2016 squads#England|squad]] for [[UEFA Euro 2016]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/2016/may/england-final-uefa-euro-2016-squad-announcement |title=Roy Hodgson confirms final squad for UEFA EURO 2016 |publisher=The Football Association |date=31 May 2016 |accessdate=31 May 2016}}</ref> On 1 September 2017, Bertrand scored his first goal for England in a 4–0 [[2018 FIFA World Cup qualification|World Cup qualifier]] win over [[Malta national football team|Malta]].<ref name=Malta/>
==Style of play== Bertrand has been described as a modern-day full-back who gives assistance in attacking down the flanks, keeping and retaining possession as well as defending and reclaiming possession, making quick runs into the box and often does one-two's with his teammates.{{citation needed|date=April 2016}} Bertrand was described by [[Glenn Roeder]], his manager at Norwich, as a defender who "likes to bomb forward and is tenacious in the tackle when defending."<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11668/3777545/ |title=Bertrand back with Canaries |publisher=Sky Sports |date=4 July 2008 |accessdate=19 August 2012}}</ref> In a 2018 ''[[ESPN FC]]'' article about the state of left-backs in England, Michael Cox said that the "only real star is Ryan Bertrand, a truly excellent full-back defensively and offensively".<ref>{{cite news |title=For several top Premier League clubs, left-back is a liability |date=20 February 2018 |first=Michael |last=Cox |accessdate=23 February 2018 |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/english-premier-league/23/blog/post/3390575/for-several-top-premier-league-clubs-left-back-is-a-liability}}</ref>
