January 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 19:32, 3 January 2018 (UTC) }} '''Fraser Gerard Forster''' (born 17 March 1988) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Goalkeeper (association football)|goalkeeper]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and the [[England national football team|English national team]].
Forster started his career with [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] and had brief [[Loan (sports)|loan]] spells with [[Stockport County F.C.|Stockport County]] and [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]]. He then spent a successful season on loan at [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]], helping the club win the [[EFL League One|League One]] title and promotion to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]]. Forster then joined [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] on loan for the [[2010–11 Celtic F.C. season|2010–11]] season, and helped them win the [[Scottish Cup]]. He spent a further season on loan there, winning the [[Scottish Premier League]] before becoming a permanent squad member in 2012 for a transfer fee of £2.2 million. Forster won many plaudits for his performances at Celtic and holds the Scottish top division record of 1,256 minutes without conceding a goal. In August 2014, he joined Southampton for a reported £10 million. Forster had a generally impressive debut season in the Premier League, but sustained a serious knee injury in March 2015 which ruled him out for the rest of the year. On his return in January 2016, he quickly found form again and went on to set a club record of 708 minutes without conceding a goal. Forster's return aided Southampton's rise from thirteenth in the league to a sixth-place finish, earning them qualification for the following season's [[UEFA Europa League]].
Forster was selected for several England squads during 2012 and 2013 before finally making his first international appearance in November 2013. He was named in England's squads for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup|2014 World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]].
==Early life== Forster was born in [[Hexham]], Northumberland, the son of Brian Clive Forster [[Queen's Counsel|QC]] (who later became a [[Circuit judge (England and Wales)|circuit judge]]),<ref>{{cite news|last=Taylor|first=Louise|title=Fraser Forster's Celtic adventure leads to England World Cup call|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2012/oct/04/fraser-forster-celtic-england-world-cup|accessdate=27 September 2016|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=4 October 2012}}</ref> and attended the [[Royal Grammar School, Newcastle]],<ref name=SignsCeltic>{{cite web |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20120705/forster-signs-for-celtic_2281670_2829530 |title=Forster Signs For Celtic |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=5 July 2012 |accessdate=5 August 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120815060321/http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20120705/forster-signs-for-celtic_2281670_2829530 |archivedate=15 August 2012}}</ref> but did not begin playing as a goalkeeper until he was 13 years old.<ref name = "england call">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/blog/2012/oct/04/fraser-forster-celtic-england-world-cup |title=Fraser Forster's Celtic adventure leads to England World Cup call |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |first=Louise |last=Taylor |date=4 October 2012 |accessdate=4 October 2012}}</ref> Before then he had mainly played either [[rugby union]] or [[cricket]].<ref name = "england call"/> Coaches initially thought Forster might be too small to play as a goalkeeper,<ref name="england call"/> although he played for local junior team Stocksfield<ref>{{cite news|title=Fraser pays £100k dues to Stocksfield|url=http://www.hexham-courant.co.uk/news/Fraser-pays-100k-dues-to-Stocksfield--fb1e98e4-c354-4e7c-9f20-68ee19a3b2a6-ds|accessdate=30 November 2015|newspaper=Hexham Courant|date=19 November 2015}}</ref> before joining the renowned [[Wallsend Boys Club]].<ref name = "england call"/> However, he entered a significant growth spurt at 15 years of age and later signed with [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].<ref name = "england call"/>
==Club career== ===Newcastle United=== [[File:Fraser Forster.jpg|thumb|upright|Forster playing for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] in 2008]]
Forster earned his first professional contract with Newcastle United, signing for their Academy in 2005.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://tyneandwear.sky.com/newcastleunited/article/24507 |title=Transfer Talk: Newcastle United Sell Fraser Forster To Glasgow Celtic |publisher=Sky Tyne & Wear |date=5 July 2012 |accessdate= 5 August 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120711071647/http://tyneandwear.sky.com/newcastleunited/article/24507 |archivedate=11 July 2012 }}</ref> Forster was Newcastle's third choice goalkeeper in the [[Newcastle United F.C. season 2007-08|2007–08 season]] while [[Tim Krul]] was on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] at [[Falkirk F.C.|Falkirk]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://icnewcastle.icnetwork.co.uk/newcastleunited/sundaysun/tm_headline=burnley-keen-on-newcastle-keeper-fraser-forster%26method=full%26objectid=26707512%26siteid=61634-name_page.html |title=Burnley keen on Newcastle keeper Fraser Forster |newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle |date=23 June 2010 |accessdate=5 August 2012 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130502020242/http://icnewcastle.icnetwork.co.uk/newcastleunited/sundaysun/tm_headline%3Dburnley-keen-on-newcastle-keeper-fraser-forster%26method%3Dfull%26objectid%3D26707512%26siteid%3D61634-name_page.html |archivedate= 2 May 2013 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> and played regularly in the reserves.<ref name="2m-move">{{cite news |url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/newcastle-united/nufc-news/2012/06/07/nufc-set-for-2m-wherever-fraser-forster-goes-72703-31130381/ |title=NUFC set for £2m wherever Fraser Forster goes |newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle |date=7 June 2012 |accessdate= 5 August 2012}}</ref> However, in the six years he was signed to the club, Fraser never made a first-team appearance for Newcastle,<ref name=SignsCeltic/> mainly due to the fact that he spent most of his time on loan to other clubs, often lasting entire seasons.<ref>{{cite web|title=Fraser Forster|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players/player.sd?player_id=45689|website=Soccerbase |publisher=Centurycomm |accessdate=15 June 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Cameron|first1=Neil|title=Fraser Forster: I'm thankful for what Newcastle United did for me|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fraser-forster-im-thankful-what-7771664|accessdate=15 June 2016|newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle |date=15 September 2014}}</ref>
====Loan to Stockport County==== With Krul back for the [[Newcastle United F.C. season 2008-09|2008–09 season]] and Given back to full fitness, it was the turn of Forster to go on loan. He was loaned out to [[Stockport County F.C.|Stockport County]] on 2 October 2008, to deputise for regular goalkeeper [[Owain Fôn Williams]] while he was away on international duty with [[Wales national under-21 football team|Wales]].<ref>{{cite news |date=2 October 2008 |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11678_4236432,00.html |title=Hatters snare Magpies keeper |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=11 October 2008}}</ref> Forster started his first match for Stockport on 7 October in the [[EFL Trophy|Football League Trophy]] second round, where they lost 1–0 away to [[Bury F.C.|Bury]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Match Report McSweeney wonder strike saves Stockport |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,19764,11065_3003462,00.html |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=19 August 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081013014012/http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0%2C19764%2C11065_3003462%2C00.html |archivedate=13 October 2008 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He started his first league match for Stockport on 11 October, where his team drew 1–1 away to [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]].<ref>{{cite web|title=McSweeney wonder strike saves Stockport |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0,19764,11065_3003462,00.html |publisher=Sky Sports |accessdate=19 August 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081013014012/http://www.skysports.com/football/match_report/0%2C19764%2C11065_3003462%2C00.html |archivedate=13 October 2008 |deadurl=yes}}</ref> He returned to Newcastle on 1 November, after completing his loan stint at Stockport playing six league matches and keeping three clean sheets.<ref name=sb0809/>
====Loan to Bristol Rovers==== Forster, having been on the bench for Newcastle on over 20 occasions in the Premier League,<ref name=sway/> needed regular playing experience and subsequently signed a month-loan deal with [[Bristol Rovers F.C.|Bristol Rovers]] on 31 July 2009.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11678_5463929,00.html |title=Rovers snap up Magpies keeper |publisher=Sky Sports |date=31 July 2009}}</ref> He kept two clean sheets in the four league matches he played for them.<ref name=sb0910/> Bristol Rovers asked to extend the loan but Norwich City made a counter offer which was accepted by Newcastle.<ref name=Crisis>{{cite web|title=Keeper crisis at Bristol Rovers as Forster signs for Norwich City|url=http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/news/Keeper-crisis-Bristol-Rovers-Forster-signs-Norwich-City/article-1293680-detail/article.html|website=This is Bristol|accessdate=19 August 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100330070810/http://www.thisisbristol.co.uk/news/Keeper-crisis-Bristol-Rovers-Forster-signs-Norwich-City/article-1293680-detail/article.html|archivedate=30 March 2010}}</ref> Manager [[Paul Trollope]] was disappointed and commented that the team wanted Forster between the sticks.<ref name=Crisis/> He stated "Fraser has a great career ahead of him".<ref name=StarMaking>{{cite web |url=http://www.footballfancast.com/2010/01/football-blogs/star-making-newcastles-fraser-forster |title=A Star in the Making – Newcastle's Fraser Forster |website=Football Fancast |date=15 January 2010}}</ref>
====Loan to Norwich City==== [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] manager [[Paul Lambert]] was keen to sign Forster who he had seen play for both Stockport and Bristol Rovers. Forster then signed for Norwich City in a one-month loan deal.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_5519264,00.html |title=Canaries capture keeper |publisher=Sky Sports |date=28 August 2009}}</ref> It was then extended to the end of January 2010 after making an impressive debut against Hartlepool in the 2–0 victory at Victoria Park.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,11095_5530086,00.html |title=Canaries extend Forster loan |publisher=Sky Sports |date=20 November 2009}}</ref> Forster received a [[Misconduct (association football)|red card]] on 26 September 2009 against [[Gillingham F.C.|Gillingham]] for bringing [[Curtis Weston]] down in the penalty area,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/8265467.stm |title=Gillingham 1–1 Norwich |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 September 2009}}</ref> however this was considered to be a controversial decision.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.mirrorfootball.co.uk/match-centre/Gillingham-vs-Norwich-article158881.html |title=Gillingham vs Norwich |newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=28 September 2009}}</ref> He made a blunder in a 2–1 defeat against [[Leeds United F.C.|Leeds United]] on 19 October, with a 90th-minute goal kick going straight to [[Jermaine Beckford]] who scored.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/8306388.stm |title=Leeds United 2–1 Norwich |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 October 2009 |accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref>
On 20 November 2009, Norwich announced that they had agreed a deal with Newcastle to extend Forster's loan until the end of the 2009–10 season, after impressing the Norwich faithful with his displays, helping the team shoot up the League One table.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/norwich/8370007.stm |title=Norwich keep Forster for season |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 November 2009}}</ref> He was also allowed to play in Norwich City's cup matches.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pinkun.com/norwich-city/fraser_forster_deal_extended_1_646054 |title=Fraser Forster deal extended |website=The Pink 'Un |date=22 November 2009 |accessdate=23 February 2015}}</ref> Norwich manager Paul Lambert praised "world class" saves and a terrific contribution to the team.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pinkun.com/norwich-city/lambert_hails_world_class_forster_1_646883 |website=The Pink 'Un |title=Lambert hails 'world class' Forster |date=19 April 2010}}</ref>
In November 2009, Forster was awarded Norwich City Player of the Month.<ref name=StarMaking/> On 17 April 2010, Norwich secured promotion to the [[EFL Championship|Championship]] with a hard-fought 1–0 win over [[Charlton Athletic F.C.|Charlton Athletic]], with Forster pulling off excellent saves to deny [[Nicky Bailey]] and [[Deon Burton]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Liew|first=Jonathan|title=Charlton Athletic 0 Norwich City 1: match report|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/norwich-city/7601700/Charlton-Athletic-0-Norwich-City-1-match-report.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=6 February 2014|date=17 April 2010}}</ref> One week later, Norwich's 2–0 win over Gillingham saw them win the League One title.<ref>{{cite news|title=Norwich 2 Gillingham 0|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_2/8620715.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=6 February 2014|date=24 April 2010}}</ref> In recognition of his contribution to Norwich's success, Forster was named the club's Players' Player of the Year 2010<ref name=norpp>{{cite web|title=Norwich City still chasing Newcastle's Fraser Forster|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/norwich/8783281.stm|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=29 July 2014|date=2 July 2010}}</ref> and second in the Supporters' Player of the Year award.<ref name=noraw>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/n/norwich/8673295.stm |title=Norwich City return appeals to Fraser Forster |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 May 2010}}</ref> An excellent season at Norwich was completed by his award of the Macron Golden Gloves Award for the best record of clean sheets in the league, keeping 18 clean sheets in 38 league appearances and 20 clean sheets in 42 appearances in all competitions.<ref name=gga>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/s/swansea_city/8721110.stm |title=Goalkeeper Dorus de Vries wins top accolade |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 June 2010}}</ref>
===Celtic=== ====2010–11 (loan)==== On 24 August 2010, Forster joined [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]], originally on a season-long loan from Newcastle. Celtic manager [[Neil Lennon]] described Forster by saying, "He's a big boy, he's come highly recommended, his age is the only thing going against him because otherwise he's all the qualities you look for."<ref name=CelticLoan>{{cite news |url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/c/celtic/8935182.stm |title=Newcastle goalkeeper Fraser Forster on Celtic loan |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 August 2010 |accessdate=24 August 2010}}</ref> He made his Celtic debut on 29 August 2010 away at [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]] and kept a clean sheet as Celtic won 1–0.<ref name=MotherwellCeltic>{{cite news |url= http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/8946509.stm |title=Motherwell 0–1 Celtic |publisher=BBC Sport |date=29 August 2010 |accessdate=16 September 2010}}</ref> He then went on to play in every match of Celtic's season with the exception of two cup matches.
Forster had a successful season with Celtic, winning a runner-up medal in the [[2010–11 Scottish League Cup|League Cup]] and [[Scottish Premier League 2010–11|Scottish Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/scot_cups/9428470.stm |title=Celtic 1–2 Rangers (aet) |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 March 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/scot_prem/9484609.stm|title=Kilmarnock 1–5 Rangers|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 May 2011|accessdate=15 May 2011}}</ref> Between them, Forster and fellow goalkeeper [[Łukasz Załuska]] kept 23 [[clean sheet]]s in the league, breaking Celtic's previous clean sheet record from the [[2001-02 Celtic F.C. season|2001–02]] season.<ref name=Delight>{{cite web |url=http://www.celticfc.net/news/1086?item=1086 |title=Forster's delight at clean sheet record |publisher=Celtic F.C. |date=17 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/scot_prem/9484608.stm |title=Celtic 4–0 Motherwell |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2011}}</ref> Forster kept 21 of the clean sheets.<ref name=Delight/><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.chroniclelive.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/fraser-forster-proud-clean-sheet-1399417 |title=Fraser Forster proud of clean sheet landmark |newspaper=Evening Chronicle |location=Newcastle |date=18 May 2011 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref> He capped off his season with a 3–0 victory over Motherwell to help Celtic win the [[Scottish Cup]].<ref name=11cup>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport2/hi/football/scot_cups/9491542.stm |title=Motherwell 0–3 Celtic |publisher=BBC Sport |date=21 May 2011}}</ref> In total, he kept 24 clean sheets in 44 matches for Celtic.<ref name=hearts>{{cite news|first=Richard |last=Wilson |url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/football/celtics-fraser-forster-can-command-a-fee-if-he-can-learn-to-command-his-box.16156154 |title=Celtic's Fraser Forster can command a fee if he can learn to command his box |newspaper=The Herald |location=Glasgow |date=14 December 2011 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref><ref name=celticg>{{cite web|url=http://www.fitbastats.com/celtic/player.php?playerid=2975 |title=Celtic Player Fraser Forster Details |website=FitbaStats |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref>
====2011–12 (loan)==== After appearing for Newcastle in pre-season against [[Darlington F.C.|Darlington]],<ref>{{cite web | url = http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20110715/darlington-0-newcastle-2_2281670_2393957 |title=Darlington 0 Newcastle 2 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=15 July 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2011 }}</ref> [[Orlando City SC (2010–14)|Orlando City]],<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20110724/orlando-city-1-newcastle-united-0_2281670_2400429 |title=Orlando City 1 Newcastle United 0 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=14 July 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2011 }}</ref> Leeds United<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20110731/leeds-3-newcastle-2_2281670_2406443 |title=Leeds 3 Newcastle 2 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=31 July 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2011 }}</ref> and [[ACF Fiorentina|Fiorentina]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0,,10278~2412310,00.html |title=Newcastle 0 Fiorentina 0 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=6 August 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20111118011848/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0%2C%2C10278~2412310%2C00.html |archivedate=18 November 2011}}</ref> as well as being named among the substitutes for the opening match of the [[Premier League]] season against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0,,10278~2419462,00.html |title=Newcastle United 0 Arsenal 0 |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |date=13 August 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2011 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110919185609/http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0%2C%2C10278~2419462%2C00.html |archivedate=19 September 2011}}</ref> Forster rejoined Celtic, on loan for the remainder of the season, on 17 August 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/story/0,19528,12875_7108241,00.html |title=Hoops re-sign Forster |publisher=Sky Sports |date=17 August 2011 |accessdate=17 August 2011 }}</ref> He helped Celtic draw 0–0 against [[FC Sion]] at home, but then lost 3–1 in the away leg, only for UEFA to reinstate Celtic into the [[UEFA Europa League|Europa League]] with 3–0 wins in both legs after Sion were found to be fielding ineligible players, thus allowing Forster to keep his only clean sheets in Europe for the season, as he conceded in all the five group matches he played in.<ref name=Sion>{{cite news |url=http://sport.stv.tv/football/scottish-premier/celtic/268715-celtic-reinstated-in-europa-league-as-uefa-rule-against-sion/ |title=Celtic reinstated in Europa League as UEFA rule against Sion |publisher=STV Sport |date=2 September 2011 |accessdate=29 January 2012}}</ref>
Forster had a successful 2011–12 season with Celtic, winning the Scottish Premier League and helping his team beat the previous season's record of 23 clean sheets. He and Załuska kept 25 clean sheets combined, Forster racking up 21 of them.<ref name=12lg>{{cite news|url=https://www.thefreelibrary.com/KING+OF+THE+SHUT-OUTS%3B+Forster+hails+coach+Woods+for+his+clean-sheet...-a0289864797 |title=King of the shut-outs; Forster hails coach Woods for his clean-sheet record |newspaper=Daily Record |location=Glasgow |date=17 May 2012 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref> In December 2011, [[Heart of Midlothian F.C.|Hearts]] were awarded a controversial penalty in the final minute of a league match at Parkhead, with Celtic leading 1–0. Forster, however, pulled off an excellent save from [[Eggert Jonsson]]'s penalty kick to secure three important points for Celtic.<ref name=hearts/> In total, he kept 26 clean sheets from 47 matches that season.<ref name=celticg/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20120705/forster-signs-for-celtic_2281670_2829530 |first=Dan |last=King |title=Forster Signs For Celtic |publisher=Newcastle United F.C. |accessdate=1 November 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141228182111/http://www.nufc.co.uk/articles/20120705/forster-signs-for-celtic_2281670_2829530 |archivedate=28 December 2014}}</ref>
====2012–13==== [[File:Fraser Forster 2012.jpg|thumb|upright|Forster playing for [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] in 2012]]
On 29 June 2012, it was announced that Forster had signed for Celtic on a permanent deal for a fee in the region of £2 million.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2166757/Fraser-Forster-signs-Celtic.html?ito=feeds-newsxml |title=Fraser Forster signs for Celtic |newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date = 30 June 2012 |accessdate=30 June 2012}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> On signing the four-year deal, Forster stated, "I'm very happy that I'm going to be at Celtic for the next four years at least", and added that "The manager's faith in me means a lot, I've loved my two seasons at Celtic and he's done so much for my confidence."<ref>{{cite web|last=McHugh|first=Joe|title=Forster: Two reasons I've signed for Celtic|url=http://videocelts.com/2012/07/blogs/forster-two-reasons-ive-signed-for-celtic |website=Video Celts|accessdate=20 May 2014|date=2 July 2012}}</ref> Manager Neil Lennon described Forster as being a "top class keeper" and that he considered him to be an important addition to the squad.<ref>{{cite news|title=Celtic goalkeeper Fraser Forster signs four-year deal after loan spell|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18720928|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 May 2014|date=5 July 2012}}</ref>
On 7 November 2012, Forster produced a resolute performance<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/celtic/9663645/Celtic-v-Barcelona-Spanish-media-label-Fraser-Forster-La-Gran-Muralla.html |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London |accessdate=3 February 2014 |title=Celtic v Barcelona: Spanish media label Fraser Forster 'La Gran Muralla'}}</ref> against [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona]] in the [[UEFA Champions League]] group stages, helping Celtic record a historic 2–1 win during the week of the club's 125th anniversary. Due to the calibre of his performance, the Spanish media nicknamed Forster "''La Gran Muralla''" ("The Great Wall").<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2012/11/08/fraser-forster-great-wall_n_2091816.html |title=Fraser Forster Hailed As The Great Wall By Spanish Press |website=HuffPost |date=8 November 2012 |accessdate=8 November 2012 }}</ref> Forster continued to impress in domestic matches as well. In January 2013, Motherwell were awarded a soft penalty against Celtic. Bizarrely, referee [[Steven McLean (referee)|Steven McLean]] allowed [[Tom Hateley]] to take the penalty kick from ''in front'' of the penalty spot.<ref name=mpen>{{cite web|last=McHugh|first=Joe|title=Parker: I fancied Fraser to save penalty|url=http://videocelts.com/2013/01/blogs/parker-i-fancied-fraser-to-save-penalty|website=Video Celts|accessdate=4 February 2014|date=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref name=mvid>{{cite web|title=Spot of Bother For Fraser Forster at Celtic Park, Celtic 1–0 Motherwell, 02/01/2013|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zGl5GRBN6fA|publisher=SPFL (YouTube)|accessdate=4 February 2014|date=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref name=sball>{{cite news|title=Was the ball on the penalty spot? Celtic complain over Motherwell spot kick|url=http://stv.tv/sport/football/208266-was-the-ball-on-the-penalty-spot-celtic-complain-over-motherwell-spot-kick/|accessdate=7 July 2016|publisher=STV Sport|date=3 January 2013}}</ref> Forster was yellow carded for his protests to McLean,<ref name=mpen/><ref name=mvid/><ref name=sball/> but the goalkeeper went on to produce an excellent one-handed save high to his right.<ref name=mvid/><ref>{{cite news|last=Murray|first=Ewan|title=Celtic's Gary Hooper sends out reminders as he sinks Motherwell|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/jan/02/celtic-motherwell-scottish-premier-league|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=4 February 2014|date=2 January 2013}}</ref> The following month in a league match against [[Dundee F.C.|Dundee]], Forster tipped over a powerful [[Gary Harkins]] dipping shot at full-stretch.<ref>{{cite web|last=Conaghan|first=Martin|title=Celtic 5 Dundee 0|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21489686|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=4 February 2014|date=24 February 2013}}</ref> This save was voted the SPL Save of the Season in May 2013.<ref name=ss13>{{cite web|last=McHugh|first=Joe|title=Two Celt's among the honours|url=http://videocelts.com/2013/05/blogs/latest-news/two-celts-among-the-honours|website=Video Celts|accessdate=4 February 2014|date=14 May 2013}}</ref> Forster went to win a second league title with Celtic that season,<ref name=13lg>{{cite news |first=Ronnie |last=Esplin |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2312473/Celtic-4-Inverness-1-match-report--Hoops-retain-SPL-title.html |title=Celtic 4 Inverness 1: match report – Hoops retain SPL title |newspaper=Daily Mail |date=21 May 2013 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> and completed a league and cup double on 26 May 2013 with a 3–0 win over [[Hibernian F.C.|Hibernian]] in the Scottish Cup Final.<ref name=13cup>{{cite web|last=Lamont |first=Alasdair |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22585339 |title=Scottish Cup final: Hibernian 0–3 Celtic |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 May 2013 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref>
====2013–14==== Celtic again qualified for the [[2013–14 UEFA Champions League|UEFA Champions League for the 2013–14 season]], and again played against Barcelona at Parkhead on 1 October 2013, losing 1–0. Despite the defeat, Forster again impressed with several excellent saves, in particular an outstanding double save near the end of the match.<ref>{{cite news|first=Alan |last=Pattullo |url=http://www.scotsman.com/sport/football/spfl/scott-brown-red-costs-celtic-against-barcelona-1-3120727 |title=Scott Brown red costs Celtic against Barcelona |newspaper=The Scotsman |location=Edinburgh |date=2 October 2013 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.101greatgoals.com/blog/fraser-forsters-wonder-double-save-during-final-stages-of-celtic-0-barcelona-1/ |title=Fraser Forster's wonder double save during final stages of Celtic 0 – Barcelona 1 |website=101 Great Goals |date=2 October 2013 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref> Forster also pulled off a crucial save during a 2–1 win on 22 October 2013 over [[AFC Ajax|Ajax]] at Parkhead, saving from [[Thulani Serero]] when he seemed to be clean through on goal.<ref>{{cite news|first=Ewan |last=Murray |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2013/oct/22/celtic-ajax-champions-league |title=Celtic 2–1 Ajax; Champions League Group H match report |newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=22 October 2013 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref>
Forster's impressive performances for Celtic in the Champions League and involvement with the England international squad led to media reports in October and November 2013 that several clubs, including [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]] and [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]], were considering to make a bid for the goalkeeper.<ref name=press1>{{cite news|last=Sanderson|first=Jamie|title=Celtic boss Neil Lennon admits Fraser Forster could join Manchester United|url=http://metro.co.uk/2013/10/26/celtic-boss-neil-lennon-admits-fraser-forster-could-join-manchester-united-4162168/|newspaper=Metro |location=London |accessdate=2 November 2013|date=26 October 2013}}</ref> In response to the press speculation, Celtic manager Neil Lennon commented, "It's going to be impossible to keep Fraser, the way he's playing," adding, "Inevitably, I think a huge club will come in and make a huge bid for him."<ref name=press1/>
On 2 February 2014, Forster set a new a club-record of 11 league clean sheets in a row,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26011023 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=3 February 2014 |title=Celtic: Neil Lennon applauds record-breaking Fraser Forster}}</ref> surpassing a record of ten clean sheets set by [[Charlie Shaw (footballer, born 1885)|Charlie Shaw]] in the 1921–22 season.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11787/9147994/neil-lennon-proud-to-break-92-year-old-record-in-win-over-st-mirren |title=Neil Lennon proud to break 92-year-old record in win over St Mirren |accessdate=3 February 2014}}</ref> Forster's achievement was noted abroad, with the Spanish daily sports newspaper ''[[Marca (newspaper)|Marca]]'' awarding him their weekly "El Óscar" accolade to someone in football who has made an outstanding contribution in some way to their team.<ref>{{cite news|title=El Óscar – Fraser Forster|url=http://api.ning.com/files/mhrng7eeJg1KmTihaEPDtpW-BhxcaogWnR4SD86*ScgWk6KfCHdNWqildB6QSRDCwi-YlmAX4X4dV8K2zz*VW5uzI0nXVt7i/marcaforster.PNG|accessdate=5 February 2014|newspaper=Marca|location=Madrid |date=4 February 2014}}</ref> On 22 February 2014, Forster broke [[Bobby Clark (footballer)|Bobby Clark]]'s [[Scottish League]] record of 1,155 minutes without conceding a goal in a league match. Celtic won 2–0 away at Hearts, and Forster racked up his 13th consecutive clean sheet in the league.<ref>{{cite news|title=Scottish Premiership LIVE: Hearts v Celtic |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-match-reports/scottish-premiership-live-hearts-v-3172172 |newspaper=Daily Record |location=Glasgow |accessdate=22 February 2014 |date=22 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140425003512/http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-match-reports/scottish-premiership-live-hearts-v-3172172 |archivedate=25 April 2014}}</ref><ref name=csr>{{cite news|title=Hearts 0 Celtic 2: Double thumbs up for Celtic at Tynecastle as Fraser Forster sets new record and Leigh Griffiths strikes |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-match-reports/hearts-0-celtic-2-double-3172864 |newspaper=Daily Record |location=Glasgow |accessdate=1 March 2014 |date=22 February 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140309102535/http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-match-reports/hearts-0-celtic-2-double-3172864 |archivedate= 9 March 2014}}</ref> Forster's clean sheet run finally ended on 1,256 minutes against [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]] on 25 February 2014, with [[Jonny Hayes]] beating him from 30 yards to open the scoring in a 2–1 win for ''The Dons''.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/25892139 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=26 February 2014 |title=Aberdeen 2–1 Celtic}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Aberdeen winger Jonny Hayes claims Goal of the Season award|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11789/9288283/scottish-football-aberdeen-winger-jonny-hayes-claims-goal-of-the-season-award|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=28 April 2014|date=28 April 2014}}</ref> Forster finished the season with another league winner's medal as Celtic clinched their third consecutive [[Scottish Professional Football League|Scottish League]] title,<ref name=14lg>{{cite news|last=Campbell|first=Alan|title=Celtic crush Partick Thistle to make it three SPL titles in a row|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/mar/26/celtic-partick-thistle-scottish-premier-league-match-report|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=28 April 2014|date=26 March 2014}}</ref> and his form over the year saw him voted into the [[PFA Scotland]] [[PFA Scotland Team of the Year#Premiership|Team of the Year]] alongside teammates [[Virgil van Dijk]] and [[Kris Commons]].<ref name=ty14>{{cite web|last=Ross|first=Jack|title=Teams of the year announced|url=http://pfascotland.co.uk/2014/news/teams-of-the-year-announced/|publisher=PFA Scotland|accessdate=28 April 2014|date=18 April 2014}}</ref>
====2014–15==== Amidst speculation linking him with a transfer to [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]],<ref>{{cite news |last=Barnes|first=John|title=Fraser Forster: Celtic reject offer from Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28424379|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=8 August 2014|date=22 July 2014}}</ref> Forster played in Celtic's first four matches in the [[2014–15 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|qualifying rounds]] for the Champions League. Celtic lost 4–1 away at [[Legia Warsaw]], with Forster saving a penalty kick from [[Ivica Vrdoljak]].<ref>{{cite news|last=McGowan|first=Stephen|title=Legia Warsaw 4–1 Celtic: Hoops' Champions League hopes in tatters as Efe Ambrose red card sees Ronny Deila's side crash in third round qualifier|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2711123/Legia-Warsaw-4-1-Celtic-Hoops-Champions-League-hopes-tatters-Efe-Ambrose-red-card-sees-Ronny-Deilas-crash-round-qualifier.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |accessdate=8 August 2014|date=30 July 2014}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> Celtic eventually won the tie on away goals, after being awarded a 3–0 win for the second leg at home due to Legia fielding an ineligible player in that match.<ref>{{cite news|title=Celtic reinstated to Champions League after Uefa punishes Legia Warsaw|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/08/celtic-reinstated-champions-league-uefa-legia-warsaw|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=8 August 2014|date=8 August 2014}}</ref>
===Southampton=== ====2014–15==== On 8 August 2014, Celtic and Southampton agreed a reported fee of around £10 million for the transfer of Forster to the Premier League club.<ref>{{cite news|last=Murray|first=Ewan|title=Southampton set to sign Fraser Forster for £10m from Celtic|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/08/fraser-forster-southampton-transfer-celtic|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |accessdate=8 August 2014|date=8 August 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Lamont|first=Alasdair|title=Fraser Forster: Southampton & Celtic agree £10m fee for keeper|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28715811|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=8 August 2014|date=8 August 2014}}</ref> Southampton officially announced the transfer the next day, after Forster signed a four-year contract with the club.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/09082014-statement-fraser-forster-signing-1816904.aspx |title=Statement: Fraser Forster signs for Southampton |date=9 August 2014 |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=9 August 2014}}</ref>
He made his Premier League debut on 17 August in Southampton's first match of the season, a 2–1 defeat away at [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Liverpool 2–1 Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28730043|accessdate=17 August 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 August 2014}}</ref> One week later, Forster kept his first clean sheet for the club in a goalless draw against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] at home.<ref>{{cite news|last=Glendenning|first=Barry|title=Southampton held to goalless draw by West Brom at St Mary's|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/aug/23/southampton-west-bromwich-albion-premier-league-match-report|accessdate=24 August 2014|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=23 August 2014}}</ref> By mid-October, and after eight Premier League matches, Forster had kept four clean sheets and conceded only five goals, at that time the best defensive record in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web|title=Forster proud of defensive record|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/20141025-fraser-forster-pre-stoke-city-home-2038135.aspx|publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=2 November 2014|date=25 October 2014}}</ref>
Forster was at fault for [[Aston Villa F.C|Aston Villa]]'s goal in a 1–1 draw in November; coming out of his penalty box in an attempt to intercept a long clearance but missing the ball and gifting [[Gabriel Agbonlahor]] a goal. However, he was defended by manager [[Ronald Koeman]], who stated, "He [Forster] is a great goalkeeper and that doesn't change after this mistake."<ref>{{cite news|title=Koeman defends Forster after error|url=http://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/koeman-defends-forster-after-error-30771841.html|newspaper=Irish Independent |location=Dublin |accessdate=10 February 2015|date=25 November 2014}}</ref> Another error by Forster a month later in the [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] led to the only goal in a surprise 1–0 win for [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Bernstein|first=Joe|title=Sheffield United 1–0 Southampton: Marc McNulty takes advantage of Fraser Forster fumble as Nigel Clough's Blades cause Capital One Cup upset|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2876456/Sheffield-United-1-0-Southampton-Marc-McNulty-takes-advantage-Fraser-Forster-fumble.html|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |accessdate=10 February 2015|date=16 December 2014}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> Those two mistakes, however, proved to be exceptions, as Forster's form generally continued to be very impressive. By 7 February 2015, another clean sheet in a 1–0 win away at [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|Queens Park Rangers]] saw Southampton move up to third place in the League. Fraser again gained plaudits, this time for pulling off a reflex save to tip a [[Charlie Austin]] downward header over the crossbar.<ref>{{cite news|last=Cox|first=Gerry|title=QPR 0 Southampton 1: Heartbreak for Rangers as Mane strikes at the death|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/competitions/premier-league/11397964/QPR-0-Southampton-1-Heartbreak-for-Rangers-as-Mane-strikes-at-the-death.html|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|location=London |accessdate=10 February 2015|date=7 February 2015}}</ref><ref name=clst11>{{cite news |title=Southampton goalkeeper Fraser Forster proud of clean sheet record|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/31300135|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=10 February 2015|date=9 February 2015}}</ref> The match was his 11th clean sheet in the Premier League, the best record among top-flight goalkeepers over the course of the season at that point.<ref name=clst11/>
On 21 March 2015, in a match against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], Forster suffered a severe knee injury after clearing a back pass and was escorted off the pitch by medics, and replaced by [[Kelvin Davis (footballer)|Kelvin Davis]]. Koeman said Forster's injury was "looking bad" and that the doctors were "not positive". Up to this point, he had been ever-present for Southampton throughout the season and kept the most clean sheets in the League.<ref>{{cite news|title=England and Southampton keeper Fraser Forster stretchered off|url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11095/9770185/england-and-southampton-keeper-fraser-forster-stretchered-off|accessdate=22 March 2015|publisher=Sky Sports|date=22 March 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Fraser Forster: Goalkeeper injury hits England before Euro qualifier|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/32002910|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=24 March 2015|date=21 March 2015}}</ref> Four days later, Southampton confirmed Forster's injury to be a [[Patella fracture|broken kneecap]] and that he would be out for the remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Horsefield|first1=Izzy|title=Southampton and England keeper Fraser Forster ruled out for six months with broken kneecap|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/566308/Southampton-Fraser-Forster-six-months-out-broken-kneecap|newspaper=Daily Express |location=London |accessdate=25 March 2015|date=25 March 2015}}</ref>
====2015–16==== [[File:Fraser Forster 2016-02-27 1.jpg|thumb|upright|Forster playing for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2016]]
Although initially expected to be out for up to a year, Forster resumed light training in November 2015. Manager Ronald Koeman commented, "Everybody [at Southampton] is happy with how he is and that he's recovering well."<ref>{{cite news|last=Purewal|first=Nick|title=Fraser Forster may return for Southampton in four or five weeks, says Ronald Koeman|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3306152/Fraser-Forster-return-Southampton-four-five-weeks-says-Ronald-Koeman.html|accessdate=11 November 2015|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=5 November 2015}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> On 6 January 2016, Forster played the full 90 minutes of an [[U21 Premier League Cup|Under-21 Premier League Cup]] match against [[Chelsea F.C.|Chelsea]], keeping a clean-sheet.<ref>{{cite web|last=Lustig|first=Nick|title=Southampton goalkeeper Fraser Forster keeps clean sheet on return from injury|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11700/10121114/southampton-goalkeeper-fraser-forster-keeps-clean-sheet-on-return-from-injury|publisher=Sky Sports|accessdate=7 January 2016|date=7 January 2016}}</ref> He made his Premier League return on 13 January 2016, playing the full 90 minutes and keeping a clean sheet in Southampton's 2–0 win over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/35239745|title=Southampton 2–0 Watford|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 January 2016}}</ref> Forster went on to keep clean sheets in his next two appearances,<ref name=sway>{{cite web |title=F. Forster |url=https://uk.soccerway.com/players/fraser-forster/5259/ |website=Soccerway |publisher=Perform Group |accessdate=3 February 2018}}</ref> although he had little to do in any of his three matches since returning from injury.<ref>{{cite news|last=Steinberg|first=Jacob|title=Southampton see off West Brom thanks to James Ward-Prowse double|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2016/jan/16/southampton-west-brom-premier-league-match-report|accessdate=4 February 2016|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=16 January 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Dawkes|first=Phil|title=Manchester Utd 0–1 Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35331084|accessdate=4 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 January 2016}}</ref>
Forster's performance at Arsenal on 2 February 2016 in his fourth match was highly impressive and drew plaudits from many. ''The Gunners'' dominated the match, and had 11 shots on target as opposed to Southampton's three. Forster pulled off a string of saves in what ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' described as a "genuinely inspired goalkeeping performance". He saved twice from [[Mesut Özil]] in the first half, saving his first effort at goal with an outstretched leg then parrying his second shot, a volley from close range, away to safety. In the second half a shot from [[Alexis Sánchez]] was saved so spectacularly that Arsenal's [[Olivier Giroud]] was seen to turn towards Forster and applaud the save. A double save near the end of the match from [[Theo Walcott]] helped Southampton secure a hard-fought 0–0 draw.<ref>{{cite news|last=Dawkes|first=Phil|title=Arsenal 0 – 0 Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35406894|accessdate=4 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 February 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Surlis|first=Patrick|title=Arsenal 0–0 Southampton: Fraser Forster denies Gunners in goalless draw|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/arsenal-vs-soton/341417|accessdate=4 February 2016|publisher=Sky Sports|date=3 February 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Arsenal 0 Southampton 0: Olivier Giroud applauded Fraser Forster he was so good at the Emirates|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/premier-league/arsenal-0-southampton-0-olivier-giroud-applauded-fraser-forster-he-was-so-good-a6850121.html|accessdate=4 February 2016|newspaper=The Independent|date=2 February 2016}}</ref> After the match, Koeman praised his goalkeeper, hailing his performance as "magic" and describing him as "one of the best goalkeepers in the Premier League and maybe in Europe". Arsenal manager [[Arsène Wenger]] also acknowledged Forster's showing, saying, "He had a brilliant game."<ref>{{cite news|last=Shergold|first=Adam|title=Ronald Koeman says Fraser Forster's 'magic' saved a point as Arsene Wenger slates Arsenal's 'very bad' finishing|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3429163/Ronald-Koeman-say-Fraser-Forster-s-magic-saved-point-Southampton-Arsene-Wenger-slates-Arsenal-s-bad-finishing.html|accessdate=4 February 2016|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=2 February 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> Former Arsenal goalkeeper, [[Bob Wilson (footballer, born 1941)|Bob Wilson]], added further praise: "It was an exceptional goalkeeping display," adding, "Where I am admiring Fraser most is he has come back so well from a real long lay-off from a career-threatening injury... As regards who won Southampton the point it was Fraser without any doubt."<ref>{{cite news|last=Woods|first=David|title=Arsenal legend hails Fraser Forster following his 'miracle display'|url=http://www.dailystar.co.uk/sport/football/492276/EXCLUSIVE-Arsenal-legend-hails-Fraser-Forster-following-his-miracle-display|accessdate=4 February 2016|newspaper=Daily Star |location=London |date=4 February 2016}}</ref>
On 13 February, Forster recorded his sixth consecutive clean sheet in a 1–0 win over [[Swansea City A.F.C.|Swansea City]], a run which helped Southampton rise from 13th to 6th place in the Premier League since his return from injury.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Al-Samarrai|first1=Riath|title=Swansea 0–1 Southampton: Shane Long heads winner as Fraser Forster keeps sixth consecutive clean sheet for high flying Saints|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3445584/Swansea-0-1-Southampton-Shane-Long-heads-winner.html|accessdate=13 February 2016|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=13 February 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=English Premier League 2015–2016 – Table on Tuesday 12th January 2016|url=http://www.statto.com/football/stats/england/premier-league/2015-2016/table/2016-01-12|publisher=Statto Organisation|accessdate=13 February 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304150355/http://www.statto.com/football/stats/england/premier-league/2015-2016/table/2016-01-12|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=English Premier League 2015–2016 – Table on Saturday 13th February 2016|url=http://www.statto.com/football/stats/england/premier-league/2015-2016/table/2016-02-13|publisher=Statto Orgnanisation|accessdate=13 February 2016|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304142941/http://www.statto.com/football/stats/england/premier-league/2015-2016/table/2016-02-13|archivedate=4 March 2016|df=dmy-all}}</ref> His clean sheet run lasted a club record 708 minutes until he was beaten by [[Cesc Fàbregas]] in a 1–2 home loss to Chelsea on 27 February.<ref>{{cite news|last=Sanghera|first=Mandeep|title=Southampton 1–2 Chelsea|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35619625|accessdate=27 February 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 February 2016}}</ref> Forster's form since his return from injury, and run of clean sheets, saw him win the [[Premier League Player of the Month]] award for February.<ref name=pom216>{{cite news|last=Arrowsmith|first=Richard|title=Fraser Forster is Barclays Premier League Player of the Month for February after making clean sheet history for Southampton|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3487041/Fraser-Forster-Barclays-Premier-League-Player-Month-February.html|accessdate=16 March 2016|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=11 March 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> On 13 May, he signed a new contract until 2021.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fraser Forster & James Ward-Prowse: Southampton pair sign new deals| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36285917 |accessdate=13 May 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=13 May 2016}}</ref> Southampton's 4–1 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on 15 May in their final league match of the season saw them finish in sixth place on 63 points, securing entry into the following season's Europa League and their highest ever points tally in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Oscroft|first1=Tim|title=Southampton 4–1 Crystal Palace|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240425|accessdate=17 June 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last1=Jurejko|first1=Jonathan|title=Manchester United 3–1 AFC Bournemouth|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36303698|accessdate=17 June 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 May 2016}}</ref>
====2016–17==== [[File:Fraser Forster 2017-04-25 1.jpg|125px|thumb|upright|Forster playing for Southampton in 2017]]
Although first choice goalkeeper since his arrival at Southampton, it was only after the retirement of Kelvin Davis in the summer of 2016 that Forster was finally handed the traditional goalkeeper's "number 1" shirt at the club.<ref>{{cite web |title=Southampton's first-team squad numbers for the 2016/17 campaign have now been confirmed|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/20160803-squad-numbers-southampton-2016-17-3223321.aspx|accessdate=23 August 2016|publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=3 August 2016}}</ref> Southampton made a poor start to the season under new manager [[Claude Puel]], taking only one point in their first three league matches,<ref>{{cite news|last=Cambridge|first=James|title=Southampton handed huge boost ahead of Arsenal clash|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/708656/Arsenal-Southampton-Premier-League-Fraser-Forster-Injury-Fit-Play-Claude-Puel|accessdate=5 October 2016|newspaper=Daily Express |location=London |date=8 September 2016}}</ref> but from mid-September onwards Forster went on a run of five successive clean sheets in all competitions.<ref>{{cite news|last=Ellis|first=Ralph|title=Fraser Forster knocking on the door for England No 1 jersey while Victor Moses finally carves out a Chelsea future – 10 things we learned|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3819461/Fraser-Forster-knocking-door-England-No-1-jersey-Victor-Moses-finally-carves-Chelsea-future-10-things-learned.html|accessdate=5 October 2016|newspaper=Daily Mail |location=London |date=3 October 2016}}{{Unreliable source?|date=April 2017}}</ref> This run of clean sheets helped Southampton rise up to eighth in the league.<ref>{{cite web |last=Williams|first=Simon|title=Report: Southampton 3–1 Burnley|url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2016-10-16/report-southampton-burnley-premier-league|accessdate=24 January 2017|publisher=Southampton F.C.|date=16 October 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|last=Lewis|first=Aimee|title=Southampton 3 – 1 Burnley|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37599421|accessdate=24 January 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=16 October 2016}}</ref> However, both Forster and his team endured a slump in form thereafter. A mis-kick by the goalkeeper against Crystal Palace on 3 December gifted [[Christian Benteke]] an easy opportunity to open the scoring in a 3–0 win over Southampton.<ref>{{cite news|last=Crellin|first=Mark|title=Fraser Forster sorry for Southampton mistake against Crystal Palace|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11700/10682430/fraser-forster-sorry-for-southampton-mistake-against-crystal-palace|accessdate=24 January 2017|publisher=Sky Sports|date=3 December 2016}}</ref> Southampton suffered an equally heavy defeat on 29 December against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]], losing 4–1 in match where ESPN described Forster's distribution as "nothing short of appalling" and held him culpable for at least two of the goals conceded.<ref>{{cite news|last=Crook|first=Alex|title=Fraser Forster appalling as Southampton suffer against Spurs|url=http://www.espnfc.co.uk/club/southampton/376/blog/post/3028067/fraser-forster-appalling-as-southampton-suffer-against-tottenham|accessdate=24 January 2017|publisher=ESPN FC|date=29 December 2016}}</ref> Forster's poor form continued into January 2017, where it was noted his save/shot ratio was the worst amongst Premier League goalkeepers for the season to date.<ref>{{cite news|last=Laurence|first=Martin|title=Claudio Bravo is not the only shot-stopper struggling in the Premier League|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/who-scored-blog/2017/jan/17/claudio-bravo-worst-goalkeeper-premier-league-manchester-city|accessdate=24 January 2017|newspaper=The Guardian |location=London |date=17 January 2017}}</ref>
Despite indifferent form on the part of both Forster and Southampton as a whole, Southampton became the first team in history to reach the League Cup final without conceding a single goal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Fraser Forster goes from ridiculous to sublime to save Southampton against Liverpool|url=http://www.irishexaminer.com/breakingnews/sport/fraser-forster-goes-from-ridiculous-to-sublime-to-save-southampton-against-liverpool-774068.html|accessdate=16 March 2017|newspaper=Irish Examiner |location=Cork |date=25 January 2017}}</ref> However, Southampton lost 3–2 to Manchester United in the final on 26 February 2017.<ref name=efl17>{{cite news|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=Manchester United 3–2 Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39018813|accessdate=16 March 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 February 2017}}</ref> Forster had a good match in Southampton's scoreless draw with Liverpool at Anfield on 7 May 2017; saving [[James Milner]]'s 65th-minute penalty kick, and then pushing [[Marko Grujic]]'s header over the crossbar in injury time.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Bascombe|first1=Chris|last2=Tyers|first2=Alan|title=Liverpool 0 Southampton 0: Fraser Forster saves James Milner penalty as Reds toil to no avail|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/football/2017/05/07/liverpool-vs-southampton-premier-league-live-score-goal-updates/|accessdate=22 May 2017|newspaper=The Daily Telegraph|date=7 May 2017}}</ref>
Although he had an inconsistent year, Forster did end the season with a total of 14 clean sheets,<ref name=Jun17>{{cite news|last=Howard|first=Peter|title=Saints goalkeeper Fraser Forster drops in England pecking order – but is backed to turn it around|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/15342745.Forster_drops_in_England_pecking_order___but_is_backed_to_turn_it_around/|accessdate=30 August 2017|newspaper=Daily Echo|date=12 June 2017}}</ref> although his side only finished eighth in the league and failed to qualify for European football in the following season.<ref>{{cite news|title=Southampton fans react to deal being signed – 'Absolutely chuffed'|url=https://ninetyminutesonline.com/southampton-fans-react-to-deal-being-signed-absolutely-chuffed/|accessdate=30 August 2017|website=Ninety Minutes Online|date=22 July 2017}}</ref>
====2017–18==== On 19 July 2017, Forster signed a new five-year contract,<ref>{{cite news|title=Fraser Forster: Southampton goalkeeper signs new five-year deal|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40661534|accessdate=30 August 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=19 July 2017}}</ref> and described Southampton as being "a fantastic club to be at".<ref>{{cite news|title=Forster: It's a great club to be at|url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2017-07-20/fraser-forster-new-contract-interview-mauricio-pellegrino-impact|accessdate=30 August 2017|publisher=Southampton F.C.|date=19 July 2017}}</ref> His indifferent form, however, continued into the new season, with mistakes against Manchester United, Newcastle and Brighton all resulting in Southampton dropping points during the early months in the league.<ref>{{cite news|last=Snowball|first=Ben|title=What has happened to Fraser Forster?|url=http://www.eurosport.co.uk/football/premier-league/2017-2018/what-has-happened-to-fraser-forster_sto6386875/story.shtml|accessdate=15 November 2017|publisher=Eurosport|date=29 October 2017}}</ref> Despite these errors, manager [[Mauricio Pellegrino]] defended Forster, insisting he is a "really good goalkeeper" and that "the position of the goalkeeper is always exposed in this type of situation but nobody remembers the good situations."<ref>{{cite news|last=Shread|first=Joe|title=Southampton boss Mauricio Pellegrino backs Fraser Forster|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11700/11090949/southampton-boss-mauricio-pellegrino-backs-fraser-forster|accessdate=15 November 2017|publisher=Sky Sports|date=21 October 2017}}</ref> Forster was eventually dropped from the team in December 2017, replaced in goal by [[Alex McCarthy]].<ref>{{cite news|last=Crook|first=Alex|title=Southampton keeper Alex McCarthy sends warning to Fraser Forster and Crystal Palace|url=https://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/898885/Southampton-Crystal-Palace-Alex-McCarthy-Fraser-Forster-Premier-League-news|accessdate=3 February 2018|newspaper=Daily Express|date=1 January 2018}}</ref> He has not played for Southampton since.<ref name=sb1718 />
====2018–19==== By July 2018, Forster was pushed further down the pecking order at Southampton with the arrival at the club of [[Angus Gunn]] from [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] as back-up for Alex McCarthy.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Stone |first1=Simon |title=Angus Gunn: Southampton complete signing of £13.5m deal for Man City goalkeeper |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44771592 |accessdate=27 August 2018 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=10 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Fraser Forster running out of time and options |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/16589097.fraser-forster-running-out-of-time-and-options/ |accessdate=27 August 2018 |work=Daily Echo |date=21 August 2018}}</ref>
==International career== On 4 October 2012, [[Roy Hodgson]] included Forster in his [[England national football team|England]] squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] qualifiers against [[San Marino national football team|San Marino]] and [[Poland national football team|Poland]].<ref name=EnglandCall>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19828475|title=Forster gets England call|publisher=BBC Sport|date=4 October 2012|accessdate= 4 October 2012}}</ref> On 8 November 2012, Forster was then named in Hodgson's England squad for their upcoming friendly against [[Sweden national football team|Sweden]].<ref>{{cite news|title=England Name Squad for Sweden Friendly: Forster, Wilshere, Sterling and Osman Named|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/celtic-keeper-fraser-forster-being-1403798|newspaper=Daily Mirror |location=London |date=8 November 2012|accessdate=9 November 2012}}</ref> On 14 March 2013, Hodgson again included Forster in his England squad, this time for the 2014 World Cup qualifiers against San Marino and [[Montenegro national football team|Montenegro]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.scotsman.com/sport/football/top-football-stories/celtic-goalkeeper-fraser-forster-in-england-squad-1-2837294 |title=Celtic goalkeeper Fraser Forster in England squad |newspaper=The Scotsman |location=Edinburgh |date=14 March 2013 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref> On 27 August 2013, Forster earned his fourth inclusion to the England squad ahead of the [[World Cup qualifiers]] with [[Moldova national football team|Moldova]] and [[Ukraine national football team|Ukraine]], joining [[Joe Hart]] and [[John Ruddy]] in competition for the goalkeeper's position.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sport.stv.tv/football/clubs/celtic/237512-fraser-forster-recalled-to-england-squad-for-moldova-and-ukraine-qualifiers/ |title=Fraser Forster recalled to England squad for Moldova and Ukraine qualifiers |publisher=STV Sport |date=27 August 2013 |accessdate=1 November 2013}}</ref>
Forster won his first cap for England on 15 November 2013 in a friendly match against [[Chile national football team|Chile]] at [[Wembley Stadium]]. England lost 2–0 but Forster was "blameless" for both goals, making a "fine diving save" to deny Chile a third.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24862578 |title=England 0–2 Chile |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 November 2013 |accessdate=16 November 2013}}</ref> This appearance against Chile saw Forster become only the second person ever to play for England while a Celtic player, after [[Alan Thompson (footballer, born 1973)|Alan Thompson]] in 2004.<ref>{{cite web|last=Nash|first=Matthew|title=Who are Glasgow Celtic's England internationals?|url=http://hereisthecity.com/en-gb/2012/10/04/mn-who-are-glasgow-celtics-england-internationals/|website=HITC Sport|accessdate=4 February 2014|date=5 October 2013}}</ref>
On 12 May 2014, Hodgson named Forster in England's 23-man squad for the 2014 World Cup in Brazil.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27362447 |title=World Cup 2014: England name Ross Barkley in squad |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 May 2014 |accessdate=12 May 2014}}</ref> In England's last warm-up match before the tournament, on 7 June, he replaced Joe Hart for the last 15 minutes of a 0–0 draw with [[Honduras national football team|Honduras]].<ref>{{cite news|last=McNulty|first=Phil|title=England 0–0 Honduras|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27383495|accessdate=8 June 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 June 2014}}</ref> Forster travelled to Brazil with the rest of the England squad but did not feature in any of the three matches England played.<ref>{{cite web|title=Fraser Forster: European trips can keep me in England frame|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/england/2014/jul/fraser-forster-craves-england-chance|publisher=The Football Association|accessdate=29 July 2014|date=13 July 2014}}</ref>
A knee injury saw Forster miss most of 2015, but his form on returning to playing football in early 2016 earned him a recall to the England squad in March.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Joyce|first1=Paul|title=Southampton and England star Fraser Forster opens up about his 10-month battle with injury|url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/655346/Southampton-England-star-Fraser-Forster-opens-up-about-10-month-battle-injury-News-Gossip|accessdate=13 June 2016|newspaper=Daily Express |location=London |date=25 March 2016}}</ref> He played the second half of England's 3–2 friendly win over [[Germany national football team|Germany]] in Berlin, making an impressive save from a [[Marco Reus]] free kick, although later conceded a goal from a [[Mario Gómez]] header.<ref>{{cite news|title=Forster makes international return in England win|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/20160326-fraser-forster-germany-england-report-3027992.aspx|accessdate=13 June 2016|publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=26 March 2016}}</ref> Forster played the full 90 minutes three days later on 29 March 2016 in a 2–1 loss against the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]]. Both goals conceded were controversial; [[Danny Rose (footballer, born 1990)|Danny Rose]] protesting that the handball that led to the penalty for the Netherlands first goal was not deliberate, while [[Phil Jagielka]] appeared to be fouled in the build-up to [[Luciano Narsingh]]'s winning goal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Forster and Clasie feature as England lose to Holland|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/20160329-fraser-forster-england-holland-report-3032170.aspx|accessdate=13 June 2016|publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=29 March 2016}}</ref><ref name=holl>{{cite news|last=Leitch|first=Adam|title=Southampton goalkeeper Fraser Forster boosts hopes for Euro 2016 despite England losing 2–1 to the Netherlands|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/14390519.Forster_shines_despite_England_loss/|accessdate=13 June 2016|newspaper=Southern Daily Echo |location=Southampton |date=29 March 2016}}</ref> Despite the defeat, Forster turned in a composed performance and made several excellent saves.<ref name=holl/> On 31 May 2016, Forster was named in England's 23-man squad for [[UEFA Euro 2016]], albeit he was once again understudy to Joe Hart and did not play in any of England's four matches at the tournament.<ref>{{cite news|title=Ryan Bertrand and Fraser Forster have been in confirmed in Roy Hodgson's finalised 23-man England squad for Euro 2016|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/14526321.Saints_duo_confirmed_in_England_s_final_Euros_squad/?ref=arc|accessdate=13 June 2016|newspaper=Southern Daily Echo |location=Southampton |date=31 May 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=England – squad|url=http://www.uefa.com/uefaeuro/season=2016/teams/team=39/squad/index.html|publisher=UEFA |accessdate=27 June 2016}}</ref>
Following Euro 2016, Forster remained an unused substitute in subsequent England matches,<ref name=Jun17/> and was dropped from the squad altogether in August 2017.<ref>{{cite news|title=Southampton goalkeeper Fraser Forster is left out of the England squad but Ryan Bertrand is named|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/15493842.Forster_axed_from_England_squad/|accessdate=30 August 2017|newspaper=Daily Echo|date=24 August 2017}}</ref>
==Style of play== Despite his large build, Forster has a high level of agility; Ian Brown who coached him as a youth at Wallsend said that "he was and is an amazing shot stopper. I've seen him for Southampton save shots he shouldn't, his body bends." In one-on-situations, he appears to make his already large stature even bigger to an onrushing opponent.<ref name=tinl>{{cite web|last=Clarke|first=John|title=Fraser Forster: Beating Hart?|url=http://theinsideleft.com/fraser-forster/|website=The Inside Left|accessdate=15 June 2016|date=6 September 2013}}</ref>
Forster was, however, criticised in the early part of his time at Celtic for lacking confidence and command, and uncertain when he had the ball at his feet.<ref name=hearts/><ref name=tinl/> In time he matured, with his confidence and kicking noticeably improved. His level of concentration was also noted; given Celtic's dominance over the majority of their opponents in Scotland, their goalkeeper often has long periods of inactivity, but when eventually called into action Forster was invariably alert and ready.<ref name=tinl/>

Under-23s and Academy|Watford]]<ref name=ryanFC/><ref name=more/> | youthyears5 = | youthclubs5 = [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]]<ref name=ryanFC/><ref name=more/> | youthyears6 = 2016–2018 | youthclubs6 = [[Southampton F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Southampton]] | years1 = 2018– | clubs1 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps1 = 6 | goals1 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2017– | nationalteam1 = [[Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team|Republic of Ireland U19]] | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 1 | nationalyears2 = 2018– | nationalteam2 = [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] | nationalcaps2 = 1 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | club-update = 08:38, 23 December 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 23:11, 19 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Michael Oluwadurotimi Obafemi''' (born 6 July 2000) is an Irish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].<ref>{{soccerway|michael-obafemi/453438|accessdate=21 January 2018}}</ref>
==Club career== Obafemi was born in [[Dublin]] to Nigerian parents and was raised in the [[London]] area,<ref name=more>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.ie/sport/soccer/i-cant-stop-here-irish-youngster-makes-his-premier-league-debutand-now-he-wants-more-36514263.html|title='I can't stop here' - Irish youngster makes his Premier League debut...and now he wants more|newspaper=[[Irish Independent]]|date=21 January 2018|accessdate=7 February 2018}}</ref> He joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] from [[Leyton Orient F.C.|Leyton Orient]] in 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Michael Obafemi|url=https://southamptonfc.com/u18s/michael-obafemi|work=Southampton FC}}</ref>
Obafemi made his professional debut as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in the 82nd minute of a 1–1 draw with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] on 21 January 2018.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.the42.ie/ireland-u19-youngster-makes-the-bench-for-southamptons-premier-league-clash-3809610-Jan2018/ | title=17-year-old Irish striker makes debut in Southampton's Premier League clash | publisher=The 42 | accessdate=21 January 2018}}</ref> Aged 17 years and 199 days, Obafemi became the second youngest player to make a Premier League appearance for Southampton after [[Luke Shaw]], who was 17 years and 116 days old.<ref>{{cite web |first= Mike|last= Henson| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/42679252 | title=Southampton 1–1 Tottenham | publisher=BBC Sport|date= 21 January 2018| accessdate=21 January 2018}}</ref>
He scored his first professional goal with the third goal in a 3–1 victory at [[Huddersfield Town A.F.C.|Huddersfield]] on 22 December 2018; at 18 years and 169 days old, he became Southampton's youngest scorer in the Premier League.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Oscroft |first1=Tim |title=Huddersfield Town 1 Southampton 3 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46576164 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=22 December 2018 |date=22 December 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Obafemi was eligible to represent England, Nigeria, and the Republic of Ireland.<ref>{{cite web |title=Michael Obafemi: Martin O'Neill won't rush Southampton player to make international decision |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46210415 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=16 November 2018 |date=14 November 2018}}</ref> However, in November 2018 he committed to the Republic of Ireland.<ref>{{cite web |title=Michael Obafemi: Southampton starlet commits to the Republic of Ireland |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46226854 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=16 November 2018 |date=15 November 2018}}</ref>
Obafemi has represented the [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] at [[Republic of Ireland national under-19 football team|under-19 level]], debuting during the [[2019 UEFA European Under-19 Championship qualification]] campaign.<ref>{{UEFA player|250115156}}</ref>
On 6 November 2018, Obafemi was named in the senior [[Republic of Ireland national football team|Republic of Ireland]] squad for the first time for the [[exhibition match|friendly]] against [[Northern Ireland national football team|Northern Ireland]] on 15 November and the [[UEFA Nations League]] match against [[Denmark national football team|Denmark]] on 19 November 2018.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.the42.ie/martin-oneill-on-michael-obafemi-4326098-Nov2018/ |title =18-year-old Southampton striker earns praise after first Ireland call-up|date=6 November 2018|work=The 42|accessdate=7 November 2018}}</ref><ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.the42.ie/ireland-squad-denmark-northern-ireland-4324713-Nov2018/ |title =Nigerian-eligible Southampton teenager among four new call-ups in Ireland squad|date=6 November 2018|work=The 42|accessdate=7 November 2018}}</ref> He came on as a substitute in the second half of the 0–0 draw against Denmark to make his debut.<ref>{{cite web |title=Denmark 0 Republic of Ireland 0 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46256127 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=20 November 2018 |date=19 November 2018}}</ref> He also became the first player born in the 2000s to win a senior cap for Ireland.<ref>{{citeweb|url=https://www.the42.ie/michael-obafemi-reaction-denmark-november-2018-4348604-Nov2018/ |title =Proud Obafemi 'never had any doubts' about representing Ireland|date=19 November 2018|work=The 42|accessdate=20 November 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== His older brother [[Afolabi Obafemi]] is also a footballer.<ref name=ryanFC/>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== {{soccerbase|100078}} [https://southamptonfc.com/first-team/michael-obafemi Southampton FC profile]
