[[Portugal national under-20 football team|Portugal U20]] | nationalcaps5 = 18 | nationalgoals5 = 0 | nationalyears6 = 2011–2012 | nationalteam6 = [[Portugal national under-21 football team|Portugal U21]] | nationalcaps6 = 10 | nationalgoals6 = 0 | nationalyears7 = 2014– | nationalteam7 = [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] | nationalcaps7 = 33 | nationalgoals7 = 1 | club-update = 23:35, 26 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 19:13, 14 October 2018 (UTC) | medaltemplates = {{medalCountry|[[Portugal national football team|Portugal]]}} {{medal|W|[[UEFA European Championship|European Championship]]|[[UEFA Euro 2016|2016]]}} {{medal|3rd|[[FIFA Confederations Cup|Confederations Cup]]|[[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup|2017]]}} }} '''Cédric Ricardo Alves Soares''' {{small|[[Order of Prince Henry|CvIH]] [[Order of Merit (Portugal)|ComM]]}}{{cite web|url=http://anibalcavacosilva.arquivo.presidencia.pt/?idc=10&idi=56611&action=7|title=Presidente Cavaco Silva condecorou selecção nacional de futebol sub-20|trans-title=President Cavaco Silva decorated national under-20 football team|publisher=Arquivo Presidência|language=pt|date=6 September 2011|accessdate=11 July 2016}}{{cite web|url=https://desporto.sapo.pt/futebol/euro_2016/artigo/2016/07/10/euro2016-marcelo-condecora-jogadores-com-grau-de-comendador-da-ordem-do-merito|title=Marcelo condecora jogadores com Grau de Comendador da Ordem do Mérito|trans-title=Marcelo decorates players with ''Grau de Comendador da Ordem do Mérito''|publisher=[[SAPO (company)|SAPO]]|language=pt|date=10 July 2016|accessdate=11 July 2016}} (born 31 August 1991), known simply as '''Cédric''' ({{IPA-pt|ˈsɛdɾik}}), is a Portuguese professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]] for Italian club [[Inter Milan]], on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], and the [[Portugal national football team|Portuguese national team]]. His career started with [[Sporting CP]], going on to appear in 94 competitive games over the course of four [[Primeira Liga]] seasons and scoring two goals. He signed for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2015. Having earned 72 [[cap (sports)|caps]] across all youth levels, Cédric made his senior debut for [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]] in 2014. He appeared for the country at the [[2018 FIFA World Cup|2018 World Cup]] and [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]], winning the latter tournament. ==Club career== ===Sporting=== Born in [[Singen]], [[Baden-Württemberg]], Germany to [[Portuguese people|Portuguese]] immigrants, Cédric returned to his parents' country at the age of two.{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/chleague/startseite/613698/artikel_cedric-setzt-sich-hohe-ziele.html|title=Cedric setzt sich hohe Ziele|trans-title=Cedric sets high goals for himself|publisher=[[Kicker (sports magazine)|Kicker]]|last=Martins|first=José|language=de|date=19 October 2014|accessdate=9 November 2014}}{{cite web|url=http://www.maisfutebol.iol.pt/cedric-sporting-liga-campeoes-schalke-04-perfil-liga-mftotal/544570e40cf2efa205a909dd.html|title=Memórias do miúdo que foi para o Sporting por causa da Alemanha|trans-title=Memoirs of the kid who joined Sporting because of Germany|publisher=Mais Futebol|last=Pereira|first=Sérgio|language=pt|date=21 October 2014|accessdate=12 January 2015}} He joined [[Sporting CP]]'s youth system in 1999, aged eight. Cédric made his [[Primeira Liga]] debut with the first team on 8 May 2011, starting in a 0–1 home loss against [[Vitória F.C.|Vitória de Setúbal]].{{cite web|url=https://www.rtp.pt/noticias/sporting/setubal-conquista-alvalade-e-a-permanencia_d440134|title=Setúbal conquista Alvalade e a permanência|trans-title=Setúbal take Alvalade and survival|publisher=[[Rádio e Televisão de Portugal]]|language=pt|date=8 May 2011|accessdate=18 May 2018}} For [[2011–12 Primeira Liga|2011–12]] he, alongside teammate [[Adrien Silva]], was loaned to fellow top division club [[Associação Académica de Coimbra – O.A.F.|Académica de Coimbra]],{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga/Sporting/interior.aspx?content_id=702977|title=Cédric emprestado à Académica|trans-title=Cédric loaned to Académica|newspaper=[[Record (newspaper)|Record]]|language=pt|date=17 June 2011|accessdate=18 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150618192835/http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Nacional/1a_liga/Sporting/interior.aspx?content_id=702977|archivedate=18 June 2015|df=}} where he played regularly and won [[2011–12 Taça de Portugal|that season]]'s [[Taça de Portugal]], playing the full 90 minutes in the [[2012 Taça de Portugal Final|1–0 triumph]] against precisely Sporting.{{cite web|url=http://www.portugoal.net/index.php/more-portuguese-cup-news/33587-cup-final-sporting-v-academica|title=Académica shock Sporting to lift Portuguese Cup|publisher=PortuGOAL|date=19 May 2012|accessdate=11 October 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131102122918/http://www.portugoal.net/index.php/more-portuguese-cup-news/33587-cup-final-sporting-v-academica|archivedate=2 November 2013|df=}} Subsequently, Cédric returned to the [[Lisbon]] side, being first-choice in the following years under several managers.{{cite news|url=http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Internacional/mundial2014/portugal/interior_premium.aspx?content_id=880287|title=Álvaro Magalhães: "Cédric é titular indiscutível no Sporting"|trans-title=Álvaro Magalhães: "Cédric is an undisputed starter in Sporting"|newspaper=Record|language=pt|date=29 April 2014|accessdate=18 June 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150618172747/http://www.record.xl.pt/Futebol/Internacional/mundial2014/portugal/interior_premium.aspx?content_id=880287|archivedate=18 June 2015|df=}} He scored his first goal in the [[Portuguese football league system|Portuguese top division]] on 15 December 2012, netting with his left foot from 30 meters in a 1–1 draw away to [[C.D. Nacional]].{{cite news|url=https://www.dn.pt/desporto/sporting/interior/cedric-e-rui-patricio-salvam-um-ponto-na-choupana-2949216.html|title=Cédric e Rui Patrício salvam um ponto na Choupana|trans-title=Cédric and Rui Patrício rescue point in Choupana|newspaper=[[Diário de Notícias]]|last=Ruela|first=João|language=pt|date=15 December 2012|accessdate=18 May 2018}} In [[2015 Taça de Portugal Final|the domestic cup final]] on 31 May 2015, against [[S.C. Braga]], Cédric was [[Ejection (sports)|sent off]] in the 14th minute after conceding a [[Penalty kick (association football)|penalty]] with a foul on [[Djavan da Silva Ferreira|Djavan]], but Sporting eventually won in [[Penalty shoot-out (association football)|a shootout]].{{cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/article-3105112/Sporting-Lisbon-stage-remarkable-comeback-having-man-sent-going-2-0-half-hour-win-Portuguese-Cup-penalties-against-Braga.html|title=Sporting Lisbon stage remarkable comeback after having man sent off and going 2–0 down after half-hour... to win Portuguese Cup on penalties against Braga|newspaper=[[Daily Mail]]|date=1 June 2015|accessdate=1 June 2015}} ===Southampton=== [[File:Southampton FC versus Sevilla (35555663034).jpg|thumb|right|Cédric playing for Southampton in 2017]] On 18 June 2015, Cédric was announced as the second summer signing for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on a four-year contract,{{cite web|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/20150618-cedric-soares-portugal-sporting-announcement-signing-2498917.aspx|title=Saints land Portugal defender Cédric|publisher=Southampton F.C|date=18 June 2015|accessdate=18 June 2015}} with the English club paying up to €6.5 million (£4.7 million) for his services.{{cite web|url=http://www.sporting.pt/incscp/pdf/investor_relations/ir_Comunicado18Junho15Cedric.pdf|title=Comunicado|trans-title=Announcement|publisher=Sporting CP|language=pt|date=18 June 2015|accessdate=18 June 2015}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33187225|title=Southampton sign Cedric Soares from Sporting Lisbon|publisher=[[BBC Sport]]|date=18 June 2015|accessdate=18 June 2015}} He made his debut on 30 July, playing the full 90 minutes in a 3–0 win over [[Vitesse Arnhem]] at [[St. Mary's Stadium]] for the [[2015–16 UEFA Europa League|third qualifying round]] of the [[UEFA Europa League]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33667103|title=Southampton 3–0 Vitesse|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Williams|first=Adam|date=30 July 2015|accessdate=30 July 2015}} Ten days later he first appeared in the [[Premier League]], assisting the opening goal for [[Graziano Pellè]] in a 2–2 draw at [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] before being [[Substitute (association football)|substituted]] for [[Cuco Martina]] at half time.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33750572|title=Newcastle United 2–2 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Davis|first=Matt|date=9 August 2015|accessdate=9 August 2015}} Cédric scored his first goal for Southampton on 18 March 2018, in a 2–0 victory at [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] in the [[2017–18 FA Cup|sixth round]] of the [[FA Cup]], the first match under new manager [[Mark Hughes]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43361316|title=Wigan Athletic 0–2 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Sanders|first=Emma|date=18 March 2018|accessdate=19 March 2018}} ===Inter Milan=== On 26 January 2019, Cédric moved to [[Inter Milan]] on loan for the rest of [[2018–19 Serie A|the season]], with an option to purchase for £9.5m in the summer.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46998974|title=Cedric Soares: Southampton defender joins Inter Milan on loan|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Stone|first=Simon|date=26 January 2019|accessdate=27 January 2019}} He made his first appearance five days later, playing 15 minutes and converting his attempt in the 4–3 shootout loss against [[S.S. Lazio]] for [[2018–19 Coppa Italia|the quarterfinals]] of the [[Coppa Italia]] (1–1 after 120 minutes).{{cite news|url=http://www.corrieredellosport.it/news/calcio/coppa-italia/2019/01/31-52778815/coppa_italia_inter-lazio_4-5_dcr_icardi_replica_a_immobile_dal_dischetto_sbaglia_nainggolan/?cookieAccept|title=Coppa Italia, Inter-Lazio 4–5 dcr: Icardi replica a Immobile, dal dischetto sbaglia Nainggolan|trans-title=Italian Cup, Inter-Lazio 4–5 apk: Icardi answers Immobile, Nainggolan misses from the spot|newspaper=[[Corriere dello Sport – Stadio|Corriere dello Sport]]|language=it|date=31 January 2019|accessdate=31 January 2019}} ==International career== Cédric played ten times with the [[Portugal national under-21 football team|Portuguese under-21s]], his debut occurring on 1 September 2011 in a 2–0 win in [[Moldova national under-21 football team|Moldova]] for the [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship|2013 UEFA European Championship]] [[2013 UEFA European Under-21 Championship qualification|qualifiers]].{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2013/matches/round=2000192/match=2006904/postmatch/report/index.html|title=Portugal prove too good for Moldova|publisher=UEFA|date=1 September 2011|accessdate=25 June 2016}} His maiden appearance with the [[Portugal national football team|senior team]] was on 11 October 2014, as he started in a 1–2 [[Exhibition game|friendly]] defeat to [[France national football team|France]] in [[Paris]].{{cite web|url=https://relvado.sapo.pt/seleccao/cedric-na-selecao-chegou-minha-hora-500214|title=Cédric na seleção: "Chegou a minha hora"|trans-title=Cédric in the national team: "My time has come"|publisher=Relvado|language=pt|date=6 October 2014|accessdate=11 October 2014|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141020091233/http://relvado.sapo.pt/seleccao/cedric-na-selecao-chegou-minha-hora-500214|archivedate=20 October 2014|df=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/friendlies/season=2016/matches/round=2000543/match=2014077/postmatch/report/index.html|title=France get the better of Portugal|publisher=UEFA|date=11 October 2014|accessdate=13 October 2014}} Cédric was selected by manager [[Fernando Santos (Portuguese footballer)|Fernando Santos]] for his [[UEFA Euro 2016]] squad.{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/portugal/story/2874983/new-bayern-munich-signing-renato-sanches-picked-for-portugal-squad|title=Portugal name Bayern Munich signing Renato Sanches for Euros squad|publisher=[[ESPN FC]]|date=17 May 2016|accessdate=25 June 2016}} His first game in the tournament took place on 25 June, when he started alongside Southampton teammate [[José Fonte]] in the [[Single-elimination tournament|round-of-16]] clash against [[Croatia national football team|Croatia]] (1–0 win after [[Overtime (sports)|extra time]]).{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com//uefaeuro/season=2016/matches/round=2000744/match=2017998/postmatch/report/index.html#portugal+snatch+extra+time|title=Quaresma snatches extra-time win for Portugal|publisher=UEFA|date=25 June 2016|accessdate=26 June 2016}} He went on to retain his position until [[UEFA Euro 2016 Final|the final]], won at the expense of hosts France.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/36696772|title=Portugal 1–0 France|publisher=BBC Sport|last=McNulty|first=Phil|date=10 July 2016|accessdate=10 July 2016}} Cédric scored his first goal for his country on 17 June 2017, netting in the 86th minute of an eventual 2–2 group stage draw to [[Mexico national football team|Mexico]] at the [[2017 FIFA Confederations Cup]] at the [[Kazan Arena]] in Russia.{{cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/jun/18/portugal-mexico-confederations-cup-match-report|title= Héctor Moreno's stoppage-time header earns Mexico draw against Portugal|newspaper=[[The Guardian]]|last=Ames|first=Nick|date=18 June 2017|accessdate=18 June 2017}} In May 2018, he was named in Portugal's squad for the [[2018 FIFA World Cup]].{{cite web|url=https://www.sbs.com.au/news/portugal-world-cup-squad|title=Nearly half Portugal's Euro squad to miss World Cup|publisher=[[Special Broadcasting Service]]|date=17 May 2018|accessdate=17 May 2018}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 19 January 2019}}{{Soccerway|cedric-ricardo-alves-soares/134612|accessdate=12 August 2018}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center" !rowspan="2"|Club !rowspan="2"|Season !colspan=3|League !colspan="2"|Cup !colspan="2"|League Cup !colspan="2"|Europe !colspan="2"|Totals |- Lazio|Lazio]] | years3 = 2017– | caps3 = 41 | goals3 = 0 | clubs3 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | years4 = 2019– | caps4 = 2 | goals4 = 0 | clubs4 = → [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta Vigo]] (loan) | nationalyears1 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam1 = Netherlands U15 | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013–2014 | nationalteam2 = [[Netherlands national under-20 football team|Netherlands U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 6 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2015–2016 | nationalteam3 = [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 4 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2017– | nationalteam4 = [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] | nationalcaps4 = 6 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | club-update = 11:08, 09 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 00:28, 5 September 2018 (UTC) }} '''Wesley Hoedt''' ({{IPA-nl|ˈʋɛsli ˈɦut}}; born 6 March 1994) is a Dutch professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[centre back]] for Spanish [[La Liga]] club [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta Vigo]], on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] from English [[Premier League]] club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], and the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands national team]]. ==Career== ===AZ Alkmaar=== Hoedt was born in [[Alkmaar]] and is a product of the youth academy from [[AZ Alkmaar|AZ]]. On 12 December 2013, he made his first-team debut for AZ in the [[UEFA Europa League]] against [[PAOK FC|PAOK]]. He played the full game, which ended in a 2–2 draw.{{citation needed|date=January 2019}} For the [[2014–15 AZ Alkmaar season|2014–15 season]], Hoedt was promoted to the first team and named in the 24-man squad for the forthcoming season.{{cite web |url=http://www.az.nl/nieuws/az-werkt-met-kleinere-a-selectie/1?catid= |title=AZ werkt met kleinere A-selectie |publisher=AZ Alkmaar |language=Dutch |date=28 July 2014 |accessdate=7 July 2017}} ===Lazio=== Following Hoedt's departure from AZ in 2015, Italian [[Serie A]] club [[S.S. Lazio|Lazio]] signed him on a free transfer. The player signed a four-year contract worth €1.25m per season.{{cite news |url=http://www.gazzetta.it/Calciomercato/20-01-2015/lazio-hoedt-arrivo-roma-si-prova-chiudere-subito-100553617980.shtml |title=Lazio, Hoedt in serata Roma: si prova a chiudere subito |newspaper=La Gazzetta dello Sport |location=Milan |language=Italian |date=20 January 2015 |accessdate=7 July 2017}} He scored his first goal for the club on 21 August 2016 in a 4–3 away win over [[Atalanta B.C.|Atalanta]].{{cite web |url=http://www.legaseriea.it/en/serie-a/match-report/2016-17/UNICO/UNI/1/ATALAZ |title=Serie A TIM: Fixtures and Results: Season 2016–17: 1^ Match Day: Atalanta 3–4 Lazio |publisher=Lega Serie A |accessdate=25 January 2019}} ===Southampton=== On 22 August 2017, Hoedt signed for Southampton on a five-year deal reported to be €17 million (£15 million).{{cite web |url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2017-08-22/wesley-hoedt-signs-for-southampton |title=Wesley Hoedt signs for Saints |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=22 August 2017 |accessdate=22 August 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.football-italia.net/108610/official-hoedt-joins-southampton |title=Official: Hoedt joins Southampton – Football Italia |website=Football Italia |publisher=Tiro Media |accessdate=22 August 2017}} Hoedt joined Spanish [[La Liga]] club [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta Vigo]] on 22 January 2019 on [[Loan (sports)|loan]] until the end of the season, with an option to purchase.{{cite web |url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2019-01-22/wesley-hoedt-southampton-celta-vigo-loan-agreement |title=Hoedt makes Celta Vigo loan move |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=22 January 2019 |accessdate=25 January 2019}}.He made his debut on 27th of January in an away game against [[Real Valladolid]] where he was booked twice and sent off.{{cite web |url=https://talksport.com/football/482870/southampton-wesley-hoedt-sent-off-celta-vigo-debut/ |title=Southampton flop Wesley Hoedt sent off in nightmare Celta Vigo debut |publisher=Talk Sport |date=27 January 2019 |accessdate=9 February 2019}} ==Career statistics== ===Club=== {{updated|match played 27 January 2019}} {| class=wikitable nationalgoals6 = 1 | nationalgoals7 = 12 | club-update = 11:55, 3 March 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 23:36, 21 March 2019 (UTC) }} '''Steven Davis''' {{post-nominals|country=GBR|MBE}} (born 1 January 1985) is a Northern Irish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Scottish Premiership]] club [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and the [[Captain (association football)|captain]] of the [[Northern Ireland national football team|Northern Ireland national team]]. Davis made his full international debut in 2005 and has since been capped 100 times at senior level, scoring ten goals. He captained his nation at [[UEFA Euro 2016]]. Davis began his career with Premier League club [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in 2004. He was named "Young Player of the Year", "The Fans Player of the Year" and "Player of the Year" for the 2005–06 season after making 42 appearances during the season. Davis was sold to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] for £4 million in the summer of 2007, but moved on loan to Scottish club [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] in January 2008 for an initial six months. He was part of the team that reached the [[2008 UEFA Cup Final]] and that won the [[2007–08 Scottish League Cup]] and [[2007–08 Scottish Cup]]. At the end of the season, he moved permanently to Rangers for £3 million. He made 211 appearances for the Glasgow club, winning three consecutive league titles in [[2008–09 in Scottish football|2009]], [[2009–10 in Scottish football|2010]] and [[2010–11 in Scottish football|2011]], two [[Scottish Cup]]s and three [[Scottish League Cup|League Cup]]s. Following the club's insolvency in 2012, Davis exercised his rights under [[Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006|TUPE regulations]] to rescind his contract and become a free agent, returning to the Premier League with Southampton. ==Club career== ===Aston Villa=== [[File:Stevis.jpg|thumb|upright|Davis warming up for [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in 2007]] Davis, who was born in [[Ballymena]], County Antrim, started his career at St Andrews Boys Club before transferring to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]] in 2002.{{cite web |url=http://www.irishfa.com/international/squad-profiles/profile/2014/senior/steven-davis-midfielder/ |title=Profile of Steven Davis |publisher=Irish Football Association |accessdate=12 May 2011}} He was a member of the 2002 [[FA Youth Cup]] winning team that beat [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] 4–2 in the final.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/1995546.stm |title=Villa lift FA Youth Cup |date=18 May 2002 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 May 2011}} His first professional appearance was on 18 September 2004, he was a 57th-minute replacement for [[Nolberto Solano]] in a goalless [[Premier League]] match against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] at [[Carrow Road]].{{ Cite news | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/3647082.stm | title=Norwich 0–0 Aston Villa | publisher= BBC Sport | date= 18 September 2004}} Davis made 28 league appearances across the [[2004–05 Premier League|season]], scoring the winner in a 3–2 comeback victory at [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] on 16 April 2005.{{cite news |title=Southampton 2–3 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/4427547.stm |accessdate=9 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=16 April 2005}} On 13 August 2005, in Villa's first game of the new campaign, Davis volleyed past [[Jussi Jääskeläinen]] to secure a 2–2 home draw against [[Bolton Wanderers]], albeit after nine minutes.{{cite news |title=Aston Villa 2–2 Bolton |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/4126966.stm |accessdate=9 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 August 2005}} He scored twice on 20 September in the third round of the [[Football League Cup]], as Villa won 8–3 at [[Wycombe Wanderers]].{{cite news |title=Wycombe 3–8 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/league_cup/4258542.stm |accessdate=9 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 September 2005}} By October 2005, he was a regular for the club and missed only one game for Villa in the [[2005–06 Aston Villa F.C. season|2005–06 season]]. Davis was named Villa's "Young Player of the Year", "The Fans Player of the Year" ''and'' "Player of the Year" for the 2005–06 season.{{cite web |url=http://www.irishfa.com/news/item/2176/davis-cleans-up-at-villa-awards/ |title=Davis cleans up at Villa awards |date=5 May 2006 |publisher=Irish Football Association |accessdate=12 May 2011}} His form prompted the Northern Ireland manager [[Lawrie Sanchez]], to state that Davis could be "another [[Frank Lampard]]".{{cite news |title=Sanchez says Davis could emulate Lampard |work=The Independent |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/sport/football/international/sanchez-says-davis-could-emulate-lampard-318798.html |date=20 August 2005 |first=Kieran |last=Daley |accessdate=5 December 2013}} Davis made 102 appearances for Villa and scored nine times.{{Soccerbase season|35928|2007|name=Steven Davis Aston Villa Stats|access-date=12 May 2011}} On 2 January 2006, he headed the first goal of a 2–1 win at rivals [[West Bromwich Albion]].{{cite news |title=West Brom 1–2 Aston Villa |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_prem/4562606.stm |accessdate=9 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 January 2006}} ===Fulham=== In the summer of 2007, Davis followed teammate [[Aaron Hughes]] to [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] on 5 July 2007 to team up with international manager Sanchez, for a fee of around £4 million.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/f/fulham/6270420.stm |title=Fulham complete £4m Davis swoop |publisher=BBC Sport |date=5 July 2007}} He made his Fulham debut against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] on 12 August 2007 and made 22 appearances for Fulham before moving to Rangers.{{Soccerbase season|35928|2007|access-date=12 May 2011}}{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/rangers/7221249.stm |title=Fulham's Davis loaned to Rangers |publisher=BBC Sport |date=31 January 2008}} ===Rangers=== On 31 January 2008, Davis was signed on a six-month loan by [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]], the club he supported as a boy. Davis made his Rangers debut against [[Panathinaikos F.C.|Panathinaikos]] in the [[UEFA Europa League|UEFA Cup]] on 13 February.{{ Cite news | url=http://newsimg.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7236378.stm | title=Rangers 0–0 Panathinaikos | publisher=BBC Sport | date=13 February 2008}} He scored his first goal, again in European competition, against German team [[SV Werder Bremen|Werder Bremen]].{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7272692.stm |title=Rangers 2–0 Werder Bremen |publisher=BBC Sport |date=6 March 2008 |first=Colin |last=Moffat |accessdate=22 September 2008}} Davis scored for Rangers in the penalty shootout against [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]] that won Rangers the [[2008 Scottish League Cup Final|League Cup]].{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2008/mar/16/minutebyminute.sport2 |title=Dundee United 2–2 Rangers |date=16 March 2008 |work=The Guardian |accessdate=5 December 2013}} He also helped the team reach the [[2008 UEFA Cup Final]],{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/europe/7393752.stm |title=Zenit St Petersburg 2–0 Rangers |date=14 May 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=5 May 2011}} and won the [[2008 Scottish Cup Final|Scottish Cup]] in May.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_cups/7418513.stm |title=Scottish Cup final as it happened |date=24 May 2008 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=5 May 2011}} Davis made his move from Fulham permanent on 21 August 2008, in a transfer worth £3 million, signing a four-year contract.{{cite news |date=21 August 2008 |title=Fulham's Davis moves to Rangers |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/rangers/7565732.stm |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=22 August 2008}} He made his first appearance of the season for Rangers against [[Aberdeen F.C.|Aberdeen]], during a 1–1 draw the day after he permanently signed.{{ Cite news | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/7575840.stm | title=Aberdeen 1–1 Rangers | publisher= BBC Sport | date= 23 August 2008}} Davis scored his first goal for Rangers, since his move became permanent, against [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]].{{Cite web |url=http://www.rangers.co.uk/match/match-reports/2008-09/item/1650-rangers-2-1-motherwell |title=Rangers 2–1 Motherwell |accessdate=5 December 2013 |first=Andrew |last=Dickson |publisher=Rangers F.C. |date=21 September 2008 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222064140/http://www.rangers.co.uk/match/match-reports/2008-09/item/1650-rangers-2-1-motherwell |archivedate=22 February 2014}} He scored the only goal in the final [[Old Firm]] derby of the season on 9 May 2009, to take Rangers to the top of the SPL by two points.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/8032832.stm |title=Rangers 1–0 Celtic |date=9 May 2009 |publisher=BBC |accessdate=5 May 2011}} Davis won the SPL title and [[Scottish Cup]] with Rangers in the 2008–09 season.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/rangers/5413108/Rangers-1-Falkirk-0-Scottish-Cup-Final-2009-match-report.html |title=Rangers 1 Falkirk 0: Match report |last=Forsyth |first=Roddy |date=30 May 2009 |work=The Daily Telegraph |accessdate=12 May 2011}} Davis began his goalscoring in the 2009–10 season against St. Mirren on 27 January.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/8480383.stm |title=St Mirren 0–2 Rangers |date=27 January 2010 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 May 2011}} He continued his goalscoring form against Falkirk in the next game, curling a free kick into [[Bobby Olejnik]]'s top right hand corner.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/8485445.stm |title=Rangers 3–0 Falkirk |date=30 January 2010 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 May 2011}} Davis's performances in January 2010, earned him the SPL Player of the Month award. He was also named [[PFA Scotland Players' Player of the Year]] on 2 May 2010. and won the SPL and Scottish League Cup each for the second time.{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/r/rangers/8657569.stm |date=2 May 2010 |publisher=BBC Sport |title=Davis crowned player of the year}} Davis scored his first goal of the 2010–11 season against Motherwell at [[Ibrox Stadium|Ibrox]] in October 2010, when he collected the ball 30 yards from goal before striking it into the top corner.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2010/oct/16/rangers-motherwell-scottish-premier-league |title=Four-goal Rangers make Motherwell pay for snatching early lead |last=Murray |first=Ewan |date=16 October 2010 |work=The Guardian |accessdate=5 December 2013}} The goal drew comparisons to former Rangers favourite [[Ian Durrant]]. Davis followed this up by scoring the winning goal in the match against Inverness at Ibrox in January 2011.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/9364318.stm |title=Rangers 1–0 Inverness CT |date=18 January 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 May 2011}} In the [[2011 Scottish League Cup Final]] against [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]], Davis opened the scoring in a match, which Rangers won 2–1 after extra time.{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/sport/football/teams/rangers/8394485/Celtic-1-Rangers-2-match-report.html |title=Celtic 1 Rangers 2: match report |last=Forsyth |first=Roddy |date=20 March 2011 |work=The Daily Telegraph |accessdate=12 May 2011}} This was the third time he had won the Scottish League Cup. Davis scored in back-to-back games in the 2011 title run in against Motherwell,{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/9470831.stm |title=Motherwell 0–5 Rangers |date=30 April 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 May 2011}} and then Hearts,{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/9476492.stm |title=Rangers 4–0 Hearts |date=7 May 2011 |publisher=BBC |accessdate=15 May 2011}} before playing his 54th, and final game of the season in a 5–1 win over Kilmarnock, as Rangers won their 3rd consecutive SPL championship.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/scot_prem/9484609.stm |title=Kilmarnock 1–5 Rangers |date=15 May 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=15 May 2011}} On 19 July 2011, Davis signed a new five-year contract with Rangers.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14208625.stm |title=Steven Davis signs new five-year deal at Rangers |date=19 July 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=19 July 2011}} He was made Rangers temporary captain, with the absence of formal club captain [[David Weir (Scottish footballer)|David Weir]] for the first part of the 2011–12 season.{{cite web |url=http://www.football365.com/rangers/7108265/Weir-important-to-Gers-Davis |title=Weir important to Rangers – Davis |date=17 August 2011 |publisher=Football 365 |accessdate=5 December 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131215124117/http://www.football365.com/rangers/7108265/Weir-important-to-Gers-Davis |archivedate=15 December 2013}} Davis scored his first goal of the 2011–12 season in a 2–0 win over Aberdeen at Ibrox in August.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14606044.stm |title=Rangers 2–0 Aberdeen |date=28 August 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 September 2011}} In the first Old Firm match of the 2011–12 season, Davis provided two assists in the game, as Rangers beat Celtic 4–2.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/14965579.stm |title=Ally McCoist praises Rangers players for second-half display |date=18 September 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 September 2011}} After Rangers beat Dunfermline 4–0 at East End Park, Rangers manager [[Ally McCoist]] praised Davis's performance by saying "It was a captain's performance from the best player on the park."{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15048580.stm |title=Manager McCoist delighted with Rangers reaction |date=24 September 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 September 2011}} For his performances during September 2011, he received the SPL Player of the Month award.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/15307172.stm |title=McCoist and Davis net SPL awards double for Rangers |date=14 October 2011 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=14 October 2011}} Following the insolvency of Rangers in 2012, Davis exercised his rights under [[Transfer of Undertakings (Protection of Employment) Regulations 2006|TUPE regulations]] to rescind his contract and become a free agent.{{cite news |url=http://sport.stv.tv/football/clubs/rangers/108094-steven-davis-becomes-seventh-rangers-player-to-refuse-newco-switch/ |title=Davis and McGregor become latest Rangers players to refuse newco switch |publisher=STV Sport |date=26 June 2012}} [[PFA Scotland]] had previously commented that players were entitled to become [[free agent]]s if they objected to the transfer to the new company formed by Charles Green.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18446597 |title=Rangers: Players free not to join 'newco' says law expert |publisher=BBC Sport |date=14 June 2012 |accessdate=24 June 2012}} ===Southampton=== [[File:Steven Davis 2016.jpg|thumb|upright|Davis playing for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2016]] Davis rejected the chance to stay with Rangers and instead signed a three-year contract with Premier League club Southampton on 6 July 2012.{{cite web |title=Saints Sign Steven Davis |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/saints-sign-steven-davis-221927.aspx?pageView=full#anchored |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=6 July 2012 |date=5 December 2013}}{{cite web |title=Rangers captain Steven Davis signs for Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18748689 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=7 July 2012 |date=6 July 2012}} The deal was subsequently extended to 2016 as part of the agreement with Rangers to complete the transfer without the need for the international transfer clearance to be agreed by FIFA, with the two clubs agreeing a fee.{{cite web |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~2855765,00.html |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120723224957/http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10280~2855765,00.html |archivedate=23 July 2012 |title=Rangers Clear Saints' Davis Deal |publisher=Southampton F.C. |date=21 July 2012 |accessdate=5 December 2013}}{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/18937843 |title=Southampton agree fee with Rangers for Steven Davis |date=21 July 2012}} After joining Southampton, Davis pleaded the Rangers fans to agree with his decision to leave but accepted that a minority of fans would take a different view{{cite news |title=Rangers in crisis: Steven Davis fears fans won't forgive him after Southampton switch |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/rangers-in-crisis-steven-davis-fears-1166308 |work=Daily Record |location=Scotland |date=8 July 2012 |accessdate=26 August 2012}} and made his explanation he left Rangers in order to revive his football career.{{cite news |title=I had to end my Ibrox hell, says Southampton new boy Steven Davis |url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/steven-davis-why-i-had-to-leave-rangers-1187548 |work=Daily Record |location=Scotland |date=29 July 2012 |accessdate=26 August 2012}} He made his debut on 19 August 2012, and scored to put the team ahead at holders [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] only three minutes after coming on as a substitute, but Southampton eventually lost 3–2.{{cite web |title=Man City 3 – 2 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19231354 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=19 August 2012 |accessdate=25 August 2012}} His only other goal of the season came against the same opposition, in a 3–1 home win on 13 February 2013.{{cite news |last1=Bevan |first1=Chris |title=Southampton 3–1 Man City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/21311313 |accessdate=9 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=9 February 2013}} His first two goals of the 2013–14 season came in a 5–1 victory at [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]] in the League Cup second round on 27 August, the latter being a penalty.{{cite news |title=Barnsley 1–5 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23763998 |accessdate=9 October 2015 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=27 August 2013}} On 17 October 2014, Davis signed a new contract to keep him at Southampton until 2018.{{cite news |title=Southampton: Steven Davis extends contract until 2018 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29663796 |accessdate=17 October 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 October 2014}} On 8 May 2016, Davis scored his first ever league brace for Southampton in a 2–1 win over [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] at [[White Hart Lane]].{{cite web |title=Tottenham Hotspur 1–2 Southampton |date=8 May 2016 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36180830 |work=''BBC Sport'' |accessdate=9 May 2016}} He followed this up with a goal in a 4–1 victory over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on the final day of the season.{{cite web |last1=Oscroft |first1=Tim |title=Southampton 2 Crystal Palace 1 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240425 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=18 June 2016 |date=15 May 2016}} On 18 June 2016, he signed a new three-year contract, extending his stay with the club until 2019.{{cite web |title=Davis signs new Saints deal until 2019 |url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/20160618-announcement-steven-davis-contract-southampton-2019-3145943.aspx |publisher=Southampton F.C. |accessdate=18 June 2016 |date=18 June 2016}} He made his 200th Southampton appearance on 16 September 2017 against Crystal Palace, scoring the only goal in a 1–0 victory.{{cite web |last1=Reddy |first1=Luke |title=Crystal Palace 0–1 Southampton |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41210053 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=17 September 2017 |date=16 September 2017}} ===Return to Rangers (loan) === On 6 January 2019, Davis returned to [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] on a six-month loan.{{cite web |title=Rangers Sign Steven Davis|url=https://rangers.co.uk/news/headlines/rangers-sign-steven-davis/ |publisher=Rangers F.C. |accessdate=6 January 2019 |date=6 January 2019}} ==International career== Davis made his full international debut on 9 February 2005 in a 1–0 loss to [[Canada men's national soccer team|Canada]], and made the [[assist (soccer)|assist]] for [[David Healy (footballer)|David Healy]] in [[Northern Ireland national football team|Northern Ireland]]'s famous 1–0 victory over [[English national football team|England]] in a [[Football World Cup 2006 (qualification UEFA)|2006 World Cup qualification match]] on 7 September.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/4212920.stm |title=Northern Ireland 1–0 England |date=7 September 2005 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 May 2011}} Davis' first goal came against [[Wales national football team|Wales]] in a 3–2 home defeat in another qualifier on 8 October.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/4322378.stm |title=N Ireland 2–3 Wales |date=8 October 2005 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 May 2011}} He was also part of the team who beat [[Spain national football team|Spain]] 3–2 at [[Windsor Park]] in September 2006.{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/internationals/5321964.stm |title=Northern Ireland 3–2 Spain |date=6 September 2006 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 May 2011}} On 21 May 2006, he became Northern Ireland's youngest modern day [[Captain (association football)|captain]] against [[Uruguay national football team|Uruguay]] in the United States, a 1–0 loss.{{cite web |url=http://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2007/july/05/fulham-sign-davis |title=Fulham Sign Davis |date=5 July 2007 |publisher=Fulham F.C. |accessdate=5 December 2013}}{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/photo_galleries/5005912.stm |title=NI v Uruguay photos |date=22 May 2006 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=12 May 2011}} On 8 October 2015, Davis scored twice in a 3–1 victory over [[Greece national football team|Greece]] to help Northern Ireland qualify for the final tournament of [[UEFA Euro 2016|Euro 2016]], their first European Championship.{{cite web |title=Northern Ireland 3 Greece 1 |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33543829 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=9 October 2015 |date=8 October 2015}} ==Personal life== Davis was appointed [[Member of the Order of the British Empire]] (MBE) in the [[2017 Birthday Honours]] for services to football.{{London Gazette |issue=61962 |supp=y |page=B17 |date=17 June 2017}} ==Career statistics== {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2016}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Sam McQueen | image = Sam McQueen v Augsburg 2017.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = McQueen playing for [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2017 | fullname = Samuel James McQueen{{cite news |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2013-14/sep/premier-league-squad-lists-201314.html |title=Barclays Premier League Squad Lists 2013/14 are revealed |publisher=[[Premier League]] |date=4 September 2013 |accessdate=15 February 2014 }} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1995|2|6|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Southampton]], England | height = 1.81m{{cite web |url= http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/sam-mcqueen |title= Premier League Player Profile Sam McQueen |website= Premier League |publisher= Barclays Premier League|accessdate= 12 January 2015}} | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Left back]] / [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]] | currentclub = [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]]
(on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]) | clubnumber = 14 | youthyears1 = 2003–2014 | youthclubs1 = [[Southampton F.C. Academy|Southampton]] | years1 = 2014– | clubs1 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps1 = 19 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2016 | clubs2 = → [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] (loan) | caps2 = 18 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2018– | clubs3 = → [[Middlesbrough FC|Middlesbrough]] (loan) | caps3 = 5 | goals3 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2017 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | medaltemplates = | club-update = 17:00, 15 December 2018 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 04:54, 28 March 2017 (UTC) }} '''Samuel James McQueen''' (born 6 February 1995) is an English [[association football|footballer]] who plays for [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. A native of the city of [[Southampton]], McQueen joined the [[Southampton F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Southampton Academy]] at the age of eight and has remained with the club ever since. Handed his senior debut for the club in 2014, he plays primarily as a left-sided [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|full back]] or [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]]. ==Early life== McQueen was born in [[Southampton]]{{cite news |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/11014622.Youth_focus_will_be_key_for_remainder_of_season__says_Saints__assistant_manager/ |title=Youth focus will be key for remainder of season, says Saints' assistant manager |publisher=[[Southern Daily Echo]] |date=17 February 2014 |accessdate=17 February 2014 }} and attended [[The Mountbatten School]] in [[Romsey]], [[Hampshire]].{{cite news |url=http://content.yudu.com/Library/A1xl0z/Summer2012Newsletter/resources/17.htm |title=Summer Term 2012 Newsletter |publisher=[[The Mountbatten School]] |date=July 2012 |accessdate=17 February 2014 }} He was scouted by [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] when he was eight years old whilst playing for Oakwood Rangers, a local youth side.{{cite news | title = Oakwood Under 8s (Photograph ref code h9a75814) | pages = 20 | newspaper = Southern Daily Echo | location = Southampton | date = January 2003 }} He was part of the Southampton FC Academy U13 side that were runners up in the prestigious Dr Pepper [[Dallas Cup]] Tournament in Texas where they lost 1–0 to FC Barcelona California in 2008.{{cite web |url=http://www.dallascup.com/schedules/XXIX/9078871.html |title=2008 Dr Pepper Dallas Cup XXIX: Southampton FC |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141218192632/http://www.dallascup.com/schedules/XXIX/9078871.html |archivedate=18 December 2014 |df=dmy-all }} The same team included other academy products [[James Ward-Prowse]], [[Luke Shaw]], [[Calum Chambers]], [[Harrison Reed (footballer)|Harrison Reed]], [[Jordan Turnbull]] and [[Jake Sinclair]], all who gained professional contracts in later years with the club.{{cite news |url=http://metro.co.uk/2013/08/30/mauricios-minors-saints-academy-is-the-best-in-the-league-3941415/ |title=Mauricio's minors: Saints Academy is the best in the league |publisher=[[Metro (British newspaper)|Metro]] |accessdate=17 February 2014 |date=30 August 2013 }} ==Club career== McQueen was named in the Southampton senior team for the first time on 15 February 2014 for the [[FA Cup]] fifth round match against [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] at the [[Stadium of Light]]; he came on in the second half for his debut, playing the last eight minutes of the 0–1 defeat, in place of [[Adam Lallana]].{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26094161 |title=Sunderland 1–0 Southampton |publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=15 February 2014 |accessdate=15 February 2014 }} McQueen signed a new four-year contract on 17 June 2014.{{cite web|title=McQueen signs four year contract|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/17062014-sam-mcqueen-signs-four-year-contract-1647510.aspx|publisher=Southampton FC|accessdate=17 June 2014|date=17 June 2014}} In January 2016, McQueen completed a loan move to [[EFL League One|League One]] side [[Southend United F.C.|Southend United]] until the end of the season.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35371805 |title=Sam McQueen: Southend United sign Southampton midfielder|publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=21 January 2016 |accessdate=21 January 2016 }}{{cite web|title=McQueen joins Southend on loan| url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/20160121-sam-mcqueen-southampton-southend-united-loan-2914156.aspx|publisher=Southampton FC|accessdate=21 January 2016|date=21 January 2016}} He made his league debut in the 3–0 home win over [[Coventry City F.C.|Coventry City]], coming on as a [[Substitute (association football)|substitute]] in the 86th minute.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35330856 |title=Southend United 3–0 Coventry City – BBC Sport|publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=26 January 2016 |accessdate=21 January 2016 }} He scored his first league goal as a professional 11 days later in his first full league start in the [[Essex derby]] against [[Colchester United F.C.|Colchester United]] on his 21st birthday.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/35447390 |title=Southend United 3–0 Colchester United – BBC Sport|publisher=[[BBC Sport]] |date=6 February 2016 |accessdate=6 February 2016}} He made his [[Premier League]] debut for Southampton on 16 October 2016, when he replaced [[Matt Targett (footballer)|Matt Targett]] at left-back after 14 minutes of a 3–1 win over [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]], winning a penalty for the third goal.{{cite web|title=Southampton 3 Burnley 1| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37599421 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=17 October 2016|date=16 October 2016}} Four days later he made his [[2016–17 UEFA Europa League]] debut and first senior start for the ''Saints'' on 20 October versus [[Inter Milan]] at the [[San Siro]].{{cite web|title=Sam McQueen still coming to terms with starring role as Southampton understudy| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3860352/Sam-McQueen-coming-terms-starring-role-Southampton-understudy.html|publisher=Daily Mirror|accessdate=21 October 2016|date=20 October 2016}} This was followed three days later by his first league start for them in a 1–1 away draw with [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].{{cite web|title=Manchester City 1 Southampton 1| url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37670364 |publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=24 October 2016|date=23 October 2016}} On 5 December 2016, McQueen signed a new long-term contract with Southampton, penning a deal until 2021.{{cite news|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11661/10684590/southampton-winger-sam-mcqueen-signs-new-long-term-contract|title=Southampton full-back Sam McQueen signs new long-term contract|website=Sky Sports|last=Vinnell|first=Paul|date=5 December 2016|accessdate=8 December 2016}} On 30 August 2018, McQueen signed for [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]] on a season-long loan.{{cite web |title=Sam McQueen: Middlesbrough sign Southampton defender on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45357102 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=30 August 2018 |date=30 August 2018}} ==International career== McQueen received his first call-up for the [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21]] side as a squad member for a pair of friendly matches against [[Germany national under-21 football team|Germany]] and [[Denmark national under-21 football team|Denmark]] in March 2017.{{cite web|title=Aidy Boothroyd names U21s squad to face Germany and Denmark|url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/mar/16/england-under-21s-squad-aidy-boothroyd-germany-denmark-160317 |publisher=[[The Football Association]] |accessdate=16 March 2017|date=16 March 2017}} McQueen was an unused substitute in the Germany match{{cite web|title=Germany U21 1–0 England U21|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39302161|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=28 March 2017|date=24 March 2017}} but was handed his debut on 27 March, starting at left back in the game against Denmark. [[Aidy Boothroyd]], the manager, was quoted as saying "Sam McQueen was excellent" in the 4–0 victory against Denmark.{{cite web | title=Enngland under-21s boss Aidy Boothroyd happy with his squad's progress in March games | url=http://www.thefa.com/news/2017/mar/27/aidy-boothroyd-england-under-21s-denmark-reaction-270317 | publisher=[[The Football Association]] |accessdate=28 March 2017|date=27 March 2017}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|31 October 2018}} {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and goals by club, season and competition |- !rowspan="2"|Club {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2016}} {{Use British English|date=June 2016}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Jake Hesketh | image = | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Jake Alexander Hesketh{{cite web |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=15 September 2016}} | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1996|3|27|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Jake Hesketh|url=http://www.11v11.com/players/jake-hesketh-248219/|publisher=11v11 |accessdate=3 January 2016}} | birth_place = [[Stockport]], England | height = {{convert|1.68|m}} | position = [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]]
(on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]) | clubnumber = 11 | youthyears1 = 2006–2014 | youthclubs1 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | years1 = 2014– | clubs1 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps1 = 2 | goals1 = 0 | years2 = 2018–2019 | clubs2 = → [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] (loan) | caps2 = 16 | goals2 = 1 | years3 = 2019– | clubs3 = → [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] (loan) | caps3 = 4 | goals3 = 2 | nationalyears1 = | nationalteam1 = | nationalcaps1 = | nationalgoals1 = | club-update = 18:22, 16 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = }} '''Jake Alexander Hesketh''' (born 27 March 1996){{cite web|title=J. Hesketh profile |url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/jake-alexander-hesketh/392517|website=uk.soccerway.com|accessdate=9 December 2014}} is an English professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]. ==Club career== ===Southampton=== Hesketh was born in [[Stockport]], Greater Manchester, but his family moved to [[Whiteley]], near [[Fareham]], Hampshire when he was six months old.{{cite web|last1=Walter|first1=Simon|title=St Mary's debut v Manchester United caps meteoric rise of Southampton FC teenager Jake Hesketh|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/11655826.Saints_starlet_s_rise_from_youth_football_to_the_Premier_League_in_a_year/|publisher=Daily Echo|accessdate=16 May 2016|location=Southampton|date=10 December 2014}} Hesketh joined [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]'s academy as an under-nine after being scouted at a local tournament playing for Crofton Saints Football Club. He studied at Whiteley Primary School before moving onto [[Swanmore College]].{{cite web|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/youth/u21-profiles/ |title=Development Squad Profiles |publisher=Southampton FC|date= |accessdate=12 January 2016}} He completed a two-year scholarship with the club and after finishing as the Under-18 team's top scorer was awarded the [[Southampton F.C. Player of the Season|2013–14 Scholar of the Season]] accolade at the Southampton club awards ceremony. The same day Hesketh signed a three-year professional contract to keep him at the club until 2017.{{cite web|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/07052014-jake-hesketh-201314-scholar-of-the-season-1541521.aspx |title= Jake Hesketh vows to push on after being crowned 2013/14 Scholar of the Season |publisher=Southampton FC |date=7 May 2014 |accessdate=12 January 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Urquhart-Cannon|first1=Alex|title=Hesketh pens professional deal|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/06052014-jake-hesketh-signs-pro-deal-1539585.aspx|accessdate=13 December 2014|publisher=Southampton FC |date=6 May 2014}} He was promoted into the first team by coach [[Ronald Koeman]] due to injury problems among the squad.{{cite web|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/20141207-ronald-koeman-pre-manchester-united-home-youth-2128992.aspx |title=Saints could give youth a chance for Utd game |last1=Lucas |first1=Jim |publisher=Southampton FC |date=8 December 2014 |accessdate=8 December 2014 |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} He made his debut for the club on 8 December 2014 in a [[Premier League]] match against [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], being brought in as a substitute for [[Dušan Tadić (footballer)|Dušan Tadić]] in the 70th minute of the 2–1 home defeat.{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/live/2014/dec/08/southampton-manchester-united-premier-league-live |title=Southampton 1–2 Manchester United: Premier League – as it happened |last1=Burnton |first1=Simon |work=The Guardian |date=8 December 2014 |accessdate=8 December 2014 |archiveurl= |archivedate= }} Five days later Hesketh made his first [[Premier League]] start as Southampton lost 1–0 away to [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].{{cite web |title=Burnley 1–0 Southampton|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30357668|accessdate=13 December 2014|publisher=BBC Sport |date=13 December 2014}} Hesketh made 22 appearances for [[Martin Hunter (football coach)|Martin Hunter]]'s Under-21s in 2014–15, scoring two goals and lifting the [[U21 Premier League Cup|2015 U21 Premier League Cup]].{{cite web|url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2014-15/apr/210415-u21pl-cup-southampton-vs-blackburn-report.html |title=Southampton v Blackburn Rovers report | Under-21 Premier League Cup final |website=Premierleague.com |date= |accessdate=12 January 2016}}{{cite news|last=Singer |first=Jonny |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-3047856/Southampton-clinch-Premier-League-U21-Cup-Sam-Gallagher-extra-time-stunner.html |title=Southampton clinch Premier League U21 Cup after Sam Gallagher extra-time stunner |work=Daily Mail |date=29 April 2015 |accessdate=12 January 2016}} He scored his first senior goal on 22 September 2016, in a 2–0 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] in the EFL Cup.{{cite web|title=Southampton 2 Crystal Palace 0|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37357875|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=22 September 2016|date=21 September 2016}}{{cite news|last1=Leitch|first1=Adam|title=Jake Hesketh scored his first senior goal as Southampton beat Crystal Palace 2–0 at St Mary's|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/saints/news/14756790.Hesketh_gives_Puel_a_problem/?ref=mac|accessdate=22 September 2016|work=Daily Echo|date=22 September 2016}} ===Burton Albion (loan)=== On 30 August 2018, Hesketh signed for [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]] on a loan deal until 2 January 2019.{{cite web |title=Brewers Sign Saints Duo on Loan |url=https://www.burtonalbionfc.co.uk/news/2018/august/3008-signings/ |publisher=Burton Albion F.C. |accessdate=31 August 2018 |date=30 August 2018}}{{cite web |title=Burton Albion sign Jake Hesketh, Jake Flannigan and Devante Cole on loan |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45358055 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=31 August 2018 |date=30 August 2018}} He scored his first league goal in a 2–2 draw at [[Portsmouth F.C.|Portsmouth]] on 23 October 2018.{{cite web |title=Portsmouth 2–2 Burton Albion |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/45871931 |publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=25 October 2018 |date=23 October 2018}} ===Milton Keynes Dons (loan)=== On 31 January 2019, Hesketh joined [[EFL League Two|League Two]] club [[Milton Keynes Dons F.C.|Milton Keynes Dons]] on loan for the remainder of the [[2018–19 Milton Keynes Dons F.C. season|2018–19]] season.{{Cite web |url=https://www.mkdons.com/news/2019/january/hesketh-heads-to-mk-dons/ |title=Hesketh heads to MK Dons |publisher=Milton Keynes Dons |date=31 January 2019 |accessdate=31 January 2019 }} ==Career statistics== {{updated|16 February 2019}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" |+ Appearances and {{Infobox football biography | name = Sofiane Boufal | image = Sofiane Boufal v Augsburg 2017.jpg | caption = Boufal with [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] in 2017 | fullname = Sofiane Boufal{{cite web |title=Squads for 2016/17 Premier League confirmed |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/84136 |publisher=Premier League |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=11 September 2016}} | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|9|17|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Paris]], France | height = {{height|m=1.75}} | position = [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] | currentclub = [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta]]
(on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]) | clubnumber = 19 | youthyears1 = 2010–2012 | youthclubs1 = [[Angers SCO|Angers]] | years1 = 2012–2015 | clubs1 = [[Angers SCO|Angers B]] | caps1 = 29 | goals1 = 5 | years2 = 2012–2015 | clubs2 = [[Angers SCO|Angers]] | caps2 = 46 | goals2 = 4 | years3 = 2015–2016 | clubs3 = [[Lille OSC|Lille]] | caps3 = 43 | goals3 = 14 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps4 = 50 | goals4 = 3 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = → [[RC Celta de Vigo|Celta]] (loan) | caps5 = 19 | goals5 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2016– | nationalteam1 = [[Morocco national football team|Morocco]] | nationalcaps1 = 5 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | club-update = 11:33, 31 January 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 31 May 2017 }} '''Sofiane Boufal''' ({{lang-ar|سيفان بوفال}}; born 17 September 1993) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as an [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|attacking midfielder]] for [[Real Club Celta de Vigo|Celta Vigo]] on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] and the [[Morocco national football team|Morocco national team]]. ==Club career== ===Angers=== Boufal came through the [[Angers SCO|Angers]] youth system, making his debut for the club at the age of 18, replacing [[Rayan Frikeche]] in the closing stages of a 1–0 home loss to [[FC Istres]] in August 2012. He made his first ever professional start the next [[Ligue 2]] season, in a 4–2 win away at [[FC Istres]], becoming a regular that season, making 31 appearances in all competitions. In the 2014–15 season, he helped [[Angers SCO|Angers]] win promotion to [[Ligue 1]]. He racked up a total of 4 goals in 16 appearances in the first half of the season, before attracting interest from [[Ligue 1]] clubs. ===Lille=== On 9 January 2015, Boufal transferred to [[Lille OSC|Lille]] in Ligue 1, instantly making an impression, scoring 3 goals in 14 league games.{{Soccerbase season|80669|2014|access-date=7 July 2016}} The next season, he continued to impress, scoring 12 goals in 35 appearances in all competitions and attracted interest from some of the biggest clubs around the world.{{Soccerbase season|80669|2015|access-date=7 July 2016}} ===Southampton=== On 29 August 2016, [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] announced they had signed Boufal on a five-year contract for a club-record undisclosed fee.{{cite web|url=http://www.saintsfc.co.uk/news/article/2016-17/20160829-sofiane-boufal-announcement-southampton-lille-3278679.aspx|title= Sofiane Boufal joins Southampton from Lille on five-year contract|date=29 August 2016| publisher=Southampton F.C.|access-date=29 August 2016}} The fee was reported as [[Pound sterling|£]]16 million, slightly more than the £15 million paid to [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] for [[Dani Osvaldo]] in October 2013.{{cite web|last1=Thomas|first1=Lall|title=Southampton confirm signing of Sofiane Boufal - Sky sources believe it to be for club record £16m|url=http://www.skysports.com/football/news/11700/10556970/southampton-are-closing-in-on-a-deal-for-sofiane-boufalS|accessdate=29 August 2016|publisher=Sky Sports|date=29 August 2016}}{{cite web|title=Sofiane Boufal: Southampton break transfer record to sign midfielder from Lille|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37184192|accessdate=29 August 2016|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 August 2016}} In the 2016–17 season, Boufal scored only one [[EFL Cup|League Cup]] goal and one [[Premier League]] goal; his strike in Saints' 26 October 2016 1–0 win over [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in the fourth round of the League Cup won Southampton's Goal of the Season award.{{cite web|title=Southampton 1 – 0 Sunderland |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/37700028|accessdate=21 October 2017|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 October 2016}}{{cite web|title=Boufal wins Goal of the Season|url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2017-05-06/video-sofiane-boufal-collects-goal-of-the-season-award|accessdate=21 October 2017 |publisher=Southampton F.C.|date=6 May 2017}} On 21 October 2017, Boufal scored a virtuoso 85th-minute goal{{cite news|first=Ben | last= Fisher| title=Sofiane Boufal wonder goal gives Southampton win against West Brom| url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/oct/21/southampton-west-bromwich-albion-premier-league-match-report |accessdate=21 October 2017|work=The Guardian |date=21 October 2017}} in a home tie against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] to lead his team to a 1–0 victory and send them into the top half of the Premier League. Having come on as a substitute in the 80th minute, he gained possession deep within his own half and took the ball past six opposing players before sending it past keeper [[Ben Foster (footballer)|Ben Foster]] from just inside the box.{{cite web |last1=Reddy| first1=Luke| title= Southampton 1 – 0 West Bromwich Albion |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41618804|publisher=BBC Sport |accessdate=22 October 2017|date=21 October 2017}} This goal was voted the 2017–18 Premier League Goal of the Season. ===Celta Vigo=== In July 2018, Boufal joined [[La Liga]] side Celta Vigo on loan for the 2018–19 campaign.{{cite web|title=Boufal set to join Celta Vigo on loan|url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2018-07-20/sofiane-boufal-southampton-celta-vigo-loan-announcement|accessdate=20 July 2018|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 July 2018}} ==International career== Boufal made his debut for the [[Morocco national football team|Moroccan first team]] on 26 March 2016 starting in a 1–0 [[2017 Africa Cup of Nations qualification|African Cup of Nations qualification]] victory against [[Cape Verde national football team|Cape Verde]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2016/03/26/africa/africa-cup-of-nations-qualification/cape-verde-islands/morocco/2038224/|title=Cape Verde Islands vs. Morocco - 25 March 2016 |publisher=soccerway.com|accessdate=29 March 2016}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|27 January 2019}}{{cite web|title=S. Excelsior|Excelsior]] (loan) | caps2 = 34 | goals2 = 2 | years3 = 2015– | clubs3 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps3 = 38 | goals3 = 1 | years4 = 2017–2018 | clubs4 = → [[Club Brugge KV|Club Brugge]] (loan) | caps4 = 17 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = → [[Feyenoord]] (loan) | caps5 = 11 | goals5 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2008–2009 | nationalteam1 = Netherlands U18 | nationalcaps1 = 3 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2009–2010 | nationalteam2 = [[Netherlands national under-19 football team|Netherlands U19]] | nationalcaps2 = 12 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2010–2013 | nationalteam3 = [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] | nationalcaps3 = 12 | nationalgoals3 = 1 | nationalyears4 = 2012– | nationalteam4 = [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]] | nationalcaps4 = 17 | nationalgoals4 = 0 | pcupdate = 24 November 2018 | ntupdate = 9 November 2016 }}
'''Jordy Clasie''' ({{IPA-nl|ˈjɔrdi ˈklaːsi}}; born 27 June 1991) is a [[Dutch people|Dutch]] [[Association football|footballer]] who currently plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Feyenoord]], on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]], and for the [[Netherlands national football team|Dutch national team]].
{{TOClimit|3}}
==Club career== ===Early career=== Clasie arrived at the youth [[Feyenoord Academy (Varkenoord)]] as a 9-year-old in the summer of 2000 and progressed through the ranks to the Feyenoord / Excelsior U19s. In the summer of 2010 the Haarlem-born youngster went out on loan to [[S.B.V. Excelsior|Excelsior]].<ref name="Bio">{{cite web|title=Jordy Clasie|url=http://www.feyenoord.com/feyenoord-1/selection/jordy-clasie|website=Feyenoord|accessdate=15 July 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140714143651/http://www.feyenoord.com/feyenoord-1/selection/jordy-clasie|archivedate=14 July 2014|df=}}</ref> Clasie made his professional debut for Excelsior on 15 August 2010, when he was part of the starting line-up in the [[Rotterdam derby]] victory against [[Feyenoord]] (3–2).
===Feyenoord=== [[File:Jordy Clasie.jpg|thumb|left|x280px|Clasie after a [[Feyenoord]] match in 2012]] Clasie was brought into the first-team squad at [[Feyenoord]] at the start of the [[2011–12 Feyenoord season|2011/2012 season]] and incoming coach [[Ronald Koeman]] immediately handed the youngster a place in the starting line-up.<ref name="Bio" /> On 31 July 2011 he made his debut for [[Feyenoord]] in a friendly game against [[Málaga CF|Málaga]]. Because of his good play and his tenacity he soon became one of the most popular players among the supporters.<ref>{{cite news |title=Excelsior – Feyenoord (15-08-2010) |url=http://www.vi.nl/Wedstrijden/Wedstrijd.htm?dbid=210975&typeofpage=84140 |newspaper=VI |language=Dutch |trans-title=|date=15 August 2010 |accessdate=15 August 2010}}</ref>
On 29 August 2014, a day after Clasie helped [[Feyenoord]] qualify for the group stage of the [[2014–15 UEFA Europa League|UEFA Europa League]], Clasie agreed to extend his contract until 2018.<ref name="feyenoord1">[http://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/jordy-clasie-tekent-bij-tot-2018 'Jordy Clasie tekent bij tot 2018']. Retrieved from wwww.feyenoord.nl on 29 August 2014.</ref> Clasie explained the decision that he was keen on developing himself as a player within the team as well as developing together with the team as a whole.<ref name="feyenoord1"/>
===Southampton=== However, on 15 July 2015, Clasie signed for [[Southampton F.C|Southampton]] on a five-year deal for a fee in the region of £8 million. This meant he would once again link up with [[Ronald Koeman]] who brought him into the Feyenoord first-team.<ref>{{cite web|title=Jordy Clasie: Southampton sign Dutch midfielder|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/33545453|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 July 2015|accessdate=15 July 2015}}</ref>
In the summer of 2016, Frenchman [[Claude Puel]] took over at the helm of Southampton. Clasie then scored his first goal for the club on 30 November 2016, in a 2–0 win over [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]] in the [[EFL Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/38073806 |title=Arsenal 0–2 Southampton |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 November 2016 |accessdate=1 December 2016 }}</ref> Clasie's creativity was instrumental in Southampton getting to the [[2016-17 EFL Cup|League Cup final of 2017]] where the Saints eventually emerged as runners up.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/14964044.Jordy_Clasie_says_he_doesn_t_feel_like_an_established_Premier_League_player_yet_but_has_set_a_new_ambitious_target/?ref=rl&lp=3|title=Jordy Clause: Feature|work =Daily Echo}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/sport/southamptons-route-efl-cup-final-9902344.amp|title=Southampton's route to the EFL Cup final|work=Daily Mirror}}</ref><ref name=EFL>{{cite web|url=http://m.bbc.com/sport/football/39018813|title=Manchester United 3–2 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
He scored his first [[Premier League]] goal on 8 April 2017 in a 1–0 victory at [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://m.bbc.com/sport/football/39464041|title=West Brom 0–1 Southampton|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref>
===Club Brugge=== On 30 August 2017, Clasie joined [[Club Brugge KV|Club Brugge]] on loan for the duration of the 2017–18 season.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2017-08-30/jordy-clasie-club-brugge-southampton-loan-announcement|title=Clasie joins Club Brugge on loan|publisher=Southampton F.C.|date=30 August 2017|accessdate=30 August 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Jordy Clasie: Southampton midfielder joins Club Brugge on loan|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41102415|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=30 August 2017|date=30 August 2017}}</ref>
===Feyenoord=== On 25 July 2018, the midfielder rejoined Feyenoord on loan for the duration of the 2018–19 season.<ref>{{cite web|title=Clasie completes Feyenoord loan switch|url=https://southamptonfc.com/news/2018-07-25/jordy-clasie-southampton-feyenoord-loan-announcementd|publisher=Southampton FC|accessdate=25 July 2018|date=25 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Ras-Feyenoorder Jordy Clasie keert terug in de Kuip|url=https://www.feyenoord.nl/nieuws/nieuwsoverzicht/ras-feyenoorder-jordy-clasie-keert-terug-in-de-kuip|publisher=Feyenoord|language=Dutch|accessdate=25 July 2018|date=25 July 2018}}</ref>
==International career== In November 2010, two months after his debut for [[S.B.V. Excelsior|Excelsior]], he was selected for the [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21 squad]]. In February 2012, Bert van Marwijk, the coach of the first team of the [[Netherlands national football team|Netherlands]], pronounced his interest in Clasie. He was made aware that his name was on the stand-by list for [[UEFA Euro 2012|Euro 2012]].
Clasie was part of [[Louis van Gaal]]'s 23-man squad for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]] in Brazil where the Dutch finished third beating the likes of defending champions [[Spain national football team|Spain]] and hosts [[Brazil national football team|Brazil]]. He made two appearances in the tournament, coming on as a substitute for [[Nigel de Jong]] in the semi-finals against [[Argentina]] and started the third place game against the hosts which the Dutch won 3–0 comfortably.<ref name=WC />

==Playing style== As a combative midfielder with an eye for goal, Clasie's style of play has earned him the label of the "Dutch [[Xavi]]".<ref>{{cite news |title=The ‘Dutch Xavi’ Jordy Clasie – from 'physically too weak’ to Euro 2012 candidate within six months |url=http://www.goal.com/en/news/1717/editorial/2012/02/12/2898420/the-dutch-xavi-jordy-clasie-from-physically-too-weak-to-euro |newspaper=Goal.Com |trans-title=|date=12 February 2011 |accessdate=31 July 2012}}</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = Guido Carrillo | image = Guido Carillo Estudiantes de la Plata starting XI against Penarol 22102014.jpg | image_size = | caption = | fullname = Guido Marcelo Carrillo<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/news/612828 |title=Updated squads for 2017/18 Premier League confirmed |publisher=Premier League |date=2 February 2018 |accessdate=15 February 2018}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1991|5|25|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Magdalena, Buenos Aires|Magdalena]], Argentina | height = 1.88 m | position = [[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] | currentclub =[[CD Leganés|Leganés]] (on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]]) | clubnumber = 9 | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes]] | years1 = 2011–2015 | clubs1 = [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes]] | caps1 = 118 | goals1 = 28 | years2 = 2015–2016 | clubs2 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco B]] | caps2 = 1 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015–2018 | clubs3 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] | caps3 = 65 | goals3 = 15 | years4 = 2018– | clubs4 = [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] | caps4 = 7 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2018– | clubs5 = → [[CD Leganés|Leganés]] (loan) | caps5 = 22 | goals5 = 5 | nationalyears1 = | nationalcaps1 = | nationalgoals1 = | nationalteam1 = | club-update = 15:15, 11 March 2019 (UTC) | ntupdate = }} '''Guido Marcelo Carrillo''' (born 25 May 1991) is an Argentine professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] for [[CD Leganés|Leganés]] on loan from [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]].
==Club career== ===Estudiantes=== Carrillo played for [[Estudiantes de La Plata|Estudiantes]] for most of his early professional career. He was a fan favorite at the [[Estadio Ciudad de La Plata]], having graduated through the youth academy and making his first-team debut in 2011.{{Citation needed|date=August 2017}} In February 2015, Estudiantes beat [[Barcelona Sporting Club|Barcelona Guayaquil]] 2–0 in their [[Libertadores Cup]] opener, played at La Plata “Único” stadium. Guido Carrillo scored three times for the “Pincha”, giving Estudiantes their first three points in the tournament.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.buenosairesherald.com/article/182931/carrillo-hattrick-gives-estudiantes-win|publisher=www.buenosairesherald.com|title=Carrillo hat-trick gives Estudiantes win|date=25 February 2015}}</ref>
In April and May 2015, interest from Greek club [[Olympiacos F.C.|Olympiacos]], Portuguese side [[S.L. Benfica|Benfica]], and [[Inter Milan|Inter]] was reported.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sdna.gr/gr/news-in-english/arthro-news-in-english/29924/carillo-and-guerrero-in-olympiakos-shortlist/|publisher=www.sdna.gr|title=Carillo and Guerrero in Olympiakos shortlist|date=15 April 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sdna.gr/gr/news-in-english/arthro-news-in-english/33901/olympiakos-hopeful-of-carrillo-deal/|publisher=www.sdna.gr|title=Olympiakos hopeful of Carrillo deal|date=2 May 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.sdna.gr/gr/news-in-english/arthro-news-in-english/40128/inter-set-to-finalize-deal-for-carillo/|publisher=sdna.gr|title=Inter set to finalize deal for Carillo|date=27 May 2015}}</ref>
===Monaco=== On 3 July 2015, [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] announced the signing of Carrillo on a five-year contract.<ref>{{cite news|title=Monaco sign Guido Carrillo from Estudiantes|url=http://www.espnfc.com/story/2512246/monaco-sign-guido-carrillo-from-estudiantes|accessdate=30 August 2017|work=ESPN FC|date=3 July 2015}}</ref> His former club Estudiantes had previously stated it had agreed a $10 million transfer offer (about €8.8 million).<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/Actualites/L-attaquant-argentin-guido-carrillo-arrive-a-monaco-pour-8-8-millions-d-euros/568203|publisher=www.lequipe.fr|title=L'attaquant argentin Guido Carrillo arrive à Monaco pour 8,8 millions d'euros|date=20 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.planete-asm.fr/actualite/17432-officiel-guido-carrillo-estudiantes-va-signer-a-monaco.html|publisher=www.planete-asm.fr|title=Officiel : Guido Carrillo (Estudiantes) va signer à Monaco|date=20 June 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/as-monaco/story/2499536/monaco-agree-a-deal-to-sign-guido-carrillo-of-estudiantes|publisher=www.espnfc.com|title=Monaco agree a deal to sign Estudiantes striker Guido Carrillo|date=20 June 2015}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club in a 3–1 away win over [[BSC Young Boys]] in the [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round|third qualifying round]] of [[2015–16 UEFA Champions League|the season's]] Champions League.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/young-boys-vs-monaco/348008|title=Young Boys 1-3 Monaco|publisher=Sky Sports |date=28 July 2015 |accessdate=4 January 2016 }}</ref>
===Southampton === On 25 January 2018, Carrillo joined [[Premier League]] side [[Southampton F.C.|Southampton]] for a fee reported to be in the region of £19 million on a three-and-a-half-year deal.<ref>{{cite news|title=Guido Carillo:Southampton sign Monaco striker for reported £19m|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42826326|accessdate=25 January 2018|work=BBC Sport|date=25 January 2018}}</ref> He made his first appearance on 27 January as an 80th-minute substitute in a 1–0 victory over [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] in the [[FA Cup]].<ref>{{cite news |last1=O'Keeffe| first1=Greg| title=Southampton 1–0 Watford| url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42756109 |accessdate=7 February 2018|publisher=BBC Sport| date=27 January 2018}}</ref>
On 8 July 2018, Carillo rejoined former manager [[Mauricio Pellegrino]], when he joined [[CD Leganés]] on a season-long loan.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Howard |first1=Peter |title=Guido Carrillo leaves Southampton on loan |url=http://www.dailyecho.co.uk/sport/16340504.guido-carrillo-leaves-southampton-on-loan/ |accessdate=8 July 2018 |work=Daily Excho |date=8 July 2018 |location=Southampton}}</ref>
